description: A rich wine, full of delicious fruit as well as a yeasty, toasty character. It has a nervy, mineral edge but that's much less dominant than the ripe pink grapefruit and lime fruit.
title: J. de Telmont 2004 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Intensely mineral, structured wine, with a taut character. There is great acidity here, with green apple and citrus flavors. It's a dry, food-friendly wine.
title: Ayala 2004 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A fruity style, full of soft grapefruit, touches of citrus and apple. Under the fruit, there is a more yeasty character, adding richness. It could well be even better if aged for several years.
title: Pommery 2004 Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: A gloriously rich Rosé that is full of ripe raspberries that burst in the mouth. It has a tight texture, balanced by a rounded feel. It is still young, of course, and the sweet finish needs time to integrate. Even so, relish the wine now, or wait 3-4 years.
title: Taittinger 2004 Comtes de Champagne Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This wine is on the dry side of Brut. It is rich, at the same time crisp with a delicious creamed pear and apple flavor, lifted even further by pineapple acidity. Congratulations to Philipponnat for indicating disgorgement date and even the dosage on the back label.
title: Philipponnat 2004 Grand Brut Blanc Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A great celebration of the fine 2004 vintage, this wine reveals both generosity and a steely resolve. It has a cool elegance as well, giving it a sense of refinement, while still preserving the Roederer richness. The tight acidity holds the wine together and promises long aging.
title: Louis Roederer 2004 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Exceptionally rich and dense, an exceptional wine that reveals itself in layers, from the first fruit attack to the mineral texture and the way it gradually fills the mouth. Selected from old vines, there is a great flavor in this wine, with the promise of many years' aging.
title: Louis Roederer 2004 Cristal Brut  (Champagne)

description: A beautiful orange pink-colored wine. Young and fresh, it has great depth of raspberry and red fruit flavors as well as a delicious summer fruit brightness and liveliness. A beautiful Champagne, that will repay some bottle aging.
title: Louis Roederer 2004 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: A wonderfully toasty, yeasty wine, with creamed apple fruits, flavors that show some softness but never deviate from a crisp, steely character. Although this wine is ready to drink, consider keeping for 3-4 years.
title: Taittinger 2004 Brut Millesimé  (Champagne)

description: Somehow this pure Chardonnay wine suffers from the Roederer preference for a higher dosage. With the Blanc de Blancs style, more minerality, something altogether more taut, would be better. That said, there is plenty to enjoy in this rich, full-bodied wine, with apricot as well as citrus flavors.
title: Louis Roederer 2004 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Warm and rich, even if still young, this is a rounded Champagne, full of ripe apple and spice, pink grapefruit, lined with intense acidity. Because it is still so young, it needs several years' aging.
title: Drappier 2004 Grande Sendrée Brut  (Champagne)

description: A lightly fresh-faced wine, with apple and grapefruit flavors balanced with a soft texture. It is easy, attractive, ready to drink.
title: Canard-Duchêne 2004 Brut Millesimé  (Champagne)

description: Impressive, but so young, this is a Pinot Noir-dominated vintage, the richness as yet a mere hint in the welter of acidity and fruit. Already, though, this is   shaping up to be a structured, tight wine, with great final balance.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2004 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Sweet, toasty wine, very ripe, full of yellow fruits, touched with almonds and bright white currants. The texture is rich, concentrated, a wine that could well age as it knits its rich fruit and acidity together.
title: Duval-Leroy 2004 Clos des Bouveries Brut  (Champagne)

description: With a sweet dosage, this is soft Blanc de Blancs. Pears, hints of apricots go with some crisp acidity. It still tastes young and needs time to integrate, but will always be on the sweet side of Brut.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2004 Chardonnay Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Now at its peak, this impressive wine has moved from fruit to maturity, adding toastiness to its acidity and giving the wine richness. It's full and ripe while keeping the taut, steely edge proper to a Chardonnay Champagne. There's no need to age further. Drink now.
designation: Belle Epoque Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Perrier Jouët 2004 Belle Epoque Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: From a great vintage, this Rosé is still young, still developing. But already the outlines are there with ripe strawberry and pink grapefruit along with a tight flinty texture. The wine needs time for the acidity to calm down-age for five years.
title: Louis Roederer 2004 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still very young, with the crispest of red currant fruits. There are almond and quince flavors to go with the raspberry juice acidity. At this stage, the dosage is not full integrated, showing an awkward final sweetness. Age for 4-5 years.
title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2004 Vintage Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Any vintage Champagne from 2004 will still be young, and this is no exception. But with the fresh, light Deutz style, this is already offering delicious green plum and citrus flavors, supplemented by creamy acidity. The finish is soft, light, creamy.
title: Deutz 2004 Brut  (Champagne)

description: Potentially this is a delicious, fresh but firm Chardonnay in the more delicate Deutz style. Potentially, because this is still young. Wait a couple of years for the mineral and ultra-fresh apple flavors to blend together.
title: Deutz 2004 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A Too young to drink now, this Chardonnay is very fresh, quite closed up and tight, the white stone fruit flavors only just showing above the intense acidity. Cellar it, because it's well made, a wine that just needs 3-4 years.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Brut
title: Mandois 2004 Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The style of Gimonnet Champagne brings out a beautiful floral character in Chardonnay. This young, fresh 2004 is, as its name suggests, dry and crisp and goes well with food. The flavors emphasize grapefruit and very crisp apple, with tight acidity.
designation: Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2004 Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: No doubt this is meant to be a slightly more serious attempt at sparkling wine, but it merely succeeds in being pleasant. Obvious citrus and earth aromas add hints of ginger on the palate. It's slightly creamy in texture, finishing clean and fresh.
title: Patriarche Pére et Fils 2004 Brut Chardonnay (Vin Mousseux)

description: This big, ripe wine is now past its youth. That is bringing out the toast, yeast and walnut flavors. But the acidity is not far away, coming from the taut texture, and leaving a crisp fresh, raspberry-flavored aftertaste.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2004 Tirage Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

description: This is a great, concentrated wine, which packs clean, almond, kiwi and apple flavors along with a creamy, rich mousse and delicious acidity. This is a wine that can age well-a 1996 was still fresh when tasted early in 2006. Imported by Louis Dressner Selections.
title: François Chidaine 2004  Montlouis-sur-Loire

description: Chenin Blanc makes delicious sparkling wine when the producer tames its high acidity. This wine has a fine, fresh, Gala apple flavor, crisp but not overpowering acidity, and a layer of almonds. Imported by Chicago Wine Merchant.
title: Château Moncontour 2004 Brut Tête de Cuvée  (Vouvray)

description: There's a serious side to this impressive wine, with its toast and biscuit flavors layered on top of apple acidity. It has richness as well as crispness, and a depth of flavor which promises some bottle aging potential. One of the best sparkling Vouvrays.
title: Château Moncontour 2004 Cuvée Prédilection  (Vouvray)

description: Not too dissimilar from an Italian Moscato d'Asti, this offers exotic scents of oranges and tropical fruit. It's a bit sweet, but balanced in part by the bubbles. This would be great at brunch, or served on its own.
title: Jaillance 2004 Grande Tradition  (Clairette de Die)

description: Egarade means a "mysterious evening stroll," according to the producer. Perhaps the idea is that you lose track of time in this wine. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, it is rich and full-bodied with a good weight of white and green fruits and a final nervy texture and acidity.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2005 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Ultra-crisp, an apple and pink grapefruit flavored wine that has a lively mousse, delicate mouthfeel and just mineral acidity. A deliciously refreshing wine.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2005 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A ripe, crisp, yellow- and white-fruit-flavored wine. It shows taut minerality, the flintiness you find in Chablis. The structure is dominant in what is still a young wine, but the fruit is all there. Worth aging for a year.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2005 Pur Chardonnay  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: The unpredictable character of Pinot Noir makes it hard to pull off a Blanc de Noirs. And this wine doesn't entirely succeed. Yes, the wine is in balance, red fruits working with acidity. But there is hardness in the finish, a cranberry juice tartness, which spoils the rest of the party.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2005 Pur Pinot Noir Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Only produced in the top years, this wine, named apparently after the Greek goddess of daylight, has just achieved maturity. It is rich in notes of almonds and toast that meld together with the ripe white fruits. It's a great wine that is impressive and ready to drink, although it will also easily age further.
title: 96pointsHenriot 2005 Cuvée Hemera Brut  (Champagne)Cellar Selection

description: Wonderfully mature, this complex wine has a pale color that is just showing some age. The richness has changed into a tighter character hinting at toast, with a mineral edge. It is ready to drink.
title: Joseph Perrier 2005 Esprit de Victoria Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: There are already indications of fine maturity in this wine. Yeast and toasty flavors mingle with the crisp acidity and ripe stewed apricots and apple to give richness. It also has the nervy acidity that is typical of Alfred Gratien Champagnes, which will allow the wine to age further.
title: Alfred Gratien 2005 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: Old vines and barrel fermentation have produced a singularly rich wine. Smooth, creamy and ripe with a predominance of Chardonnay, it has loads of yellow fruit reined in with plenty of acidity and crisp texture. Now just mature, it's ready to drink.
title: Jacques Picard 2005 Art de Vigne Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is one of a collection of Champagnes tasted and approved by a group of growers under the Special Club label. With a predominance of Chardonnay, it's still crisp and fruity, showing rich apple and pear flavors. Its citrusy acidity gives it lift, slowing any signs of maturity. It will continue to age gracefully but is delicious now.
title: Charlier & Fils 2005 Special Club Brut  (Champagne)

description: This Champagne is beautifully mature, its ripe fruit and soft texture magnified by toast and yeast. Rich and full bodied, its fine acidity keeps it in great condition. With a crisp aftertaste that gives it a delicious lift, it's ready to drink now.
title: Moët & Chandon 2005 Dom Pérignon Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This is ripe Chardonnay, maybe missing the more typical minerality but making up for it with the ripe apple and apricot fruits. The wine is now showing some good age while still retaining a fresh character. With its hints of almonds and vanilla, it balances fruit and maturity. Drink now.
title: Jean Laurent 2005 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A pale gold color leads into a wine that is mature and rich. The fruits have mellowed into almond and spice, with attractive acidity, while the ripe texture remains. The balance is just right in a wine that is generous and full in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Jean Laurent 2005 Blanc de Noirs Millésimé Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This wine is mature, ripe and perfectly ready to drink. With hints of toast mingling with minerality and tangy acidity, it is a balanced, delicious wine full of rich flavors. The acidity has softened while keeping the tension of pure Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. Drink now. Gonet uses this label for the American market.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Charles-Gilbert de Vindé 2005 Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Still young, this wine is showing structure and a dense texture as well as tight fruitiness. It's a blend of one-third of each of Champagne's principal grapes, giving good balance and intense acidity. The low dosage has made the wine dry without losing a ripe, full character. Drink from 2017.
title: Lelarge-Pugeot 2005 Millésime Premier Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: With some age, this is a gloriously ripe and toasty wine. It has a rich character emphasized by the round texture and the creamy mousse. It also has great concentration, bringing together acidity as well as dense secondary flavors. With its rich, mature character, it is best suited for food. It is ready to drink, but will hold well through 2025.
title: Moët & Chandon 2005 Dom Pérignon Brut  (Champagne)

description: With 49% Chardonnay and 51% Pinot Noir from grand cru vineyards, this well-balanced wine is just coming into its best years. Crisp and dry, following the Lanson style of no malolactic fermentation, the wine is full of white fruits, citrus and hints of toast, based around a tangy, mineral texture. Drink now and until 2025.
title: Lanson 2005 Gold Label Brut Vintage  (Champagne)

description: A shallot-skin-colored wine, this has ripe red berry fruits and a soft texture. It is attractively on the way to maturity, with hints of toast coming through the acidity and rounded character at the end. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Joseph Perrier 2005 Brut Rosé Vintage  (Champagne)

description: A soft style of Blanc de Blancs, rounded as much as crisp, this is an attractively ripe and fruity wine. Apple and grapefruit flavors are filled out with perfumed acidity and a lively, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Chassenay d'Arce 2005 Blanc de Blancs Millésimé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This well-balanced wine is both rich and tightly fresh and crisp. It's aromatic from the steely Chardonnay that treads a fine line between generous fruit and great minerality. The wine is just reaching its peak with touches of toast beginning to develop. Drink now through 2019.
title: Charles Ellner 2005 Brut Prestige  (Champagne)

description: The palest of Rosés, this crisp, bright and fruity wine is full of tight acidity, freshly picked raspberries and steely acidity. It could age a few more years to bring out a toastier character. The specially designed bottle has a hummingbird etched on the inside and gold on the outside.
title: Perrier Jouët 2005 Belle Epoque Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This is just showing hints of maturing. For now, the texture is tangy, zesty with a bite of minerality from the chalk soil of the Chardonnay vineyards. It will develop further in bottle, giving a crisp Champagne with a delicious bite at the end.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Millesimé Brut
title: Drappier 2005 Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Millesimé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Still very young, this holds great potential. Rich, full-bodied and densely structured, it is a wine first, sparkling second. Ripe apple and peach flavors partner with a strongly mineral texture. It needs to age more in bottle, so drink from 2016.
title: Charles Heidsieck 2005 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: Now reaching its peak, this vintage of Ayala's top quality prestige Cuvée is ripe, full-bodied and rounded. It has the hallmark dryness of the house although it has been softened by aging and given elegance and style. It's totally ready to drink.
title: Ayala 2005 Cuvée Perle d'Ayala Millesimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Goutorbe is a member of the Spécial Club grouping of grower producers, which tastes and approves each other's special Cuvée. This 2005, with its ripe fruits and the beginnings of bottle age, is a worthy member. It has delicious apple and white peach fruits, lively acidity and a texture that is moving towards toastiness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Henri Goutorbe 2005 Spécial Club Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: With just a touch of bottle age giving a toasty character, this impressive wine is already showing some maturity. That said, the apple and citrus character, the mineral tight texture and crisp acidity promise some aging. The wine conveys a sense of elegance, intensity and richness. Drink now, but the wine will also age.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2005 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A beautifully balanced wine that exudes elegance as well as richness. It is drier than previous vintages of Cristal Rosé, yielding a bright, crisp and layered wine. Red fruits are married with orange zest and tight acidity. It can be drunk now, but it is a young wine and will certainly age well through 2022.
title: Louis Roederer 2005 Cristal Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Fermented in 225-liter barrels, this is a rich, full-flavored wine touched with hints of toast and brisk acidity. The palate is weighty, but there's a crisp, dry fruit quality on the palate. Still youthful, it's not quite integrated yet, so keep until 2016.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2005 Cuvée 225 Millesimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a rich, full-bodied Champagne, with hints of toast and wood flavors, balanced with a citrus acidity. There's a warm feel to this complex wine that will certainly age well.
title: H. Blin 2005 Millésime  (Champagne)

description: Pale pink in color, this is a full, fruity wine that's aromatic in character. The red fruits are topped with citrus and bright acidity, as well as signs of maturity, giving a toasty character. The wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Chanoine 2005 Tsarine Millésime Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: While full and ripe in style, this wine is also quite dry. It's packed with crisp, youthful fruits, along with an intensely mineral texture that penetrates deep on the palate. Apple and lime juice pierce through the finish. Drink through 2021.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2005 Cuvée Spéciale Brut Millesimé  (Champagne)

description: This is a soft wine that has a cotton-candy sweetness. It's fruity with strong strawberry flavor and only a light touch of acidity.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2005 Palmes d'Or Vintage Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: A pure, clean mineral-driven Champagne. It's very crisp, with a chalky texture, flavors of green apples and tight acidity. It's one of those Champagnes that needs time in the glass, because as it opens the flavors become more complex, bringing out yellow fruits as well as the underlying citrus.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2005 Extra Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: An attractively ripe and mature wine with a great balance between the orangy citrus fruits and a tight, taut, mineral texture. The wine is rich in its dosage and fruitiness while showing signs of maturer toast and almond flavors. However, it could still age.
title: Duval-Leroy 2005 Clos des Bouveries Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: From one of Champagne's less ageworthy vintages, this is already deliciously drinkable. It has fine acidity that cuts through the mineral texture, shaping the rounded fruitiness. It's dry and crisp at the end. Drink now and over the next 4-5 years.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2005 Noble Vintage  Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: A soft, rich wine with delicious flavors of pear and red apples, lifted by pineapple acidity. It is ripe, but still young, with touches of yeast and almond. It will age well over the medium-term.
title: Duval-Leroy 2005 Blanc de Blancs Brut Millesimé Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The iconic Roederer Champagne, Cristal's latest release, brings a perfect balance of richness and age worthiness. It is full of apple flavor, and the mousse is very fine and almost imperceptible. As so often with a beautifully blended wine like this, a few minutes breathing brings out extra complex flavors. It certainly should age over five years and more.
title: Louis Roederer 2005 Cristal Brut  (Champagne)

description: The extra age on this bone-dry wine has paid off, as the taut character of a young wine has been tempered with toast, creating a round feeling. It is perfectly in harmony now, beautiful and crisp.
designation: Oenophile Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2005 Oenophile Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The Spécial Club is a grouping of Champagne producers who taste each other's wines before allowing them to be released under this label. With its pure expression of mineral-driven, tense Chardonnay, this is made in a dry style. It's fragrant, fruity and ready to age for several years.
designation: Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2005 Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: While 2005 is not a great vintage in Champagne, in the right hands, as here, it can produce some fine wines. This is beautifully balanced, a contrast between soft fruit and a touch of maturity. It is not a wine for long aging, and will be completely ready in a year.
title: Gaston Chiquet 2005 Spécial Club Brut  (Champagne)

description: One of Aubry's two Champagnes from relatively rare grape varieties, this is a full-throated wine, replete with ripe fruit. Full bodied and rich, it has weight and intensity. Its yellow fruit is laced with complex acidity from citrus.
title: Aubry 2005 Le Nombre d'Or Brut  (Champagne)

description: While the style is soft, full of yellow fruit richness, the wine also show an excellent concentrated texture. The fresh fruit is integrated into this more complex style. The aftertaste shows some softness, but the wine can certainly age for several years.
title: Lallier 2005 Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Full-bodied Champagne that feels rich with its pear and apricot juice flavors. It has weight, an apple skin texture and a soft, creamy aftertaste. It would be worth aging for a few more years.
title: Louis Barthélémy 2005 Brut Saphir  (Champagne)

description: A blend from all the top vineyards owned by the Gimonnet family, with a high proportion of Grand Cru. It has power and concentration as well as great ripeness. Very full-bodied, with a low dosage, this is dry, the richness coming from the fruit.
designation: Fleuron Brut Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2005 Fleuron Brut Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The top Cuvée from this fine cooperative is rich, dominated by Pinot Noir to give a full-bodied feel. Fruit flavors of ripe apple and pink grapefruit give sophistication, along with toast and yeast. Worth aging for 4-5 years, but delicious now.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2005 L'Air Brut  (Champagne)

description: A deceptively soft Champagne. The initial attack is rounded with a delicious pear flavor, but definitely soft. Then tight mineral acidity adds its presence, producing a wine that is also very fresh, apple crisp, with a potential for aging and a long lingering aftertaste.
title: Louis Roederer 2005 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Smooth, creamy wine, showing some good, rich, white fruits. It is soft, with ripe apple and lime juice flavors and vivid and balanced acidity. Attractive, ready-to-drink Champagne.
title: Charles de Cazanove 2005 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still young, this round and textured Champagne has great apple and citrus flavors. It is tightly drawn with a great line of acidity, some toast and the purest light final touch of fruit. Age for 4-5 years and more.
title: Vollereaux 2005 Brut Cuvée Tradition  (Champagne)

description: There is some bitterness to this wine, with almond and quince flavors. Caramel and soft fruitiness lead to a more creamy character. Not for aging.
title: Heidsieck & Co Monopole 2005 Gold Top Brut  (Champagne)

description: A superbly rich and creamy wine, powered by ripe Pinot Noir, with elegance and élan. The wine is concentrated, powerful, packed with intense white fruit flavors and citrus. For aging.
title: Louis Roederer 2005 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a crisp, high-wire-walking wine, just so poised. Its youthful red fruits, laced with citrus, taste so fresh, with a strawberry bite. At this stage, it is intensely enjoyable as young Champagne, but it does need to age for several years.
title: Louis Roederer 2005 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Literally timeless, L'Intemporelle is an elegant, almost discreet style. It downplays the rich fruit to present a stylish wine, with citrus highlights over ripe yellow fruit. This 2005 is still young; age for 3-4 years.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2005 L'Intemporelle Brut  (Champagne)

description: To age an extra brut vintage before release is a great idea. It leaves a wine that hints at toasty aromas as well as still-crisp fruitiness. The apple and pear flavors are filled out by the tangy edge and the hints of maturity to come. Drink this fine vintage now.
designation: Le Vintage Premier Cru Extra Brut
title: J. Dumangin Fils 2005 Le Vintage Premier Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: Les Meslaines is the name of the parcel of Pinot Noir that produces this Blanc de Noirs. It has richness, a ripe character with fresh apricot flavors, a Champagne that has the weight of a wine. It could do with bottle age, but for freshness drink now.
title: Lamiable 2005 Les Meslaines Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: It's a shame to release this wine so young, because its constituents are individually impressive. It will need a few years for the acidity to come together with the ripe melon and grapefruit flavors, the soft texture and the bright vivid character.
title: Deutz 2005 Brut  (Champagne)

description: Following the elegant Deutz tradition, this wine has a character that is light as a feather, but still anchored into vivid red fruits and tight acidity, leavened by a softness. The final taste is soft, but well integrated.
title: Deutz 2005 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: A pretty and remarkably drinkable sparkler with soft green apple, tangerine oil and faint yellow floral notes accented with hints of lavender. There's medium carbonation and weight in the mouth, and pear and apple flavors abound with suggestions of honeydew in the finish. Drink now.
title: Saint-Hilaire 2005 Brut Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: This is a crisp, dry sparkler with notes of red apple, carnation and cereal followed by flavors of peach pit and lime acidity in the highly carbonated mouth. Ends on a smooth, bright citrus-inflused finish.
title: Saint-Hilaire 2005 Blanc de Blancs Extra Dry Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: Hints of sherry and nuttiness come through on the nose, along with notes of ripe Granny Smith apple and citrus resin. The mouth shows a bit more ripeness by way of sweet nectarine slices and tangerine citrus. The moderate acidity keeps the sweetness from going over the top.
title: Saint-Hilaire 2005 Semi-Sweet Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: A fine, clean and intense sparkling wine, with excellent acidity and bright lemon and apple notes.
title: Domaine Huët 2005 Pétillant  (Vouvray)

description: One of the best sparkling Vouvrays, this 2005 vintage has an extra richness from the year. It has the mineral, chalky edge of Chenin Blanc, but this is rounded out with pear, white peach and sweet almond flavors. Good to drink now, but also worth aging for 2-3 years.
title: Château Moncontour 2005 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: A balanced, ripe wine, packed with pear skins, green apples and cream. It is delicate, with its acidity acting as a fresh, clean blast through the bubbles. Ends with that same freshness.
title: Château Moncontour 2005 Tête de Cuvée  (Vouvray)

description: This is a serious wine that shows great quality, structure and dense flavors. Packed with apple, citrus and hints of toastiness, it is rich, steely and ageworthy. The finish brings both freshness and a good depth of flavor. Drink now-2020.
title: JCB 2006 No 39 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This low-production wine comes from a small Chardonnay vineyard in the Côte des Blancs. It shows the beauty of mature Chardonnay, with the minerality totally subsumed by the richness and elegance of the texture. It's ready to drink now.
title: Thiénot 2006 Vigne aux Gamins Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Named after the founder of the house, Nicolas François Billecart (who married Elisabeth Salmon), this wine is now at its peak. It is poised between fresh apple fruits and broader, riper maturity. This balance gives a ripe wine hinting at toast and almonds while still with a dry aftertaste. Drink now, although in 2019 it will be even better.
title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Nicolas François Brut  (Champagne)

description: With grapes coming from the Chardonnay heartland of the Côte des Blancs, this wine is the epitome of structured, textured fruit but with the essential addition of age. Still hinting at freshness and still textured, the wine is also rich with white-fruit flavors cut with limes. Drink from 2020.
designation: Cuvée Louis Brut Blanc de Blancs
title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Louis Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This ripe opulent wine has rich white fruits and a warm, rounded texture. It's very much in the rich Ruinart style, made extra special by the maturity of the wine. There is still a mineral texture to the wine but the fruit has become toasty and rich. Drink now.
title: Ruinart 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This crisp, textured wine still offers great freshness. Its acidity and taut white fruits are zesty, hinting at toastiness and with a fine texture. It is an elegant wine, ready to drink.
title: Jean Laurent 2006 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This producer with vines in the Aube has made a specialty of pure Pinot Noir Champagnes. Rich yet dry, this wine is full of generous white fruits cut with toastiness. Now mature, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean Laurent 2006 Millésime Brut Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Now mature, this wine is rich and stylish. As it matures, it has developed a ripe yeast and toast character along with a beautiful patina of intense spice, and minerality along with great complexity. The wine is fully ready, a great experience to drink now.
title: Henriot 2006 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is the latest release of this legendary wine. A blend, although with a majority of Pinot Noir (Churchill's preference), the wine is rich, just beginning to show wonderful signs of maturity. It still has intense fruit along with the taut mineral texture that will allow the wine to age further. It is a standout Champagne from this vintage. Drink now, although this Champagne will age for many years.
title: Pol Roger 2006 Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still very crisp and fruity with only a hint of maturity, this is a bright, apple- and citrus-driven wine. Light and stylish, it gets its generous minerality from the Chardonnay in the blend. While it's great now, it will be even better from 2018.
title: Deutz 2006 Amour de Deutz Brut  (Champagne)

description: The second of two prestige Cuvées from Deutz, this shows its high proportion of Pinot Noir with its full-bodied nature. Already mature, it has broadened into a richly complex, toasty, spicy wine. With full-throttle acidity that gives it a taut edge, it's impressive and ready to drink.
title: Deutz 2006 Cuvée William Deutz  (Champagne)

description: This Champagne is produced for the Bordeaux Rothschild families to serve at events in their chateaus (Mouton, Lafite, Clarke). It is a beautiful wine that manages to be both rich and tightly textured with minerality, crisp apple flavor and a hint of toast balances all elements so well. A limited amount is available outside the family circuit. Drink now.
title: Barons de Rothschild 2006 Blanc de Blancs Vintage Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This rich, opulent prestige Cuvée lives up to the Séduction name, instantly appealing with its ripe yellow fruit and generous texture. It is just approaching maturity, with hints of toast. Drink now or, even better, from 2017.
title: Charles Ellner 2006 Séduction Brut  (Champagne)

description: This crisp, dry style of Champagne with its tightly wound texture and acidity is deliciously balanced, showing just the hint of toasty maturity that lies behind the apple and citrus fruits. Relying on ripe fruit for its richness, the wine is on the cusp of drinkability. Ideally wait until 2017.
title: Pannier 2006 Egérie Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: The prestige Cuvée from this producer, this has richness and a dense texture that brings out the ripe fruits. From a good, if not great, vintage, it is beautifully balanced, still young to taste and likely to age well. Drink now for the fruit or wait until 2018 for more maturity.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2006 Palmes d'Or Brut  (Champagne)

description: Paillard's crispest Chardonnay comes mainly from the Côte des Blancs. Offering great white fruit and bright apple flavors, this wine is also textured and mineral. It is beginning to mature, suggesting a touch of toastiness while the fruit remains. It finishes dry. Drink the wine now.
title: Bruno Paillard 2006 Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: Produced from Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this balances ripe red berry and citrus fruits with more mature spice and vanilla. With this development has come depth, concentration and richness. It is a wine to drink with food, ripe and finishing with crisp, dry acidity.
title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Elisabeth Salmon Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This Champagne is produced from a small parcel of Chardonnay in the heart of the city of Reims above the Lanson cellars. It has more than rarity value with its wonderful mature flavors, richness and flavors of vanilla, baked apple and hints of the wood in which the wine fermented. It is ready to drink now.
designation: Clos Lanson Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Lanson 2006 Clos Lanson Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The good 2006 vintage has produced this well-balanced wine that is now showing delicious signs of maturity. The initial fruit has gone, replaced by toast, spice and grilled almonds. At the same time, the acidity and taut mineral texture are still in play, giving a wine that is lively and just ready to drink now.
title: Besserat de Bellefon 2006 Cuvée des Moines Brut Millésime  (Champagne)

description: Feuillatte has taken great advantage of the very good 2006 vintage with this wine. It is crisp, now maturing well, hinting at toast while still with lively white fruit and citrus flavors. It is at a good point to drink, although it will certainly age until 2022.
designation: Grand Cru Millésimé Chardonnay Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2006 Grand Cru Millésimé Chardonnay Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Named after the French king who first said that Champagne had to be bottled (thereby allowing the bubbles to be retained), this dry Rosé is rich, beginning to mature and full of ripe red fruits. Hints of toast and almonds add an extra dimension to the wine's complexity. It is ready to drink.
title: De Venoge 2006 Louis XV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: In its distinctive carafe-shaped bottle, this Champagne commemorates the French king who first said that Champagne had to be bottled (so the bubbles would not disappear). It is dominated by Chardonnay, giving a chalky, mineral texture to this ripe wine. While the fruit is still deliciously fresh, the wine is just beginning to add toast flavors to its repertoire. Drink now, or better from 2017.
title: De Venoge 2006 Louis XV Brut  (Champagne)

description: From a good vintage, this wine with its blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay has a pale gold color and attractive maturity. The initial fruitiness has given way to a mineral-textured wine with a touch of almonds, spice and a rich character. It is ready to drink.
title: Chassenay d'Arce 2006 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: Based in the Côte des Blancs, Nicolas Feuillatte has access to some fine Chardonnay for this mineral-textured wine. Lightly perfumed with white flowers, it is crisp and fresh, with sliced apple and lemon right up front. The wine is fruity now and will age well. Either drink now or wait for more maturity from 2017.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Deep pink in color, this is a ripe wine, now ready to drink. An edge of tannin, from the addition of red wine to give color, as well as layers of red fruits and acidity, make for a structured wine. Drink this rich, dense wine now.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2006 Palmes d'Or Vintage Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: With its creamy texture and ripe apple fruits, this is a rich, rounded style. It is certainly fresh while also having yellow and white stone fruit flavors cut by acidity and citrus. Coming from the southern Côte de Bar, this is an open fruity Champagne that still has plenty of the proper steely aftertaste. At nine years, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Chassenay d'Arce 2006 Blanc de Blanc Millesimé Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced only from Grand Cru vineyards on the north side of the Montagne de Reims (with some Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs), this wine is beautifully balanced. It is rich and creamy, with just a zing of mineral acidity to give extra freshness. It is just now ready to drink, still fresh although with touches of toast at the end.
designation: Face Nord Millésime Grand Cru Brut
title: Pehu-Simonet 2006 Face Nord Millésime Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: The top wine from Mailly, this is rich with a good balance between its fresh white fruits streaked with lemon and its tight texture. Together, these two aspects hold the wine poised and coiled, a tight wine that is now just at maturity. Drink now and until 2022.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2006 Les Echansons Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Veuve Clicquot's prestige Cuvée is named after the widow Clicquot, the great lady who built up the house in the early 19th century. This latest incarnation is just showing signs of ripe toasty maturity. It is rich and soft with a high dosage, in the house style, with a full panoply of lime, red apple and apricot. Drink now and until 2022.
title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2006 La Grande Dame Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a dry style of wine, with great acidity and a tightly wrought texture. As with many Gosset Champagnes, this wine has had no malolactic fermentation, enhancing the freshness and crispness as well as the structure. Full of lemon zest, crisp grapefruit and delicious acidity, it will still age for many years. Drink from 2017.
title: Gosset 2006 Grand Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: The lively mousse carries this sophisticated wine, which is the perfect partner to the Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs. Everything is in its place, well integrated and with great precision. This trends to the sweeter side of Brut but with bottle age this has brought fine secondary flavors that are ripe and rich. The wine will age further, drink until 2020.
title: Taittinger 2006 Comtes de Champagne Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Billecart-Salmon's style is dry, so an Extra Brut will be almost bone-dry. This wine is crisp and tight, bringing out grapefruit and citrus flavors and a steely, mineral character. It is still young, with freshness dominant, and needs to mature to blossom into a very fine Champagne. Drink from 2018.
title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Vintage Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: It is the balance that stars with this wine. The fruit, acidity and mineral texture are held together in maturing harmony. Still young, the wine is still in the fruity spectrum and yet is very ready to drink now. The acidity and the link between the soft dosage and freshness are all in place. Drink now and until 2026.
title: Pol Roger 2006 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Taittinger's prestige Cuvée epitomizes the Chardonnay predilection of this producer. This now-mature bottling is elegant and very stylish. Toast and a soft texture combine with great complexity to reveal a wine that is poised and ready to drink. But with the acidity in the background, it could still age, so drink now and until 2022.
designation: Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Taittinger 2006 Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Certainly dry, this Champagne is also ripe and structured, balancing the extreme dryness and acidity. It is a complex wine that has the ability to age in the bottle. The minimalist label, designed by Philip Starck, is a perfect pairing with the no-frills wine inside the bottle.
title: Louis Roederer 2006 Brut Nature  (Champagne)

description: With fruit from the chalk vineyards of the Côte des Blancs, this wine named after Alain Thiénot's son Stanislas is tightly textured, mineral-driven, steely and crisp. Apple skins and lime juice feature along with a continuing freshness despite the wine's age. It can be enjoyed now, although it will be better from 2017.
designation: Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millesimé
title: Thiénot 2006 Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millesimé Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This prestige Cuvée from Jacquart is a blend of grand and premier crus, giving a wine that is rich, round and approaching maturity with a dense, deep series of fruit and creamy toast flavors. It's a beautiful Champagne at this stage, poised between youth and maturity. The aftertaste leaves a crisper, fruitier end.
title: Jacquart 2006 Cuvée Alpha  (Champagne)

description: With some wood fermentation in the old style of Champagne, this vintage wine is rich and ripe. It has a smooth texture, with ripe white and citrus fruits that are contrasted by tight minerality that cuts right through the core. The wine is still young and will continue to improve through 2020.
title: Collet 2006 Brut Vintage Collection Privée  (Champagne)

description: This is a pale-colored wine with a finely wrought texture and great fruit. It is tight and mineral on the one hand, but balanced with the crispest red-currant flavors that offer a bright line in acidity. Delicious hints of age round out the final fresh aftertaste.
title: Charles Heidsieck 2006 Millésime Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: The wine is mature both in its orange-pink color and toasty flavors. It has fresh acidity, although that is less important than the almond and spice secondary flavors. Ripe and full in the mouth, this is a rich Rosé with a soft, ready-to-drink aftertaste.
title: Moët & Chandon 2006 Grand Vintage Rosé  (Champagne)

description: An equal blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this is a crisper than other Champagnes in the Coutelas range. It is also still young with its bright green and citrus fruits and tense texture. Lively and fresh, it should be aged and not drunk before 2017.
title: A. D. Coutelas 2006 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Definitely mature, this is a ripe wine with rich tropical flavors that give balance to the beginnings of toastiness. An attractive tang of acidity contrasts with the soft, ripe aftertaste. The wine will age further, although it is ready to drink now and until 2018.
title: Bertrand-Delespierre 2006 Millésimé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Based in the Aube in southern Champagne, Fluteau's vineyards are in the Seine valley. This crisp, tight and dry wine is balanced although still young. Textured crisp apple and lemon flavors have a taut, nervy character. It needs to age for a few more months, so drink from 2016.
title: Fluteau 2006 Cuvée Symbiose  (Champagne)

description: The wine still tastes young, with ripe yellow fruits and bright acidity. Chardonnay dominates the blend, allowing hints of minerality to come through the lime and lemon crispness. Still developing its more toasty character, it will be better from 2017.
title: Charles Ellner 2006 Brut Prestige  (Champagne)

description: Crisp, tight acidity and still-young, fresh fruitiness give this wine its initial brightness. Rich and full in the mouth, it also has a range of complex fruit flavors followed by hints of toastiness that will only continue to develop. It should be aged further, so drink from 2016.
title: H. Blin 2006 Millesime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a complex, pale salmon-pink wine, delicious and worth aging. It has the hallmark light touch of Belle Epoque, all fresh and light as well as fruity. A more serious texture brings out tight minerality, some toastiness and delicate acidity. Drink now, but better from 2016.
title: Perrier Jouët 2006 Belle Epoque Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This offers great balance between the freshest fruit and toasty maturity. That poise gives this impressive Champagne a tension, a high wire act that works superbly. It is rich, full of fruit but also with great depth. It will certainly age, so drink now or hold through 2019.
title: Moët & Chandon 2006 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: This vintage of Drappier's top Cuvée is showing signs of delicious maturity. With tropical fruits morphing into toast and ripe almonds, it's a wine on the cusp of greatness. For now, there is still plenty of freshness there, tight acidity and the ripe character that's typical of Champagnes from the Aube. Drink now, but better wait until 2016.
title: Drappier 2006 Grande Sendrée Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still so fresh, this is fruity, yes, but it has such a depth of flavor with its red fruits the starting point for an adventure in tastes and textures. Produced from Roederer's own vineyards, it is ready to drink, although it will age in bottle for many years.
title: Louis Roederer 2006 Cristal Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Spécial Club is a grouping of growers who taste each other's wines and approve them for Club status. This is certainly an impressive wine, seamlessly moving from freshness to richness via a steely texture. It is still impressively young and fruity, a bright, crisp wine that will age for several more years. Drink from 2016.
designation: Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2006 Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: With its mature orange, onion skin color, this is a soft, toasty wine. It is losing fruit and gaining a wide range of mature flavors while keeping tight acidity. The wine tastes drier than previous vintages, a crisp aftertaste allowing the texture to shine and the more mature elements to develop well. Drink now, although the wine will age longer.
designation: Extra Cuvée de Réserve Brut Rosé
title: Pol Roger 2006 Extra Cuvée de Réserve Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Just getting to maturity, this is hinting at toastiness while also retaining all the bright apple and citrus fruit flavors. The taut and steely texture brings out great freshness and a concentrated final acidity. It is just ready to drink.
designation: Cuvée Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2006 Cuvée Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a soft, finely formed wine, ripe, smooth and creamy. It has elegance, a light touch of fruit and acidity with some minerality from the Chardonnay in the blend. It's a vintage that is already drinkable, with just a touch of toast suggesting maturing. A beautiful wine, drink now.
title: Taittinger 2006 Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: Although it is still young, this vintage of Cristal promises great things. There's an impressive balance between ripe fruit and crisp acidity, rich and food friendly, but also a fine apéritif. Apricot and grapefruit flavors are round and rich, but with considerable minerality as well. This is a beautiful wine that can improve with age, at least through 2030.
title: Louis Roederer 2006 Cristal Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a full-bodied and ripe wine, showing some toastiness as well as concentrated apple and peach flavors. There is a crisp edge to this opulent and rich wine. It has a great future: it is drinkable now, but will continue well into the 2020s.
title: Perrier Jouët 2006 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)

description: This rich and creamy vintage wine boasts soft apples, fresh acidity and a fine, tight texture. There's just a hint of toast to round out the palate and add complexity. It could improve with age further, so drink through 2020.
title: Piper-Heidsieck 2006 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Bright citrus-fruit flavors are rounded with warm apple and pear notes on this densely textured, fruity wine. It shows no sign of aging, with a palate that's still fresh and bright, and revealing its minerality and tight acidity slowly. Drink through 2020.
designation: Tsarine Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Chanoine 2006 Tsarine Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This richly textured wine boasts incredible freshness, as well as complexity of flavor. Apple and citrus flavors show hints of development- secondary notes of toast and cookies. The acidity is still very present-a crisp reminder of its age worthiness. Drink through 2022
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2006 Brut Millesimé  (Champagne)

description: This wine is sourced from two parcels, one planted in the 1930s and the other in the 1950s. The low dosage is possible because of the concentration and ripeness of the fruit, resulting in a sophisticated, balanced and rich wine with a lemon zest flavor, a tight, mineral texture, and a crisp finish.
designation: Vieilles Vignes de Cramant Grand Cru
title: Larmandier-Bernier 2006 Vieilles Vignes de Cramant Grand Cru Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Roederer takes the natural elegance of a blanc de blancs to an extra level. This is so stylish, its white fruit and lemon flavors are touched with the minerality, and the acidity is nearly absorbed into the texture of the wine. Like many Roederer vintages on release, this should be aged, so give it 4-5 years.
title: Louis Roederer 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Rich, ripe and full bodied, this is a warm, Chardonnay-dominated blend. It has crisp apple and citrus flavors, followed by a quince note and a touch of apricot. The fruit for this wine is sourced from premier cru vineyards, and it could age a few more months in bottle. Disgorged January 2012.
title: René Geoffroy 2006 Volupté Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Geoffroy's style produces a full, rich offering, one that benefits from ripe Pinot Noir. The vintage gives it a soft, rounded character, featuring pear, quince and seemingly sweet citrus flavors. It is balanced, with a crisp finish.
title: René Geoffroy 2006 Empreinte Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: From the lesser-quality 2006 vintage, this is a gentle and tangy selection. It has lemon zest and steely acidity, with light touches of grapefruit and crisp apple. Not for aging, this is an attractive wine to drink now.
title: Michel Moritz 2006 Noblesse d'Or Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Balancing a ripe lime flavor with a note of rich peach and acidity, this shows the ability to age. Even though it is delicious now, it will age over several years.
title: Duval-Leroy 2006 Paris Brut  (Champagne)

description: Rounded and soft, this has currant and sweet apple flavors balanced with its acidity. It is concentrated and rich, and there's still some aging potential.
title: Veuve Doussot 2006 Millésime  (Champagne)

description: This is an intense Rosé, pushing forward the pink fruit flavors, the rich texture and red berry fruits. Dry, still youthful, it has considerable acidity and a complex and concentrated mélange of flavors. Age for 3-5 years.
title: Louis Roederer 2006 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a crisp wine, combining apple freshness with apricot richness. There is a tight edge of acidity and minerality from the chalk soil Chardonnay, although the finish is softer and more creamy.
designation: Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2006 Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A full-bodied, fruity Champagne with ripe, intense strawberry fruit flavors. Like its partner brut, this Rosé is still young, needing time to develop secondary flavors, while delicious now.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2006 L'Intemporelle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: A young, delicious, fresh wine, with soft apple and pear flavors, rounded and ripe. The fruit is right up front, with an apple-skin texture and brilliant acidity. It could age for a few years, but is ready to drink now.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2006 L'Intemporelle Brut  (Champagne)

description: Very young wine, one which is full and rich, but which needs several years to blossom into its full potential. It is in the dry Deutz style, emphasizing acidity and elegance, even though it also has a wonderful ripe intensity.
title: Deutz 2006 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: The wine from this clos or walled vineyard in the city of Reims has spent eight years aging before disgorgement. It's a rare wine, with a wonderful balance between its toasty character and the crisp, dry apple and green-fruit flavors. It will certainly age further, so wait-if you can-until 2019.
title: Lanson 2006 Clos Lanson Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This new release from a great vintage for Chardonnay in Champagne is a perfect blanc de blancs, showing a wealth of intensity from the crisp, chalky, mineral tones to the perfumed apple notes. The aromas hint at developing toastiness that adds depth and complexity. The wine is still young and it will age for years. Drink from 2020.
designation: Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Salon 2006 Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Perfectly mature, this ripe wine with its fruit from premier cru vineyards is balanced. The touches of toast go with the still-vibrant white fruits and acidity. With a richly textured background, the wine is ripe and deliciously ready to drink.
title: Forget-Brimont 2006 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This pale-colored wine with its crushed raspberry perfume, is now reaching its peak. It is rich with a dosage that gives it a soft character without losing any of the crisp fruit. The wine is balanced, hinting at toast while still tangy and tight. Drink this delicious wine now.
title: Perrier Jouët 2006 Belle Epoque Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: More full and developed characteristics than other Blanquettes, boasting aromas of buttery toast and butterscotch among fruity nuances of red apple skins and tangerine supremes. The round, lush mouth conjures more of the same with a nice citrus backbone and a long, tasty finish.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2006 Brut Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: With its rich fruit, this is an immediately attractive wine. It shows the ripeness of the year in Saumur, bringing together apricot and cantaloupe melon flavors, the acidity a necessary and balancing adjunct to the full-bodied texture. Drink now, or age for 2-3 years.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay 2006 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

description: A rich, creamy sparkling wine that brings out the ripe Chenin flavors: ground almonds and a touch of ginger to go with the fine maturity. The finish is bright, full of citrus acidity.
title: Château Moncontour 2006 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: Already showing some maturity, this almond- and yeast-flavored wine still has plenty of soft white fruits and balancing acidity. The wine finishes with a warm, rounded feel.
title: Joseph Cattin 2007 Grande Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Petroleum (in a good way) and candied fruit are the opening act while peach and apricot headline on the palate. The finish is light and fres and there's enough depth here to serve with main course salads.
title: René Muré 2007 Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A complex, full-bodied wine that is full of mature fruit flavors with a touch of toast to add to the attractive mix. With apple, quince and almonds well blended together, this is a finely balanced wine, that could age for a couple of years more.
title: Louis Bouillot 2007 Perle d'Or Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: The minerality is a reminder that the grapes come from an area near Chablis. It has a tangy, zingy character, with a nervy edge that promises aging, but it also provides fruity, apple-driven pleasure now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2007 Vive-la-Joie Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Deliciously crisp, this is a light and lively blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. With its raspberry and red apple flavors, it exudes fruitiness, with an attractively soft finish.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2007 Vive-la-Joie Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Crisp sparkling Burgundy, laced with taut acidity and hints of nuts and toast. This is a wine under tension, with a strong mineral element, cool and fresh, best with food.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2007  Crémant de Bourgogne

description: One of two flagship wines from this producer, this is named after the founder of the company. It shows all the elegance and style for which the house is known. Mature fruit, a touch of brioche and toast, and a dry aftertaste all make for an impressive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Deutz 2007 William Deutz Brut  (Champagne)

description: Beautifully mature, this rich wine shines with the minerality and texture of Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. Its intensity and concentration make for a ripe while toasty wine, crisp and deliciously in balance. Drink now.
title: Boizel 2007 Joyau de France Brut Chardonnay Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced from a small walled vineyard close to the Lanson winery in Reims, this is a splendid wine. Its richness is balanced by the intense freshness and minerality of the Chardonnay, with apple and citrus flavors that still in the background. Now mature, this wine is ready to drink.
title: Lanson 2007 Clos Lanson Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This legendary Champagne, only produced in exceptional years, comes from the village of Le Mesnil in the Côte des Blancs. It is made from 100% Chardonnay and aged for many years before release. Its minerality, concentration and beautiful fruit are still astonishingly young and deserve further aging. Drink from 2020.
designation: Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Salon 2007 Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Not only is this 11-year-old Champagne made from old vines, giving it concentration, it also has oak aging, adding to the toasty character. It is rich, well balanced and now mature. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Victor Mandois Vieilles Vignes Brut
title: Mandois 2007 Cuvée Victor Mandois Vieilles Vignes Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Mainly Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs, this wine has a good balance between the maturing rich apple and green-plum fruits and the mineral texture. Notes of spice and yeastiness are coming through to give the wine a generous aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millésimé
title: Thiénot 2007 Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millésimé Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This producer is located in Mailly on the north slopes of the Montagne de Reims. The wine is everything this style should be: crisp, tight and mineral driven. Apple and the fresh citrus come through strongly even after 11 years. The wine is just ready to drink.
designation: Exception Blanche Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2007 Exception Blanche Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Half-and half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this just-mature wine still has plenty of fruitiness. It's balanced, with hints of toast contrasting with red apples and light spice. Drink this wine now.
title: Forget-Brimont 2007 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Part of a range of limited-edition Champagnes created for artist André Saraiva, this is a deliciously crisp and dry wine. It still has freshness, although hints of yeast add complexity. Drink now, or let it age until 2020.
title: Artéis & Co 2007 Brut  (Champagne)

description: From a very good if not great Champagne vintage, this mature wine is delicious and beautifully ripe. It still has plenty of crisp acidity, allowing the fruit to shine. At the same time, a yeasty, toasty character indicates its gentle aging. After eight years in the cellar before disgorging, it is ready to drink.
title: Boude Baudin 2007 Cuvée Amour de B  (Champagne)

description: This wine, now mature, shows a fine toast and yeast character. That still leaves room for crisp apple fruit and bright acidity, exuding a stylish elegance. It's poised with delicious balance. Drink now.
title: Deutz 2007 Amour de Deutz Brut  (Champagne)

description: Crisp red fruit dominates this beautifully crafted wine. Poised and stylish, it exudes sophistication with its bright red currant fruit and delicious acidity. A lively mousse enhances its crisp texture and fine aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Deutz 2007 Amour de Deutz Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This is a refined, mature Champagne with an elegant texture that just hints at minerality. A toasty character shows through its ripe white fruit, yielding a balanced wine. The aftertaste is lingering and satisfying. Drink now.
title: Charlier & Fils 2007 Bacchus Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Dominated by Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs, this mature, mineral-textured wine is both ripe and beautifully structured. With white fruits and a floral character, it is moving into spicy territory. Roast almonds are balanced with a crisp character from the low dosage. The wine is now just ready to drink.
title: Henri Abele 2007 Le Sourire de Reims Brut  (Champagne)

description: Named after the officials of the French Court who were responsible for the King's cellar, this intense wine is a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. With some age it is much about secondary flavors as fruit. Spice and yeast come together with textured apple and creamed pear. The wine is on the dry side of Brut, the ripe fruit adding richness. Drink this balanced wine now.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2007 Les Échansons Brut  (Champagne)

description: Named after the daughter of owner Alain Thiénot, this Champagne comes from the Montagne de Reims. Full and rich, it is mature with toast and almond flavors as much as fruit. The vanilla flavor is balanced by the acidity and tight, zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Thiénot 2007 Cuvée Garance Blanc de Rouges Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This is a ripe, rich red-fruit-flavored wine. It has great concentration and a dense texture that spotlights bright fruit, plus a touch of tannin from the red wine used to give color. This bottling needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
title: Alfred Gratien 2007 Cuvée Paradis Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Named after the 13th-century crusading Archbishop of Reims, this is Aubry's top Cuvée. It is just coming into its own, filling out with ripe white and yellow fruits while keeping a tight, fresh edge. It is full in the mouth, creamy in texture and still able to age. Drink now and until 2022.
title: Aubry 2007 Aubry de Humbert Brut  (Champagne)

description: Disgorged in October 2014, this smooth, now mature, wine has flavors of yeasty toastiness and a tight, mineral structure. Sliced apple and lemon zest still give freshness. Behind the fruit, crisp texture and a steely edge await. It is beautifully balanced, rich while dry and ready to drink.
title: Boizel 2007 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: For Perrier-Jouët the symbols of the Belle Epoque are the house calling card. This prestige Cuvée, in its stylish flowered bottle, has been released with good maturity, offering toast as well as fruit and a crisp, tight and mineral backdrop. There is an elegant style to the wine, fresh and with poise. Drink now.
title: Perrier Jouët 2007 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)

description: Among the most iconic Champagnes, this wine always reflects its vintage. In this 2007, coming from a good, not great year, the wine is developing more quickly than is sometimes the case. It is now showing as a beautiful, balanced wine ripe with apples while also hinting at almonds and a yeasty character. The wine has such style, elegant with its fragrant acidity and complex structure.
title: Louis Roederer 2007 Cristal Brut  (Champagne)

description: Beautifully pale in color, this is the latest release of Cristal Rosé. It is ripe and full in the mouth, packed with fruit and also with intense acidity that cuts through the soft texture. There is a hint of bottle age, giving the wine a toasty complexity that brings a balance to this great wine. Drink now, although this vintage will certainly last to 2020 and beyond.
title: Louis Roederer 2007 Cristal Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Delamotte, the sister house of the legendary Salon, is based in the Côte des Blancs so it has plenty of experience with Chardonnay. This crisp, fruity and lightly toasty wine shows well-balanced freshness and poise. Drink now.
title: Delamotte 2007 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Named after Alain Thiénot's daughter Garance, this is rich and full of delicious fruit. Well aged, it is just developing some secondary flavors that complement the ripe apple and crisp grapefruit flavors. The mineral tang on the finish adds a bit of levity. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Garance Blanc de Rouges Brut Millesimé
title: Thiénot 2007 Cuvée Garance Blanc de Rouges Brut Millesimé Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: A rare Rosé Champagne whose color comes from Pinot Noir skins rather than from added red wine, this has vivid colors of orange and onion skin. It is rich, tasting as much like wine as like sparkling wine, with a full and ripe, yet dry, feel.
title: Tendil & Lombardi 2007 Rosé de Saignée Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: A limited-edition vintage that Perrier-Jouët releases for summer drinking. It has weight and richness with a soft, fruity dosage that gives touches of yeast and fragrant acidity. Ripe apple, raspberry and citrus fruits are still very present in this wine that is full and balanced. It could do with more bottle age to bring out more of the toast that is just beginning, so drink from 2016.
title: Perrier Jouët 2007 Belle Epoque Edition Premiére Brut  (Champagne)

description: Ripe, soft and creamy, this is a gold-colored, fresh Champagne, with yellow and white fruit flavors. The wine is open, softly rich with a light, bright mousse and finishing acidity. The aftertaste adds an attractive yeasty character.
title: Veuve Doussot 2007 Memory Brut  (Champagne)

description: This Blanc de Blancs has shed its initial minerality and gained rich fruitiness. Apricots as well as more citrus flavors abound, bringing out a full and round character. From Grand Cru vineyards on the Côte des Blancs, this is ready to drink.
title: Ayala 2007 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: In the case of this wine, Brut really means dry. It has an austere character, personified by the strongly mineral, steely streak that goes through it. In contrast, green apple and pink grapefruit flavors give the crisp fruitiness. All this means the wine needs to age further, so drink from 2016.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2007 Noble Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: This wine is so crisp and piercingly direct in its acidity and minerality. On the palate, apples are fringed with grapefruit and white-currant flavors, with a texture that tight and edgy. Although hints of toast peek through, the wine is still young, so hold and don't drink before 2016.
title: Louis Roederer 2007 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: While 2007 was not the greatest vintage, Roederer managed to produce one of the best wines of the year. It is a great blend of mature yellow fruits, with a pure line of tangy orange zest. Tightly txtured, with bright acidity and steely minerality, it promises long aging. Drink until 2025, and possibly longer.
title: Louis Roederer 2007 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a beautiful wine showing remarkable richness and maturity. Hints of toast and bright fruits combine seamlessly to yield a full, ripe wine marked with with intense acidity. With concentration from old vines showing strongly, it's a wine that's ready to drink now.
title: Vollereaux 2007 Cuvée Marguerite Brut  (Champagne)

description: Fruity and fragrant, this wine shows just a touch of toast suggesting it is approaching maturity. Crisp on the palate with a light twist of lemon, it boasts tight acidity and a mineral character. It's an solidly structured wine, with a fruitiness that lingers on the finish.
title: Philippe Fontaine 2007 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Partly fermented in wood, this smooth, unctuous Champagne is at the same time delicately dry and lined with acidity. With its steely overtones, it's still a young Champagne, needing time to smooth out the sharp, youthful edges. Give it at least five years.
title: Yann Alexandre 2007 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: In perfect balance now, this is a great expression of mineral-driven Chardonnay. Its acidity is a vehicle for the crisp flavors of pear and lime, with a hint of ginger. It's still young, so drink it now for its great fruit, or age for four more years.
designation: Spécial Club Chouilly Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Roland Champion 2007 Spécial Club Chouilly Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Attractively mature, this has a toast flavor that combines delicately with citrus and pineapple notes. Tight, crisp and textured, it is delicious and fragrant. This includes old Champagne varieties, including the unusual Arbanne and Petit Meslier.
designation: Le Nombre d'Or Sablé Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Aubry 2007 Le Nombre d'Or Sablé Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)

description: This producer in the Aude  has made a rounded, rich bottling that's packed with tropical fruits and orange-zest acidity, with a lively, lemon-and-grapefruit texture on the finish. The final feel is balanced, ripe and round.
title: Veuve Doussot 2007 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is definitely dry, yet it still retains the full, rich Vilmart style. Crisp, mineral-driven and taut in character, it features a fine mélange of apple, tangerine, light spice and intense citrus. Its texture suggests it needs to age at least three more years.
designation: Grand Cellier d'Or Premier Cru Brut
title: Vilmart & Co 2007 Grand Cellier d'Or Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Definitely dry, this impressively crisp wine is tightly textured, mineral in character and with great fruit. Its acidity and taut tangy character are part of a sophisticated wine that is still maturing. The hints of toast are there, but this beautiful wine will take a while to show its full potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Billecart-Salmon 2007 Vintage Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: White flowers and almonds give fragrance to this Chardonnay-dominant Champagne. It is a concentrated wine, full of ripe white fruits, with a tight core of acidity. Named after the producer's owner, it is a flagship wine, intense and just ready to drink.
title: Thiénot 2007 Cuvée Alain Thiénot  (Champagne)

description: There's a strong, nutty character to this bubbly, with accents of Granny Smith apple, toast and lemon rind citrus on the nose and mouth. The rich mouth is full and satisfying, but the alcohol is a bit warming on the close.
title: Delmas 2007 Cuvée Berléne Brut Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: Delicate notes of wood-grilled apples, walnut skin and lightly toasted brioche take center stage on this sparkler. Balanced and creamy in the mouth, with a nice streak of ruby red grapefruit pith unfolding on the clean finish.
title: Sieur d'Arques 2007 Toques et Clochers Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: This vintage Rosé, made with 57% Chardonnay, 28% Chenin Blanc, 10% Mauzac and 5% Pinot Noir, is a perfect match for tomato-cream sauce dishes or insalata Caprese. Delicate toast adds depth to the dainty strawberry and apple notes, with a touch of sweet spice unfolding on the finish. Drink up.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2007 Vintage Rosé Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: A pale straw color with moderate aromas of apple skins, hay, small white flowers and a touch of toast. The mouth is creamy with good carbonation and tons of nice citrus flavors among suggestions of stone fruit and apple. The finish is clean but lingering, leaving the palate ready for more.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2007 Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: Ripe and creamy, a classic sparkling Vouvray showing well in a cool year. It has weight and richness as well as fresh nuts and spice flavors, with just a touch of pepper. The acidity is well in balance.
title: Château Moncontour 2007 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: A classic blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this has a steely texture, fresh acidity and lively flavors of sliced apple and citrus with a tangy orange zest texture. It is bright and a bit taught now, so give it a little time to harmonize; try in 2015.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2008 Vive-la-Joie Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this is the palest Rosé, with a delicious fresh character. Red currants and raspberries are combined with pure crisp acidity and lively texture to make a totally refreshing wine. Drink now, or age until 2016.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2008 Vive-la-Joie Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This rich, fruity wine is packed with ripe apples and pears, and cut with delicious, full-on acidity. It's aromatic, with a lively mousse and a sparkling, lifted character. Drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Cuvée S Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: There is a bitter edge to this wine. Spice and tight acidity give a nervy, taut character. At the same time, fresh apple and citrus flavors come through. Give this wine until 2016 to soften.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Composed of Pinot Noir from Verzenay, this wine is beautifully balanced. Rich while elegant, it has ripe apple fruits that are cut by lime and filled out with hints of mature toastiness. It deserves to be aged even further. Drink from 2020.
designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Brut Grand Cru
title: G. H. Mumm 2008 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Brut Grand Cru Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This vintage Blanc de Blancs completes what is now a full range produced for all the Rothschild family-owned properties in Bordeaux. It is full of minerality as well as crisp intensity. The fruit is almost mature while still fresh and tangy. This textured Champagne will be best from 2020.
title: Barons de Rothschild 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Packed with fruit while hinting at mature toastiness, this wine is now in perfect balance. Its white fruits are from half-and-half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, shot through with acidity while having a ripe character. Rich while also crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Henriot 2008 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: One of the great Champagnes both for its richness and its longevity, this latest incarnation is superb. The wine's richness is linked to the ripe fruit and the dominance of Pinot Noir in the blend. It also shines in the perfect balance between the texture, the minerality and the integration of the fruit. It can be enjoyed now, but it will be better from 2020 and then for many years to come.
title: 100pointsPol Roger 2008 Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill Brut  (Champagne)Cellar Selection

description: Veuve Clicquot's prestige Cuvée is a ripe, mature wine. With toastiness coming from soft fruit and a rich textured character, it is a classic of this producer's ripe style. The wine's acidity and crisp edge make a good contrast to the full-bodied character. Drink now.
title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 La Grande Dame Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Half-and-half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this rich wine is just approaching maturity. Touches of spice and toast contrast beautifully with ripe pear and apple flavors that are crispened with citrus acidity. Although this full wine can be drunk now, it will be best from 2019.
title: Boizel 2008 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: This rich Champagne is dominated, as usual, by Pinot Noir. Its ripe fruit is approaching maturity, the hints of toast and croissant becoming more apparent. It is balanced, rich but textured and with an opulent, ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 La Grande Dame Brut  (Champagne)

description: Drawing on fruit from the Côte des Blancs, this wine is concentrated and still young. Density comes from the strong minerality that is balanced by a lemon flavor. Textured and taut, this wine needs time in the cellar. Drink from 2020.
title: Delamotte 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A blend of all three of the main Champagne grapes, this wine comes from an exceptional year in Champagne. It is showing some delicious maturity in its toastiness and cookie aromas. The fruit is now well integrated, still mineral but also with richness. Drink now.
title: Thiénot 2008 Brut Vintage  (Champagne)
