description: From one of the many fine Champagne vintages this century, this intense wine is structured and still young. There is some richness from the ripe Pinot Noir in the blend but ultimately this tight wine would benefit from further aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Collet 2008 Brut Millésime  (Champagne)

description: A small-production wine, this is dark Rosé in color, with a touch of tannin from the pure Pinot Noir. Rich and now mature, with hints of acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean Laurent 2008 Rosé Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This is part of a range of Champagnes made for artist André Saraiva. It is crisp, with great fruitiness and lively acidity. The texture is soft and open, lifted by red-currant flavors and by the bright aftertaste. Drink this attractive bottling now.
title: Artéis & Co 2008 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Now approaching its peak, this vintage blend balances the three primary Champagne grapes in equal proportion. It's ripe, yet still crisp, with attractive hints of toast and a full, rich, creamy background. Full-bodied and beautiful, it's ready to drink.
title: Huré Fréres 2008 Instantanée Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: A high proportion of Pinot Noir gives this Deutz prestige Cuvée richness as well as a strong green fruit character. Citrus, green apples and intense acidity underpin this finely understated wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Deutz 2008 Cuvée William Deutz  (Champagne)

description: What this mature, ripe wine has lost in fruit, it has gained in richness and complexity. Its toasty, nutty character attracts, along with its tight acidity and taut, nervy texture. Nicely evolved and well-balanced, it is ready to drink now.
title: H. Blin 2008 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: The half-bottle format has sped up the maturing of this wine. It rides a fine line between crisp red fruit and fuller, toastier character. With great acidity, layers of zingy citrus and a soft texture, it's delicate and ready to drink.
title: Deutz 2008 Amour de Deutz Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This wine is rich and surprisingly full-bodied. It comes from a great Champagne vintage, giving it both intensity and an acidity built for longterm aging. This half-bottle version is filling out, showing almond flavors yet retaining its citrus edge. Drink from 2019.
title: Deutz 2008 Amour de Deutz Brut  (Champagne)

description: Vines in Chouilly in the Côte des Blancs give this vintage Champagne a still impressively youthful character. It's crisp, tangy and taut with minerality, showing no sign of aging. Drink this food-friendly wine now and until 2022.
designation: Millésime Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru
title: Marcel Moineaux 2008 Millésime Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier blend is perfectly ready to drink with fine mature fruit, layers of toast and tangy spice. From a very good Champagne vintage, it's rich while having plenty of acidity to allow it to age further.
title: Baron-Fuenté 2008 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This impressive Champagne is rich while tight and mineral-textured. Creamy and ripe, it balances the weight of Pinot Noir with the elegance of Chardonnay. The producer's location in the relatively warm Aube region gives its wines extra fullness. This one is just now ready to drink.
title: Fluteau 2008 Cuvée Symbiose Brut  (Champagne)

description: It's rare to find Pinot Blanc in Champagne, let alone as a stand-alone grape. From the southern Aube vineyards, it's fruitier and softer than a Chardonnay-based wine. That makes it accessible, smooth, creamy and just ready to drink.
title: Chassenay d'Arce 2008 Extra Brut Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

description: Still so crisp and fruity, this is lively Champagne. It has a great tang of lemon zest and a tight texture that shows plenty of minerality. It will continue to age gracefully, allowing a more mature toasty character to come through. Drink from 2018.
designation: Carte Noire Brut Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs
title: Roland Champion 2008 Carte Noire Brut Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The balance between ripeness and acidity that is the hallmark of this fine vintage is expressed well in this impressive wine. Tangy, with a strong streak of minerality, it is crisp and rich at the same time. For its fruitiness, it is ready to drink; for more maturity, it will need to age until 2018.
title: Taittinger 2008 Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This Aube-based producer has made a fine vintage from a good year. A half-and-half blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, still young and crisp, this concentrated wine brings in apricot as well as citrus fruits into a taut and mineral texture. Still full of its baby fruit, it will age well and will be best drunk from 2018.
title: Devaux 2008 D Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This ripe wine with its red fruits and well-balanced texture is beautifully ready to drink, with just the right crisp acidity to balance the soft richness. There is no sign yet of maturity, the fruit from this great vintage showing at its perfumed best. Drink the wine now.
title: Pol Roger 2008 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This ripe wine offers great balance between the rich, structured Pinot Noir and the mineral Chardonnay. From a very fine vintage, it reveals intense flavors, layers of ripe apple and a taut texture that promises further aging. The wine can be drunk now, but it will be so much better from 2018.
title: Drappier 2008 Grande Sendrée Brut  (Champagne)

description: Based around a blend of grand cru wines and with seven years aging, this wine combines a rich texture with tight acidity and hints of toast from the wood fermentation. A creamy background gives the mature fruits their chance to show beautifully. The wine is ready to drink although it will age at least until 2025.
title: Alfred Gratien 2008 Cuvée Paradis Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a beautiful wine with its pink-orange color. The taste lives up to its appearance. A mature wine from a great vintage, it's rich with spice and nuts along with tight acidity. From fruit grown in the southern Champagne region of the Aube, the wine is completely ready to drink.
title: Drappier 2008 Grande Sendrée Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: From one of the best Champagne vintages, this wine offers a tight texture and layers of intense acidity. It is still young, showing citrus and crisp apple fruit, while the depth and concentration of minerality promise long aging. Drink from 2019. Gonet uses this label for the American market.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Charles-Gilbert de Vindé 2008 Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Equal proportions of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier make this a well-balanced wine. It is initially soft with a creamy mousse followed by a good tang of acidity to keep it crisp. The apple fruitiness shows a wine from a fine vintage that is still young. Ideally drink from 2018.
title: Bertrand-Delespierre 2008 Millésimé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Made from Pinot Noir grown in the Aube village of Les Riceys, this deep-colored Rosé is rich with red fruits and as well as a more mature, toasty character. It's spicy, full in the mouth and ripe. The aftertaste continues the full, generous character of the wine.
designation: Le Sourire de Reims Rosé Brut
title: Henri Abele 2008 Le Sourire de Reims Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: With an attractive touch of toastiness on this ripe wine, this is balanced and very ready to drink. In the house style, it is rich with a comparatively high dosage that gives it a soft character. Plenty of acidity and hints of red fruits provide a vibrant contrast. It is ready to drink.
title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 Vintage Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: A 50-50 blend of Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay from the Marne Valley gives this wood-aged wine richness, with good spice and flavor concentration. Dry and crisp, it benefits from the fine vintage to highlight ripe grapes with acidity and citrus flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Dom Caudron 2008 Sublimité 50/50  (Champagne)

description: With seven years on lees before disgorgement, this wine already shows some maturity. It is rich while also having the intense acidity of the vintage. Turning to gold in color, it is balanced and dry as with all the Paillard wines, although with age that character becomes less obvious. Drink now for the fruit or until 2024.
title: Bruno Paillard 2008 Assemblage Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a ripe and creamy wine from the great 2008 vintage. Tight acidity and lively citrus are balanced by a more serious richness and texture. The wine, bringing all three of the main Champagne grapes together, is still maturing. Wait until 2018.
title: Pannier 2008 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: From a very fine vintage, this structured, tight while also fruity Champagne is poised and stylish. A creamy mousse balances the crisp texture and beautiful acidity. Red fruits and blood orange come through well at the end. It is ready to drink.
title: Moët & Chandon 2008 Grand Vintage Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: From the excellent 2008 vintage, this is a very complete, ripe wine. It is rich, packed with crisp white fruits that are developing into a structured, concentrated wine with a great future. The balance between acidity and dosage is just right. Drink ideally from 2018.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2008 Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: A lively mousse is the starting point for this wine. It is intensely rich, dense and still young, with a soft background to the ripe white fruits that are cut with lime. From a vintage year whose wines need to age, this follows the pattern, so wait at least until 2018.
title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier, this wine has great fruit and a soft texture. The flavors of ripe bitter orange and apples are now moving towards maturity, with the toastiness coming through. Drink now.
title: A. D. Coutelas 2008 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: A blend of 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay, this is the top wine from Vollereaux. It is dry and crisp, although with ripe fruits in the background. Just becoming mature, this is a wine to hold for another couple of years and drink from 2018.
title: Vollereaux 2008 Cuvée Marguerite Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: A beautiful wine, this has fresh acidity, crisp fruits and zesty mineral texture. Apples, citrus and hints of apricots are all there along with an intense tangy character that bursts in the mouth. It's still so young and needs to age; drink from 2018 at the earliest. The Special Club is a group of growers who rate and taste each other's wines before release.
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2008 Special Club de Collection Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The heart of the Gimonnet vineyards is in the Côte des Blancs. This bone-dry, very crisp Chardonnay is intense in its acidity and tight texture. Like many wines that are so dry, it needs to age to allow its almost shocking freshness to soften. It will always be a wine for food. Drink from 2018.
designation: Extra Brut Oenophile Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2008 Extra Brut Oenophile Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a blend from Aí¿ on the Montagne de Reims and from the Côte des Blancs. It is intensely perfumed, with weight from Pinot Noir and crispness from Chardonnay. If it seems not quite integrated at this stage, it will hopefully come together over the next few years to reveal a ripe and rich wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2008 Cuvée Paradoxe Premier Cru  (Champagne)

description: The great 2008 vintage has produced a textured wine that is still young. With its crisp citrus and green fruits, it is tight, mineral and tense. The wine is balanced with its texture and fresh fruits, but it needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Soutiran 2008 Grand Cru Millésimeé  (Champagne)

description: Crisply fresh, this full-bodied wine has citrus fruitiness that is followed by hints of toast and honey that are just developing. Well balanced, it's very textured while also fruity, and will develop well in bottle. Drink from 2017 for the more mature flavors to bring their own character to the wine.
title: Pol Roger 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a fine wine from a great vintage. Still young, it is already showing great swathes of apple and tight citrus fruit cut with lemon zest. It has a crisp character, packed with acidity that will soften while always there. Drink this wine from 2018.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Brut
title: A.R. LenobleÂ  2008 Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Rich and structured, this complex wine comes from grand cru vines on the northern slopes of the Montagne de Reims. It is tense as well as packed with ripe apple and pineapple fruit flavors. The tension develops from a fine vintage that will allow it to age. Drink until 2022.
title: Henriet-Bazin 2008 Millésime Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: This delicious wine, on the dry side of brut, is fresh and fruity while also finely textured. Initially, it seems light and then more complex minerality and steely acidity come through to give a structure that promises aging. Drink this impressive wine from 2017.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2008 O' de Mailly Milésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Produced from Grand and Premier cru vineyards, this ripe wine is from a good, not great, year in Champagne. It has good structure and a tense texture that shows that it is still maturing. With crisp acidity and layers of complex fruit and structure, it could still age further. Drink from 2017.
title: Jacquart 2008 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Mainly Pinot Noir with a shot of Chardonnay, this is developing into an impressive wine. It has ripe fruit with hints of tropicality as well tighter lemon zest. The toastiness is just beginning to develop and the wine will be at its peak from 2016.
title: Liebart-Régnier 2008 Excélia Brut  (Champagne)

description: Showing signs of toastiness, this is a ripe and full-bodied wine. Rich with apples and yellow fruits shot through with lemon, it still could age. Drink from 2016.
title: Poissinet 2008 Cuvée Carte d'Or Brut  (Champagne)

description: A deliciously ripe wine, full of fruit as well as a great mineral texture. It completely expresses the exceptional 2008 with all its structure. Still young, it's all fruit and freshness that promise serious bottle aging. Drink this complex, serious wine from 2017.
title: Louis Roederer 2008 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Extra Brut and the wine is also described as non dosé, meaning no dosage. So it's as dry as a bone while also being totally crisp, fresh and fruity. It also means that it needs to age in bottle to allow the mouthwatering acidity to soften a little. As it fills out, it will become an impressive wine that has pure fruits to go with the minerality. Keep until 2017.
designation: Oenophile Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2008 Oenophile Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is moving stylishly towards maturity, which is allowing the tangy orange and crisp apple flavors to develop toast and almond flavors and to deepen in richness. It's ripe, hinting at yellow fruits and still able to age, at least until 2020.
title: Drappier 2008 Millésime Exception Brut  (Champagne)

description: Tight with acidity and minerality, this is a precocious Champagne from a great vintage. Citrus and crisp apple flavors are allied to a strongly zesty character that brings out the chalk terroir of the Côte des Blancs in Champagne. Certainly the wine will age, so keep and drink from 2016.
title: Louis Roederer 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A lightly orange-colored Rosé that is made by macerating the grapes on the skins for 72 hours. The result is a soft wine, very dry while also showing a rounded character that gives richness. Ripe red fruits and a touch of grapefruit are sustained by a mineral texture. Drink now.
designation: Premium Rosé de Saignée Premier Cru Extra-Brut
title: J. Dumangin Fils 2008 Premium Rosé de Saignée Premier Cru Extra-Brut  (Champagne)

description: This dark-colored Rosé comes from a single vineyard in the village of Dizy. It is certainly dry as its Extra Brut description indicates, but it offers so much ripe red fruitiness that it is also rich and concentrated. There is bright acidity at the end. Drink now.
designation: Dizy Terres Rouges Extra Brut Rosé
title: Jacquesson et Fils 2008 Dizy Terres Rouges Extra Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: With its beautiful pale pink color and bright fruitiness, this delicious wine also has a good depth of texture, mineral strength and tight acidity. Even though it is now six years old, it is showing no sign of maturity, so drink from 2016.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2008 L'Intemporelle Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Still young and fruity, this is a wine with impressive potential. For now, enjoy the palest of Rosé colors, bright red fruits, and crisp and lively acidity. In the next several years, this will deepen and mellow, so keep and don't drink until 2017.
title: Louis Roederer 2008 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This beautifully fragrant offering is definitely on the dry side. It has a crisp apple flavor, accompanied by a citrus note and taut minerality. This nervy, feather-light wine is better fit for food than as an apéritif. Still young, it could age for several more years.
title: Aubry 2008 Ivoire et Ebéne Brut  (Champagne)

description: This serious, complex selection features a lively mousse. It balances ripe yellow and white fruits with powerful acidity. It is rounded with some bottle age, which gives it a toasty character. Drink now or age for several years.
designation: Symphorine Sélection Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Jean Milan 2008 Symphorine Sélection Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This 100% Pinot Noir bottling has weight and a sense of structure. It is dry and moderately tannic, with citrus and green apple flavors. It's a young, intensely textured wine, one that needs bottle aging for at least four years.
title: Tendil & Lombardi 2008 Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Taut and crisp, this is in the dry Gimonnet style. It is expressive and mineral driven, all citrus and green apple skin. Alongside this tense character, there is an elegance, with its bright acidity cutting through the fruit. This is food friendly.
designation: Cuvée Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2008 Cuvée Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Just beginning to mature, this balanced, ripe wine is complex, with bright acidity, toast and pear and green-plum fruits. It is rich, with a tight mouse that shows intensity as well as a stylish character. This is a fine wine just coming into its own but well worth aging further until 2020.
title: Moët & Chandon 2008 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: The producer held this wine back from release because it came from such a great ageworthy vintage-this is well worth the weight. With the wonderful richness of the 75% Pinot Noir dominating, this is a balanced wine, just hinting at toastiness, with concentrated ripe apple fruits melding into the texture of the wine.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2008 Les Echansons  (Champagne)

description: Interestingly released after the softer 2009 version of this wine, this 2008 vintage is beautifully balanced between crisp fruit and ripe maturity. With its red fruits still in place, it also has a toasty yeasty edge that is sophisticated and enticing. It is a superb wine, delicious to drink now although because of the quality of the vintage it will age for many more years, certainly into the 2020s.
title: Louis Roederer 2008 Cristal Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This latest incarnation of the famous brand is a superb wine. It is on par with, maybe even better than, the already legendary 2002. Its balance is impeccable: Apple and citrus flavors working with the tight minerality to give a textured yet fruity wine. Produced from Roederer's own vineyards which are mainly biodynamic, the wine has its own intense purity and crispness. It has amazing potential and is likely to age for many years. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Roederer 2008 Cristal Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Named after the daughter of owner Alain Thiénot, this elegant Champagne from grapes grown on the Montagne de Reims is just reaching maturity. It shows structure as well as ripe white fruits, with a citrus background. Drink now.
title: Thiénot 2008 Cuvée Garance Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This blanc de blancs, fermented and aged in wood, is a fine Champagne. Its mineral texture and light oxidative character from the use of wood is contrasted with the tight citrus fruitiness and nervy steely texture. The wine is just mature although still with plenty of fruit. Drink now.
title: Louise Brison 2008 Tendresse Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The latest release in this series of wines with its Belle Epoque bottle is, as always, a blend dominated by Chardonnay. So although the dosage is relatively high, that is balanced by fine acidity and minerality. It is a stylish wine, ripe and with the maturity to drink now.
title: Perrier Jouët 2008 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is the producer's prestige Cuvée, a fine perfumed blend with a great balance between the ripe fruitiness, the balanced dosage and a crisp edge of pink-grapefruit flavors. This impressive vintage with its hints of toasty maturity is ready to drink.
title: Joseph Perrier 2008 Cuvée Josephine Brut  (Champagne)

description: Almost entirely Chardonnay, with just a whisper of Pinot Noir, this is a dry Champagne. It is crisp, lively, steely and with great intensity. The apple and lemon flavors are just a part of this impressive wine that could age longer. Drink from 2019.
title: Le Brun de Neuville 2008 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Some wood aging for the Chardonnay in the blend of this mature vintage has given the wine its light toast and spice character. The wine is rich, smooth and generous with a full-bodied feel. It is now ready to drink.
title: Jean de la Fontaine 2008 La Majestueuse Brut Millesimé  (Champagne)

description: The latest vintage release from this producer based in Châlons-en-Champagne is very much in the house style with its crisp acidity and tight texture. It is towards the dry end of Brut with apple and citrus flavors and little sign yet of aging. Although this textured wine is ready to drink, it will be better from 2018.
title: Joseph Perrier 2008 Cuvée Royale Brut Vintage  (Champagne)

description: With some age, this bone-dry wine has softened and filled out. There's still a lemon aroma as well as crisp acidity on the palate, but they are less tight now, rounded and with a fine balance between fruit and acidity. It is still a year off maturity, so wait until 2018.
title: Lombard et Cie 2008 Brut Nature Grand Cru Millésime  (Champagne)

description: With its winery close to the Chardonnay heartland of the Côte des Blancs, it is no surprise that this massive cooperative can produce a fine Blanc de Blancs. This vintage iteration is mineral and full of tangy orange zest acidity. It also has a softer element from the dosage that comes through at the end to leave a balanced wine. Drink now.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte 2008 Millésime Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The wine in this 100% Pinot Noir comes from one of the top villages in the Montagne de Reims. It is rich, structured and with a youthful character despite its nine years . It has berry and rich plum fruits as well as a dry core of acidity. Drink this ageworthy Champagne from 2019.
designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut
title: G. H. Mumm 2008 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Only produced in magnums, this Champagne is crisp, tight and with intense acidity. It is tangy, salty with lemon and grapefruit flavors. It is only just ready to drink, the magnum allowing it to age more slowly. Best to drink from 2018.
title: Esterlin 2008 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Dominated by rich Chardonnay, this is a ripe wine. Acidity and a mineral texture are foils to the rich apple and green-plum flavors, giving a balance between deliciously crisp and a fuller style. It is just about ready to drink but will be better from 2018.
title: Besserat de Bellefon 2008 Cuvée des Moines Brut Millésime  (Champagne)

description: This light wine is still tangy and full of fruit. There are hints of age with a toasty character although that is balanced by the crisp apple acidity. So it is zesty, full of life and ready to drink.
title: Claude Baron 2008 Cuvée Topaze Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Chardonay and Pinot Noir are both present in this apple and pear flavored wine. A lively mousse brings out the fruit and acidity, giving a tangy, bright wine that's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Rolet Pére et Fils 2008 Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Jura)

description: This Blanquette (made with 90% Mauzac) offers a bouquet full of bright crisp red apple and melon core. The texture is creamy with fine bubbles and medium acidity, and the palate is loaded with satisfying sweet citrus rind and toasty brioche flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Rives-Blanques 2008 Brut Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: Sparkling Vouvray, full of rich fruit, with layers of almonds, toasted bread and intense acidity. It is a tangy wine, with an apple skin texture over a light creamy mousse.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2008 Cuvée T Brut  (Vouvray)

description: A sumptuous wine, creamy and nutty, full of ripe apples, touched by yeast. It is fresh and rich, very dry, a toasty character yielding to final crisp, clean acidity.
title: Château Moncontour 2008 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: Whether it's the biodynamic vineyard or the ripeness of the fruit, this is certainly a rich, full-bodied wine. It's fruity and forward, although it's structure and minerality lendimpressive character. The aftertaste is fruity, fresh and bone dry.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2009 Eclipse Crémant Blanc Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This is a yeasty offering that's full on the palate, with a rich mousse. Yellow and white fruits contribute to its richness, a touch of bitterness balanced with the fruity acidity. Drink now, or age for a year.
title: Wunsch & Mann 2009 Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Produced from selected wines, this top of the range Rosé is a textured, complex wine. It has ripe fruit reflected in the raspberry flavor and tight acidity. The texture shows minerality as well as intense fruitiness. Drink this fine wine from 2017.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2009 Vive la Joie Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is yeasty, bearing crisp flavors of pear and green apple, with a taut lemon-zest texture and a firm edge of minerality. It needs at least three years in bottle.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2009 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is the top wine from this sparkling-wine specialist based in northern Burgundy, close to Chablis. Fruit and richness come from long aging before disgorgement, adding a full texture to the citrus and apple fruitiness. It is a blend of 50/50 Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, ready to drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2009 Vive-la-Joie Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This perfumed wine has just the right color and lively, crisp acidity. The full-bodied feel is very much the house style of this producer, giving richness from ripe red fruits as well as balanced acidity to finish. The wine is generous and ready to drink.
title: Pol Roger 2009 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Produced by the Baroville cooperative in the Aube, this rich, rounded wine has balanced fruit that is just beginning to show some good aging. Toast and almonds are coming through the tight white-fruit texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Barfontarc 2009 Cuvée Sainte Germaine Brut  (Champagne)

description: The crisp, mineral Chardonnay in this wine is keeping it fresh and still young. With acidity and tight citrus flavors, it has a dense texture that dominates the white-stone fruits, suggesting it should age a little longer. Drink from 2020.
title: Canard-Duchêne 2009 Authentic Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: With fruit from the Côte des Blancs, this is a classic, textured, mineral-driven Chardonnay Champagne. Its bottle age gives a toasty edge to the crisp, lively grapefruit and bitter orange flavors. Well balanced, this impressive wine is still likely to improve with aging. Drink now, but, better, wait until 2020.
title: Pol Roger 2009 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)

description: While initially soft, this wine then develops a crisper side that comes from the red-currant flavors. It also has some toasty touches and hints of maturity. Taken together, these elements have produced a rich wine, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Moët & Chandon 2009 Grand Vintage Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is the top Champagne from this cooperative brand. Based in the Marne Valley, the producer specializes in Pinot Meunier, as shown in this half-and-half blend with Chardonnay. It is a ripe, generous and warm wine that keeps a tight texture and is now showing hints of yeasty maturity. Drink now.
title: Dom Caudron 2009 Sublimité 50/50  (Champagne)

description: Taking advantage of the natural richness of this vintage, this wine is ripe and soft, hinting at yeastiness as well as retaining plenty of attractive acidity. This balanced wine is powerfully rich and ready to drink now.
title: Moët & Chandon 2009 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: This producer, unlike most Champagne firms, does not let its wines go through malolactic fermentation, ensuring that the acidity remains intense and fresh. The policy results in crisp, mineral-driven, dry wines like this, which also age well. This prestige Cuvée offers great citrus fruit, a strong tight texture and aging potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Alfred Gratien 2009 Cuvée Paradis Brut  (Champagne)

description: The latest vintage release from this producer, this is beautifully balanced with white fruits and touches of citrus paralleled by a tight mineral texture and acidity. It is still young, because vintages from this producer age for many years. Drink from 2020.
title: Pol Roger 2009 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still young, this complex, rich wine deserves aging. It has rich acidity as well as rounded apple and pear flavors. This producer, based in the Aube, has taken advantage of the ripe grapes of the region to keep the wine dry, bringing out minerality and fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Philippe Fourrier 2009 Cuvée Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: Dominated by Chardonnay, this well-aged wine is ripe and creamy. Balancing acidity reinforces the smooth texture, yeasty character and great elegance. Apple and citrus flavors are sustained by the tight mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2009 Noble Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Produced from a 2.5-acre parcel of vines planted in 1949, this is a sophisticated wine. It has a fine balance of fruit, maturity and concentration. Its fruit richness lends weight and a fast-maturing quality. Drink from 2018.
designation: Mes Vieilles Vignes Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: José Dhondt 2009 Mes Vieilles Vignes Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The latest incarnation of this famous Champagne now comes from Roderer's own vineyards, a good portion of which are run on biodynamic lines. This still-young wine has great depth and richness, a beautiful balance between ripe fruit and crisp texture that make it alive, crisp and bright. As it matures, it will deepen and become even more intense. Drink now if you must, but preferably wait until 2019.
title: Louis Roederer 2009 Cristal Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still young but already impressive, this new vintage of Cristal Rosé is dry and perfumed, packed with fruit and tightened by acidity. It features red fruit, zesty blood orange and ripe apple flavors. Because it is young and because it is dry, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Roederer 2009 Cristal Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This rich wine is full of ripe white and citrus fruits that combine easily with the tangy, tight texture that comes from the dominance of Pinot Noir in the blend. It is still young, the sort of wine that needs to age to bring out its full potential. Drink this very fine vintage from 2018.
title: Louis Roederer 2009 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: From a ripe vintage, this soft, generous wine has a good balance between its acidity and its smooth, creamy character. The wine is crisp now and could probably do with some bottle age to bring out its inherent richness. Wait until 2018.
title: Taittinger 2009 Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This Champagne offers rich yellow fruit and crisp white stone fruits balanced with a full texture. Hints of the wood used in fermentation add to the ripe feel. Still a little young, it will be much better from 2019.
designation: Gentilhomme Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: A.R. LenobleÂ  2009 Gentilhomme Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced from Grand and Premier Cru vines in the Côte des Blancs, this crisp, mineral-driven wine has intense acidity, citrus flavors and a tight, steely texture. Still young, it needs to age and will be best from 2018.
title: Jacquart 2009 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: One of a range of top Cuvées from this cooperative in the grand cru village of Mailly, this is a Pinot Noir-dominated wine, fashionably pale in color with a good balance between crisp red fruits and tight, nervy acidity. A touch of tannin gives structure to this elegant wine. Drink now.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2009 L'Intemporelle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a rich wine that's full of crisp fruit notes, with a touch of minerality. Ripe yellow fruits and melon come to the fore, balanced by the attractive acidity and tangy aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Vollereaux 2009 Brut Tradition Millésime  (Champagne)

description: This is a serious wine, with its mineral texture and tangy structure. It has plenty of apple and zingy orange flavors. But the main thrust at this stage is of a wine poised for considerable aging. Fresh and still tight, it needs several years. Drink from 2018.
designation: Cuvée Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2009 Cuvée Fleuron Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine is bone-dry, although with some age the shock of the acidity has been rounded out by a hint of toast. It's linear, fresh and intensely crisp, with citrus and almond tones. Drink this wine from a good vintage now.
title: Aubry 2009 Le Nombre d'Or Brut Nature Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a beautiful wine, so crisp, taut and refreshing. It brings out the fragrance and freshness of the chalk vineyards of the Côte de Blancs, fruity with apples and citrus. Still young although already balanced, the wine will age for several years and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Louis Roederer 2009 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Already showing maturity, this is a rich wine, despite its low dosage. It shows layers of Pinot Noir from premier cru vineyards on the Montagne de Reims. With ripe fruit flavors that are generous in texture, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Henriet-Bazin 2009 Premier Cru Brut Nature Millésime  (Champagne)

description: This is a ripe style of Champagne, rounded and rich, from a 60-40 Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend. The structure of the Pinot gives it ripe apple and Rocha pear flavors, well cut by acidity and with a soft, full, creamy aftertaste. The wine is still young and will be better drunk from 2017.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2009 L'Intemporelle Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: This wine is still young, very fresh in its crisp acidity and lemon and grapefruit flavors. It has the potential to age well, with an underlay of tension between fruit and mineral texture. It is complex, structured and needs to mature further. Drink from 2018.
title: Chanoine 2009 Tsarine Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This young wine is fruity and fresh, perfumed with spice and lemon blossom. The tight texture will soften as the wine ages to bring out the warmth and richness of the vintage. Keep this long-term wine and drink from 2018.
designation: Premier Cru Blanc de Noirs Bisseuil Brut
title: A.R. LenobleÂ  2009 Premier Cru Blanc de Noirs Bisseuil Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: From its base in the Marne Valley, Blin has access to the best Pinot Meunier. This rare Champagne-100% Pinot Meunier-has a richness and open fruitiness that impart ripe character, but with a tight, dry edge. The lightest pink color, it's not quite a Rosé, although it certainly has some raspberry flavors as well as orange zest and a tangy texture. Drink from 2016.
designation: Quintessence Meunier Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut
title: H. Blin 2009 Quintessence Meunier Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)

description: Ripe and still young, this crisp, mineral-textured wine is packed with citrus flavors that bring out acidity and a bright, fresh character. It needs time to fully integrate the dosage and the wine and bring out the full potential, so wait until 2017.
title: Gremillet 2009 Millésimé Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: The latest vintage of Roederer Rosé shows all the finesse of which this producer is capable. It has fruit and the merest touches of bottle age. Red berries shine alongside the mineral texture and the pure line of crisp acidity. It's a beautiful Champagne that could age longer.
title: Louis Roederer 2009 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Although this wine is labeled Brut, it is in fact right at the driest end of that category. Bone dry, therefore, while full of white fruits and crisp lemon zest flavors. The texture is tight, steely and speaks strongly of the chalk of the soil. It is still young, so this vintage wine can be drunk now for its fruitiness or left until 2016 for a more rounded, toasty character.
designation: Cuvée Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2009 Cuvée Gastronome Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a fresh, still-young wine packed with citrus and white fruits. It has strong layers of acidity, a tight texture and a mineral aftertaste. There is a considerable depth of flavor here, a wine that delves deep into the textured fruitiness. It's a wine for aging, so wait until 2016 before drinking.
designation: Symphorine Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Jean Milan 2009 Symphorine Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A wonderfully textured and fruity wine that comes from vineyard in Damery on the slopes of the Montagne de Reims. It is steely with a chalky texture that marches with the fresh apple fruits and crisp acidity. Still young, it will be better from 2016.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2009 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Milan is a specialist in Blanc de Blancs wines, and this is a top-quality example of that skill. It is as crisp as possible, very tight and bright. With a nervy, mineral character it speaks of the chalk soil of the vineyards. This is still young, very drinkable now while also ready to age for several more years.
designation: Terres de Noël Vieilles Vignes Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Jean Milan 2009 Terres de Noël Vieilles Vignes Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Extra Brut, yes, but the ripeness of the Chardonnay gives a rich, creamed apple character that balances the very dry aftertaste. It is still a fledgling Champagne needing to fill out. Give this until 2016 before drinking.
designation: Inattendue Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut
title: Huré Fréres 2009 Inattendue Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Now approaching maturity although certainly not leaving its fruit behind, this is a fine structured wine. It has hints of toastiness as well as spice while keeping bright acidity and a tangy texture. The wine is rich still tense and ready to drink.
designation: Monsieur Léonard Brut Blanc de Blancs Millésime
title: Marie Copinet 2009 Monsieur Léonard Brut Blanc de Blancs Millésime Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Designer Philippe Starck was involved in the blending and label design of this Champagne. It is a pure crisp white-fruit-flavored wine, almost austere with intense acidity. Like many great bone dry Champagnes it will need to age to allow the spare lines of the wine to fill out. Drink this bottling from 2019.
title: Louis Roederer 2009 Philippe Starck Brut Nature  (Champagne)

description: Based in Epernay, this cooperative has produced a crisp balanced wine. A zesty, lightly mineral texture gives shape and precision to the citrus fruit and bright aftertaste. It is still young, so drink this vintage wine from 2019.
title: Esterlin 2009 Brut Nature  (Champagne)

description: There is a distinct tannic edge to this 100% Pinot Noir Champagne. It gives a firm character and with spice as well as red fruits and citrus. These elements, not quite integrated, show the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2019.
designation: Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature
title: Joseph Perrier 2009 Cuvée Royale Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This is an attractively fruity wine, with an apple flavor and a creamy, full-in-the-mouth mousse. It's fragrant and refreshing, with final rich acidity.
title: Alpha Loire 2009 Belle de Nuit Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: This is a deliciously ripe wine, aged in wood to give roundness to the blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay. It is full bodied and rich in the mouth with orange and pineapple flavors giving a great lift to the mineral texture.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay 2009 Trésor  (Saumur)

description: Accented by a light touch of honey, this attractive wine is fruity, with a nutty underlying texture and a rich body. Full and ripe, it could age until 2016 although it's quite ready to drink.
title: Vignoble Brisebarre 2009 Cuvée Millesimé Brut  (Vouvray)

description: One of the top sparkling Vouvrays, Cuvée Prédilection brings out richness, depth of green and white fruit flavors balanced by refreshing acidity. Touches of yeast and toast add complexity to this bone-dry yet ripe wine.
title: Château Moncontour 2009 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: A golden color and a nose of honeyed evolution, reminiscent of fresh field mushrooms and chalk already hint at a vintage wine. The palate surprises with the most gentle, generous and balmy fruit, like an essence of peach, without resorting to any sweetness added by dosage. Its fruity freshness is truly astonishing. This is an evolved, gloriously fresh testament to what Crémant d'Alsace can be. This might work better alongside food than as an apéritif. In any case: let it speak to you and savor the long finish.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2010 Trilogie Dosage Zero Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Hints of ripe peach creep in with the yellow plum notes on the nose. The palate adds a generous if frothy creaminess to these flavors, making them fizz and fill the mouth with their fruity freshness. Behind all this lurks a grown-up backdrop of biscuity richness that allows for a restrained dosage and a very dry finish. Lovely now, will benefit from bottle age. Drink 2016-2019.
title: Joseph Cattin 2010 Grande Cuvée Brut Millesimé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Strong, attractive apple aromas also give the flavor profile of this fresh and fruity wine. It has a light tangy, zesty texture, fresh acidity and a bright, mineral aftertaste.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2010 Plaisir Perlant Millesimé Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A full-bodied, deliciously ripe blend of Pinot Blanc, Auxerrois and Pinot Noir, this is spiced with apples and crisp grapefruit acidity. Rich and creamy yet fresh, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Albert Mann 2010 Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A blend of Pinots (hence the P in the wine's name)-Gris, Blanc and Noir-this is a rich, full in the mouth wine. It has weight with a touch of spice as well as crisp acidity. Likely to age a few months more.
title: Cave de Cleebourg 2010 Symphonie en P Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Touches of red fruits give this soft and creamy wine attractive acidity. Pepper and spice lead to a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château de Piote 2010 Perles Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: Named after the delicious perfume that wafts across the vineyards in the evening, Egarade is a fine example of how close in character Crémant de Bourgogne is to many Champagnes. It has just the right steely character, crisp and structured, a very mineral feel to the aftertaste.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2010 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A new concept from this Aí¿-based producer, this wine showcases pure Pinot Noir from some of its finest parcels. The wine has weight and richness while not losing sight of elegance. The fruit is just beginning to mature, showing a crisp texture while promising a broader vision in the future. Drink from 2021.
title: Deutz 2010 Parcelles d'Aí¿ Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Pinot Noir from Cumiéres at the entry to the Marne Valley forms the basis of this rich, structured wine. Still young although with mature richness in sight, this dry wine relies on its ripe fruit to counterbalance the low dosage. In a year, maybe two, it will be splendid. Drink from 2019.
title: Joseph Perrier 2010 Blanc de Noirs Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This wine is rich, ready to drink and full bodied. It has weight, with hints of yellow fruits as well as crisper citrus. A strong streak of minerality cuts through the wine, giving texture. Drink now.
title: Lallier 2010 Millésime Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Now mature, this rich wine is beautifully balanced. Ripe fruitiness contrasts with minerality and a tight texture. The touches of toast and lively acidity are part of the maturing process of the wine. Drink now, although it will be better from 2020.
title: Régine Baron 2010 Cuvée Topaz Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: From a producer with a panoply of Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is balanced and perfumed. The crisp texture and taut red fruit contrast with the generous richness of this still-young wine. It needs to age a bit more. Drink from 2019.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2010 L'Intemporelle Rosé Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Claude Baron and daughters Lisa, Aline and Clare are at the heart of this structured blend of 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir. Just now mature, it retains plenty of freshness and acidity, but the tautness has softened and opened to reveal a tangy, fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Claude Baron 2010 Cuvée Topaz Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: A small part of the Chardonnay in this blend was vinified in wood. Along with the aging, the wine offers richness, toastiness and layers of perfumed, ripe fruit. The aftertaste is crisp. Drink now.
designation: Jean de la Fontaine La Majestueuse Brut Millésimé
title: Baron Albert 2010 Jean de la Fontaine La Majestueuse Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: With its high proportion of Chardonnay, this wine has both richness and a tight texture. It is just approaching maturity, but the bright white fruits and citrus are still present, bringing out the acidity. Let it age further and drink from 2020.
title: Louis Nouvelot 2010 Topaze Millésime  (Champagne)

description: This wine is still young, reveling in its bright fruit and mineral texture. Drawn from Côte des Blancs vineyards, it's tight, tense and loaded with citrus fruit. With its finely crisp aftertaste, it's delicious now for its fruit but will also be great from 2020, once its toasty character develops more fully.
title: Deutz 2010 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)

description: This wine, though still young, reveals much about the Deutz style as well as the vintage. It strikes a balance between softness and crispness that fits the ethos of the house. At the same time, it's an attractive medium-term bottling, in line with what many producers acheived in 2010. It should be kept until 2019.
title: Deutz 2010 Brut  (Champagne)

description: This pale Rosé is showing its maturity at seven years of age, its fruitiness transforming into extra richness, with touches of toast. It's a very fine wine, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Deutz 2010 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Based in the Côte des Blancs Grand Cru village of Oger, this producer draws on some very fine vines. That superior fruit gives this vintage wine its texture, minerality and intensity. Crisp with acidity and a flinty texture, it still needs further time to develop. Drink from 2019.
designation: Neyrot Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut
title: Demiére-Ansiot 2010 Neyrot Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This producer releases a vintage Champagne almost every year. This latest release shows the character of a vintage widely regarded as difficult. It's fast maturing, with soft fruit, attractive acidity, just a touch of toast and a mineral structure. Drink now.
title: Lété-Vautrain 2010 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This potentially rich Champagne is still young. The Chardonnay and Pinot Noir that dominate the blend show tight acidity, minerality and a tangy, orange-like edge. Give it time to mature, and it will be splendid.
title: Boude Baudin 2010 Cuvée St Clément  (Champagne)

description: Based in the Côte des Blancs, this producer has made a soft, ripe style of Blanc de Blancs. It's smooth and creamy in texture, drinkable now with its hint of toastiness balanced by crisper apple flavors.
designation: Grand Bouquet Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Vazart Coquart & Fils 2010 Grand Bouquet Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This latest Blanc de Blancs vintage from Roederer is well poised and balanced, already offering a hint of toast, while the minerality is prominent. It is in a dry style, relying on the ripe fruit to soften the impact of the acidity. A beautiful wine, ready to drink.
title: Louis Roederer 2010 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is an aromatic, balanced and smooth wine. With its poise between acidity, fragrant white fruits and touch of toast, it has concentration and richness. On the dry side of brut, it's crisp and delicate on the one hand and intense on the other. Drink now.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2010 L'Intemporelle Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still young, this blend of Pinot Noir, with a small amount of Pinot Meunier, is crisp with bright citrus and white fruits. Richness and a touch of tannin give structure. The acidity cuts through at the end, offering a zesty, tight aftertaste. Drink this vintage from 2017.
title: Pannier 2010 Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne)

description: This young vintage Champagne is drinkable now because it is made from Pinot Meunier, which has produced a fruity, softly textured and balanced wine. It offers a touch of pepper as well as ripe red-currant and lime fruits. It's tightly crisp at the end.
designation: Quintessence Meunier Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut
title: H. Blin 2010 Quintessence Meunier Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)

description: With 80% Chardonnay barrel-fermented and 20% Pinot Noir from vat, this prestige Cuvée is ripe, with the fruit softening towards a more mature character. A tang of orange zest gives a crisp texture that contrasts with the spicy, rich aftertaste. The wine from the family's small vineyards in the Marne Valley is still developing; drink from 2018.
title: Liebart-Régnier 2010 Confidencia Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a blend of premier and grand cru Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Vintages from the difficult 2010 harvest are rare, so this wine with its soft texture and smooth fruit is an exception. Already mature, it offers hints of almonds as well as ripe fruits. Ready to drink, it's rich in the middle and crisp at the end.
title: Jacquart 2010 Cuvée Alpha Brut  (Champagne)

description: This single-parcel, partially barrel-fermented Champagne is in effect a Blanc de Noirs. If all that sounds complicated (and so does the name of the wine), the wine itself is much easier to appreciate. It is certainly rich, with a touch of tannin and mineral texture. Full of ripe white fruits, it offers good acidity at the end. It could age longer; drink from 2017.
designation: Fins Lieux No 1 Millésimé Grand Cru Brut
title: Pehu-Simonet 2010 Fins Lieux No 1 Millésimé Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Made from Grand Cru vineyards in Mesnil-sur-Oger on the Côte des Blancs, this beautiful wine is maturing well. The ripe, creamy pineapple and spice character has softened the natural minerality of the texture. Full in the mouth, ripe and rounded, the wine will age more, so drink now, or better, keep until 2017.
designation: Fins Lieux No 5 Grand Cru Brut
title: Pehu-Simonet 2010 Fins Lieux No 5 Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Beautifully crisp and fresh, this is a young, tightly textured wine that is already so refreshing. Its red fruit character is just a part of the mineral and tannin texture and the pure line of fragrant acidity. Very pale in color, this sophisticated wine could do with some aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Louis Roederer 2010 Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Marie-Amélie is the daughter of the Henriets and her Cuvée is a fine blend of ripe fruits from the difficult 2010 vintage. It has a crisp element as well as fresh acidity and delicious apple juice and ripe pear flavors. A crisper element gives a balanced wine that has soft acidity at the end.
designation: Marie-Amélie Fleur de Vigne Premier Cru Brut
title: Henriet-Bazin 2010 Marie-Amélie Fleur de Vigne Premier Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Still young and fruity, this wine is totally integrated, harmoniously blending the red fruits with a tight texture and fresh acidity. Although it is drinkable now, it will benefit from bottle age, so best drink from 2017.
title: J. M. Gobillard et Fils 2010 Cuvée Prestige Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: A fresh, grapefruit and citrus flavored Champagne, this is intensely crisp. It is all fruit with just a hint of zesty texture to give some shape. It could age in bottle for a few more months, so drink from 2016.
title: Jean Josselin 2010 Millésime Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is a floral, mineral wine, both tight and exuberant in its perfumed character. Green apple and spices combine with the textured character of this balanced wine-lively, fruity and with fine acidity. It comes in a bottle that was common in the Victorian era, slightly narrower at the base.
designation: Esprit de Victoria Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs
title: Joseph Perrier 2010 Esprit de Victoria Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This producer, based on the northern slopes of the Montagne de Reims, has created a tight vintage wine that is still young. With its 70% Pinot Noir it has a dry, almost tannic edge that will soften to bring out the ripe pear and apricot flavors. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.
title: Henriet-Bazin 2010 Millésime Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: This ripe wine is still young. It has a taut texture that's dominated by the lively white fruit and crisp acidity. There's a mineral streak that cuts through the wine to give a steely texture that will soften over the next year. Drink from the end of 2018.
title: Voirin-Jumel 2010 Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Fermented in oak, this wine with its crisp apple aroma is ripe and spicy. It has great citrus and white fruit plus a dry character that gives it both a tang and a mineral texture. Drink this crisp balanced wine now.
title: Louise Brison 2010 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: A tight wine with notes of almond and green fruit that add tension to the structure. The acidity is dominant in this complex, textured wine. It could age beautifully over the next 2-3 years.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay 2010 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

description: A fruity sparkling wine, touched by apricots and citrus. It is very floral in character, with a bright mousse and clean, fresh acidity to finish.
title: Domaine Pichot 2010 Brut  (Vouvray)

description: This sparkling Vouvray has weight and richness, balanced by intense acidity and a crisp green-salad texture. Lemon zest and quince flavors add the fruit element. It will benefit from another two years in bottle.
title: Château Moncontour 2010 Cuvée Prédilection  (Vouvray)

description: Savory spiced apple with complex autolytic overtones of stone, oatmeal, soy and baked apple lend a rich, rounded to the nose and palate. There is real character in the classy, slender structure and the lingering taste is satisfyingly clean and long.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2011 Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Chalky, stony notes come to the forefront on this austere, restrained, non-dosed vintage crémant. The taut texture carries green apple and citrus tones, with a satisfying, savory soy sauce backdrop. This is poised and precise, fresh and refreshing, clean and structured-a testament to the nobility of Chardonnay.
title: Boeckel 2011 Extra Brut Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This is a very slender, taut, fresh and citrus-focused Crémant with aromatic overtones of aloe vera, green apple and citrus foliage. Showing wonderful precision and balance, the slendern and fresh characters combine to make for a very invigorating, delicious drink.
title: Henri Schoenheitz 2011 Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Frothy, fresh, lemony and light-this uncomplicated, slightly earthy crémant is ideal apéritif material with its easy-drinking, light-footed character. There's a lemony lift on the finish that's rather moreish.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2011 Cométe Pinot Blanc (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Creamy aromas predominate on the nose and carry through to a round, rich palate. This is generous, full and bready, with a lot of earthy flavors on the midpalate. While there is balance, there is little fruit and lots of yeasty character.
title: Sipp Mack 2011 Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Already showing some toasty maturity, this blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir is delicate, yeasty and rounded. Coming from northern Burgundy, it has a cool climate feel, textured with orange zest and the crispest acidity. It is ready to drink, although another few years in bottle will improve it even more.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2011 Egarade  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wine is made from Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. The well-balanced palate is textured and mineral driven, with a crisp white-fruit flavor that comes together well. This can be enjoyed now, although it will be better from 2020.
title: Louis Roederer 2011 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Always a light, ethereal style of wine, this is also very fresh and still young. It will age with its taut minerality from the Chardonnay in the blend. A softer background will become toasty over the next few years. The vintage date on this bottle is 200 years after the foundation of this producer. Drink from 2021.
title: Perrier Jouët 2011 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)

description: Fruit from selected vineyards went into this ripe wine. Smoothly textured, it has hints of minerality but much more of ripe white fruits with touches of toastiness. It could do with some more time, so drink from 2020.
title: V. Testulat 2011 Cuvée Paul-Vincent Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine shows the wonderful Pinot Meunier grown in this village close to Reims. Rich and very approachable at seven years, the wine also has a great texture and taut character that keeps it lively and complex. Drink now.
designation: Les Meuniers de Clémence Extra Brut
title: Lelarge-Pugeot 2011 Les Meuniers de Clémence Extra Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)

description: This young wine needs plenty of bottle age. At the same time its rich potential is all there with ripe fruits, apple and peach flavors, and tight acidity. A lower dosage than for the nonvintage wines from this producer allows the fruit to sing. Drink from 2020.
title: Montaudon 2011 Millesimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Dominated by Chardonnay, this tight and textured wine is still young, giving it bright acidity, a strong mineral texture and a zesty aftertaste. It is going to develop well, bringing in richness from the Pinot Noir and more yeasty characters from the Chardonnay. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2020.
title: Liebart-Régnier 2011 Confidencia Brut  (Champagne)

description: Produced from two parcels on the Montagne de Reims, this dry yet soft wine is ripe and richly fruity. Still young, its minerality and bright fruitiness are firmly intact. It will be a delicious Champagne as it matures. Drink from 2019.
designation: Inattendue Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs
title: Huré Fréres 2011 Inattendue Extra Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced from old vines in the Grand Cru vineyards of Chouilly in the Côte des Blancs, this is a beautifully crisp, ripe wine, showing taut fruit and fine, stylish acidity. As a Special Club bottling, it adheres to stringent qualitative guidelines set out by an elite group of growers. Still young, it will be best from 2019.
designation: Special Club Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Grand Cru Brut
title: Roland Champion 2011 Special Club Blanc de Blancs Chouilly Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is the family's top wine-a blend of selected Pinot Noir and Chardonnay lots from their 25 acres. Made to be aged, it still shows its extra-crisp fruit and acidity, needing time to soften and bring out its full, rich potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Liebart-Régnier 2011 Excélia Brut  (Champagne)

description: A blend of grapes from Cumiéres in the Marne Valley and the Côte des Blancs, this is a rich, well-balanced and very young brut Rosé. It is ripe, while keeping an almost austere texture and acidity that will soften and broaden out as it ages. Drink now for the lively red fruits, but better to wait until 2019.
title: Louis Roederer 2011 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Beautifully balanced, this wine is both fresh and creamy. It is still young and at its crispest, needing some time. Acidity, citrus and green plum fruits are there along with a tight, mineral texture. The future will bring out more of the wine's creamy character and soften it. Drink from 2017.
designation: Ivoire et Ebéne Premier Cru Brut
title: Aubry 2011 Ivoire et Ebéne Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Still young, this is a ripe fruit-driven wine. It suggests green apple slices as well as warmer yellow fruits that give richness. It should be aged to bring out greater texture and character. Drink from 2017.
title: Veuve Doussot 2011 Cuvée Ernestine Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: As befits a producer whose vines are on the Montagne de Reims, this blend is dominated by Pinot Noir. This vintage is tangy with a toasty nutty character while still retaining plenty of youthful fruit. It is dry, textured and likely to be at its best from 2019.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2011 L'Intemporelle Brut  (Champagne)

description: With almost five years of aging on its lees, this is now a rich mature wine. It has a toasty, spicy character to balance the still-vibrant white-fruit flavors. The acidity is a foil to the richness of the wine, cutting through and giving a crisp, always mature aftertaste.
title: Petit & Bajan 2011 Ambrosie Brut Grand Cru  (Champagne)

description: Delicately sparkling, this creamy Champagne is crisp, fruity and on the dry side of Brut. It has citrus as well as pear flavors giving a fruity edge to the lively texture. This delicious wine should age a little longer, so drink from 2019.
designation: Nuit Blanche Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Petit & Bajan 2011 Nuit Blanche Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This ripe wine from the Montagne de Reims is dominated by its 75% Pinot Noir. That gives a rich wine, full of ripe berry and citrus fruits and with a strong edge of tannin and minerality. It is young-a vintage that needs to age. Drink this firm, youthful wine from 2019.
title: Mailly Grand Cru 2011 Extra Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)

description: This taut, tight wine is impressive. The mineral texture and crisp white fruits combine into a harmonious wine that is full of apple and pear flavors. It comes from the Grand Cru village of Avize, reflecting the chalk soil in its structure. Drink from 2019.
designation: Blanche Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs
title: Waris Hubert 2011 Blanche Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: With just the merest hint of bubbles, this is a bright, breezy wine, very herbaceous in its clean character. The bubbles and the wine sit uneasily together, resulting in a wine that's not altogether balanced. Screwcap.
title: François Lurton 2011 Fumées Blanches Lightly Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Vin Pétillant)

description: Fruity and crisp, this is a lively, bright wine. It has good acidity and a gentle mousse that give lift to the palate. Apple fruits and a fresh feel set this up as a great apéritif wine.
title: Fabrice Closset 2011 Sparkling (Crémant de Jura)

description: This is a crisp and inviting sparkling wine, with bright notes of citrus and apple that are accented by hints of toast. An approachable and wallet-friendly quaff, perfect for holiday entertaining.
title: Saint-Hilaire 2011 Brut Estate Bottled Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: Aged four years before release, this ripe apple and honey-flavored wine is soft, rich and generous in texture. The lively mousse is counterbalanced by the ripe Chardonnay and Chenin Blanc to give a wine that is bright while also concentrated. Drink now.
title: Cave Robert & Marcel 2011 De Chanceny Impetus Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: A full and rich wine, it is packed with pepper and spice flavors as well as the crispest apple fruits. A young wine that could age, it is still tight and mineral although showing a fragrant character.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay 2011 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

description: One of the best sparkling wines to come from the Loire, this is a classically driven wine, packed with tingling acidity along with some toastiness and apple fruits. The wine is still fresh and could age a few more months in bottle.
title: Château Moncontour 2011 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: Soft notes of Golden Delicious on the nose really unfold on the palate. The body is slender but the fruit notes have a honeyed quality, as befits a vintage Crémant. Its biscuity shortcrust flavours are accentuated by soft mousse and are a great counterpoint to the very refreshing, pleasantly light-weight body. The finish is creamy and full of yeasty roundness, yet beautifully dry.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2012 Cométe Brut Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Notes of creamy apple on the nose also pervade the palate where they are joined by a more bitter element that lends both structure and pleasant backbone. In spirit, this is sprightly and pure and brings lots and lots of honest, frothy refreshment.
title: Domaine Pfister 2012 Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Exquisitely fragrant notes of ripe, aromatic apples rise from the glass: tart, fruity and fresh in equal measure. The palate shows both evolved autolysis by way of soy-spiced breadiness and even more fruit in the way of bruised, tart apple notes of great purity. The finish is long and full of flavor, complex, nuanced and resolutely dry.
title: Zusslin 2012 Clos Liebenberg Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Notes of chalk, bread and stone precede the bruised apple notes on this beautiful, elegant vintage Crémant. On the palate, the apple notes become fuller and rounder and appear like mellow, baked Golden Delicious. There is purity, structure and precision in the autolytic notes which are supported by pure citrus and apple freshness, leaving the palate impressed but not weighed down. Hints of spice develop in the background while all the freshness makes for a lip-smacking, long and savory finish.
title: Boeckel 2012 Extra Brut Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Enticing notes of ripe yellow apples make for an utterly appetizing opening. The flavors swirl even more exuberantly on the palate, assisted by soft dosage which boosts the fruitiness. This is counteracted by crisp freshness and a soft mousse. The palate finishes dry with lovely notes of apple and honey.
title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2012 Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Lovely notes of Golden Pearmain apple perfume the nose, with hints of soy sauce. The body and palate are luminous showing green apple freshness that come across as light, graceful and authentic. There is something honest and fresh-faced about this wine that is rather disarming. This is a very beautiful, classy crémant made from a blend of Riesling and Auxerrois.
title: Zusslin 2012 Clos Liebenberg Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Very soft, faint strawberry nose hints at freshness and summery fruit. The palate foams frothily but carries some bitter edges. Nonetheless, the lemony core makes this zero dosage a refreshing, light-hearted apéritif.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2012 Poussiére d'Étoiles Pinot Noir (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Earth dominates the citrus fruit notes on the nose. On the equally lemony palate there is a touch of bitterness and some earthy notes, but the finish is clean, fresh and invigorating.
title: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2012 Prestige Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Tight and sharp, this is an herbaceous wine with a strongly citrus character. The aftertaste has some spice.
title: Château de Piote 2012 Perles  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: With some maturity, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. Its crisp fruitiness has been tempered with a more toasty, yeasty character that adds complexity. The wine has good depth, with spice and a steely minerality coming together with the fruit. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2012 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wine, from a range of Champagnes that highlights grand cru villages, is still very young, with taut acidity and considerable minerality. From Cramant on the Côte des Blancs, it is developing into a fine wine and has richness, great fruit and a taut texture. Let the wine soften and drink from 2021.
designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Blancs Brut Grand Cru
title: 94pointsG. H. Mumm 2012 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Blancs Brut Grand Cru  (Champagne)Cellar Selection

description: This explosive, ripe wine is part of a trilogy that the producer has made from three of the greatest villages in Champagne. This tense, mineral-driven wine is rich with white fruits. It is still young, so wait until 2020.
title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Avize Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine is one of a trilogy of individual village wines from the Côte des Blancs. It is just moving out of youth and growing up, hinting at the toastiness to come. However, it has kept its intense minerality from the chalk soil of the Côte des Blancs. Drink this structured wine from 2020.
title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Oger Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Produced from fruit grown on the Côte des Blancs, the heart of Chardonnay in Champagne, this wine is both richly mineral and deliciously fruity. Dry and tense, this vintage wine should be aged further. Drink from 2020.
title: Ayala 2012 Le Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is an exemplary wine in its balance, texture and concentration. While it is still somewhat young, its rich fruit and taut texture indicate considerable potential. Age this wine for the intense acidity to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2012 Noble Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: This wine comes from Le Mesnil, one of the top villages in the Côte des Blancs, and is produced from only Grand Cru vineyards. It is as textured and mineral as a young wine like this should be. White fruit shows through the concentrated texture and will become more dominant as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Mesnil Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: The dark color of this Rosé results from skin contact. Most Champagnes are turned Rosé by adding still red wine. It is a dry style, crisp and fruity with a zingy texture and plenty of red-currant acidity. Drink now.
designation: Saignée des Terres Amoureuses Brut Rosé Premier Cru
title: Bertrand-Delespierre 2012 Saignée des Terres Amoureuses Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)

description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine, rich in white fruits, generous acidity and with a good balance. It has weight and intensity, the fruitiness partnered by acidity and touches of spice and minerality. Still young, the wine emphasizes fresh fruit, but is ready to drink.
title: Philippe Fontaine 2012 Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Partially fermented in wood, this wine dominated by Chardonnay is crisp, taut, tense and very mineral in texture. It is obviously young, emphasizing freshness and tart citrus flavors. However, it will soften to give a rounder and richer wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean Duclert 2012 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This elegant blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay is the top Champagne from this Marne Valley producer. It has a good balance between its acidity and zesty texture. The mineral character along with citrus fruit give this still-young wine aging potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Liebart-Régnier 2012 Excélia Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a rare style of wine. Made from 100% Pinot Meunier grown in the Marne Valley, it has a ripe, rounded and easily accessible character. At the same time, minerality comes through the white fruit and floral citrus flavors. Special Club is a grouping of independent growers who taste and approve each other's wines before release.
title: Salmon 2012 Special Club Zéro Dosage Pinot Meunier (Champagne)

description: The latest vintage release from this producer is dominated by Pinot Noir, rich and with considerable aging potential. For now, it is mineral, zesty and tightly textured, a concentrated wine offering white and citrus fruits and a lingering aftertaste of fruit and acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Deutz 2012 Brut  (Champagne)

description: This most recent release of vintage Rosé from Deutz boasts fine acidity and crisp young fruit, marking it as a wine to age. Bright and lively with a sophisticated edge of acidity and red currant fruit, it should be cellared until 2019.
title: Deutz 2012 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This is a delicious, light, poised wine. With fresh acidity and a crisp, mineral texture, it's exuberant in its youthful, bright apple and grapefruit flavors. It has aging potential and will certainly be better from 2018.
title: Jean Josselin 2012 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Made exclusively from Pinot Noir grown in the best parcels of the Josselin vineyard, this Champagne has richness along with hints of maturity. Fruity with citrus and green apple flavors, it has a crisp texture that is just about to soften. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean Josselin 2012 Cordon Royal Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Made from equal parts Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this still young Champagne is rich in the Taittinger style, with an elegant poise that is impressive. The wine, with its apricot and ripe apple fruit, is generously tempered by bright acidity and a crisp edge. Drink from 2021.
title: Taittinger 2012 Millésimé Brut  (Champagne)

description: This beautiful wine, with its poise, elegance and balance, has both a steely mineral core and an outer ripe-fruit character. It has citrus, tight acidity and rich apple and green-plum flavors. The wine is still a little young and will be better from 2019.
title: Louis Roederer 2012 Vintage Brut  (Champagne)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a rich wine. Its lightly oxidative character gives it a smoothness as well as bringing out ripe white fruits and citrus. It is a finely made wine, worthy of aging for a few more years. Drink from 2019.
title: Besserat de Bellefon 2012 Triple B  (Champagne)

description: This mature generous wine is perfectly ready to drink. Its red fruits are now balanced by a toasty character as well as ripe acidity and a touch of tannin. This is a very fine wine, balanced and rich. Drink now.
title: Louis Roederer 2012 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This rich, delicious wine is still bursting with young apple and grapefruit flavors, giving it a fruity start with great long-term potential. Then the concentration and the richly mineral texture kicks in, lending the wine intensity and the possibility of aging. Drink from 2019.
designation: Marie-Amélie Fleur de Vigne Brut Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Millésime
title: Henriet-Bazin 2012 Marie-Amélie Fleur de Vigne Brut Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru Millésime Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Mumm has always had a special relationship with the Chardonnay village of Cramant, and this new vintage reinforces that. It brings out both richness and minerality in a fine, generous blend. It comes from grand cru vineyards, ripe in its creamy apple character and the beginnings of maturity.
designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: G. H. Mumm 2012 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: This impressive dry wine is made as part of a club of producers who taste and evaluate each other's wines before release. A blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay, it is full of white fruit with a toasty edge that gives the wine weight. Behind this is a strongly mineral character with bite and zest that will allow it age further. Drink from 2020.
title: Duménil 2012 Premier Cru Special Club  (Champagne)
