description: A fine blend of equal parts of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier, this ripe wine is crisp with acidity and a nervy mineral texture. It is still young, still tight and structured. But it will be a fine wine as it matures. Drink from 2019.
title: Chanoine 2012 Tsarine Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: The ripe combination of Chenin and Chardonnay gives this always-delicious wine its richness and creamy texture. It is ripe, full-bodied with melon and peach flavors as well as crisper acidity. This limited-production wine is smooth and rich at the end. Drink now.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay 2012 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

description: A significant touch of bitterness in this wine spoils the otherwise attractive tropical fruit. It suggests the wine is too young and going through one of Chenin Blanc's growing-pain stages. Keep the wine until 2017 when it will broaden out and be all about perfumed fruit.
title: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2012 De Chanceny Brut Excellence  (Vouvray)

description: Fermented only once in bottle, this wine is made in a traditional way used before Champagne was created. It's full in the mouth, nutty and rounded. It has ripe white fruits, greengages and a mineral texture. Ready to drink, it is rich and full-bodied.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2012 L'Ancestrale  (Vouvray)

description: This is a fresh, almond and apple-flavored sparkling wine. With crisp acidity and some attractive bottle aging, it's ripe but cut by a steely aftertaste, and is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2012 Cuvée T  (Vouvray)

description: One of the top Vouvray sparkling wines, this 2012 is still young. That gives it almond, quince and pear flavors along with intense bright acidity. It is still missing the richer, toasty character that will come with age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Moncontour 2012 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: After three years aging in bottle, this ripe, delicious wine is packed with white fruits and with a creamy texture that gives richness and freshness at the same time. It is lightly spicy, crisply textured to finish and ready to drink now.
title: Vignoble Brisebarre 2012 Cuvée Millésimée Brut  (Vouvray)

description: The faintest note of caramel precedes hints of baked red apples. This is soft and generous, mellow and smooth, supported by very fine mousse and pervaded by subtle freshness. All the structure and richness of Pinot Noir are evident in this elegant Rosé. Its purity and poise is outstanding, its flavors linger and last. This is immensely rich yet slender: clearly the art of zero-dosage has been mastered here completely.
title: Zusslin 2013 Brut Zéro Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: While this is pink fizz, its intent is serious and showcases the structure of Pinot Noir. The palate is dry and displays some pleasant bitterness around the edges, accentuating both dryness and austerity. This will work better at the table-say with salmon sashimi-rather than as an apéritif. This is a serious wine, so explore its hidden charms.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2013 Poussiére d'Etoiles Rosé Zéro Dosage Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Ripe yellow apple and a vanilla dominate the nose. This richness continues on the palate, with its full flavor and gently fizzing bubbles. It's a rich and rounded, yet dry and fresh wine. Consider this with food rather than as an aperitif. Lovely now, it is sure to evolve. Drink now-2025.
title: Lucien Albrecht 2013 1698 Brut Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Brisk lemon freshness sets the tone on the nose. The very frothy mousse on the palate continues in this fruity, exuberant and fresh vein. The finish is superclean, brisk and dry, creating an ideal and invigorating apéritif-style for summer days.
title: André Kientzler 2013 Cuvée MIllésimée Non Dosée Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Notes of fresh sourdough rye bread, crisp apples and citrus vie for attention and signal an evolved wine with beautiful notes of long autolysis. This is borne out on the exquisitely pure and fresh palate, still sprightly with lemon and green-apple freshness against a background of bread crust and crumb. Over time, the apple notes mellow and are reminiscent of spiced winter apple. This is marked by exquisite elegance and purity. Without any dosage, this shines with pure, intense and lively fruit.
title: Zusslin 2013 Brut Zéro Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Fragrant notes of both green zingy fresh apples and more mellow baked apple fill the nose. The palate follows this with yeasty autolysis reminiscent of sourdough bread, dark honey and more refreshing green apple. The palate is lithe, dry and elegant with fine mousse and makes for a mouth-watering finish and a classy apéritif.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Plaisir Perlant Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: The deep strawberry-pink color immediately spells fun but the palate is actually more serious than that. Full to the brim of strawberry fruit without being cloying or candied, there's a beautiful balance to the fruit expression, with lots of refreshment and plump, yet light-footed joy.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Strawberry hints and floral overtones promise pleasure that arrives on the dry, creamy palate. A lively froth accentuates lightness and ease, while dryness underlines the clean fruit flavors. Fine autolysis provides the creamy, textured background, all pervaded by a lively seam of bright acid.
title: Boeckel 2013 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Aromatic notes of green, yellow and red-cheeked apples waft enticingly from the glass. The palate is equally friendly and smile-inducing, with a totally fruit-driven but exuberant character that majors on frivolous pleasure. The palate is light, frothy and dry. This is made for sparkly afternoons and evenings that last and last. Be sure to get more than one bottle.
title: Domaine Gresser 2013 Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Frothy fizz carries fresh lemon and lime scents to the surface. The palate has the same citric flavor profile and is diffuse with lots of bubbles-which exaggerates the lightness of the dry palate even more. While there is not a lot of substance there certainly is lots of refreshment.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2013 Tradition Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A very neutral nose leads to an equally neutral palate. There is a hint of earthiness and just the merest edge of citric verve, with oatmeal flavors associated with autolysis. While there is balance and freshness, this is a very straight-laced crémant.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2013 Brut Réserve Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Both ripe, red apple and juicy Mirabelle plum make an enticing appearance. The fruity character somewhat loses itself on the broad palate which nonetheless is made lively by a frothy, friendly mousse. This is simple but fizzy and fresh, with a bitter finish.
title: Domaine Mersiol 2013 Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Creamy notes of strawberry shortcake make for an alluring nose. The impression continues on the palate with very fine creamy mousse while the more tender, tart red-berry notes now gain some enticing pepper spice. This is a very elegant, dry apéritif style. Without any dosage the finish is long, refreshing and dry.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2013 Poussiére d'étoiles Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Ripe mirabelle fruit plays on the nose and leads onto a very rich, creamy but fresh palate. This is autolytic generosity set against bright lemony fruity freshness. The creamy mousse adds to the creaminess even more but also accentuates spiky lemon. The palate is bone dry but full of rich flavors. This is lovely now but will gain from bottle age. Drink 2017-2025.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Quintessence Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Very vivid notes of green citrus signal refreshment and lightness. The palate confirms this near weightless lightness and underlines it with fine tiny bubbles that fizz away creamily, providing a counterpoint and resulting in a wine that is both exquisitely light, dry, creamy and elegant. If you are looking for a sophisticated but light apéritif, this is your answer.
title: Domaine Pfister 2013 Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Lemon plays on the nose alongside hints of shortbread. The palate has a lovely rich creaminess and very fine elegant mousse, creating an impression of light-bodied richness. This is sophisticated and dry, elegant and creamy-very grown-up and utterly delicious.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2013 Cométe Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This is a crisp wine, fresh and with a texture that includes both minerality and light tannins. The wine is still young and very fruity, delicious now but better with some aging so the crispness can tone down a little. Drink from 2019.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2013 Vive-la-Joie Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: With some age in the bottle, this wine shows sophisticated maturity while still keeping plenty of fruitiness. Crisp but creamy, it offers a rich texture and is ready to drink.
title: Victorine de Chastenay 2013 Brut Millésimé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is an impressively rich wine. Its generousity derives from the ripe grapes and the intense fruitiness that balances the total dryness of the wine. Drink from 2020.
designation: Triple B by Besserat Brut Nature
title: Besserat de Bellefon 2013 Triple B by Besserat Brut Nature  (Champagne)

description: A smoothly textured wine, this is perfectly in balance, with red berry and currant fruitiness assimilated into the lightly tannic and crisp texture. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Roederer 2013 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Still young, this crisp, fruity wine is tangy and packed with red-currant flavors and acidity. The fruit balances with the fresh, tangy character that will allow this wine to age well. Drink now for its freshness, but the wine will be best from 2020.
title: Deutz 2013 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This wine is named after Ernestine Doussot, the widow (veuve) who created this producer. Rich but tautly textured, it is balanced, elegant with a strong streak of acidity and minerality as well as tense citrus fruits. Drink from 2020.
title: Veuve Doussot 2013 Cuvée Ernestine  (Champagne)

description: Typically Deutz, this stylish is wine full of fruit, with a crisp texture. A dry style and tautness go with the citrus flavors that are shot through with acidity. This well-structured wine is still young and will be best from 2020.
title: Deutz 2013 Brut  (Champagne)

description: This smooth and ripe wine has a creamy mousse and hints of mature, rich fruit. It is well poised, hinting at minerality while also boasting great fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Veuve Doussot 2013 Cuvée L by VD Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A blend of Grand Cru fruit, this well-structured wine is rich while also tense, mineral and with further aging potential. Citrus acidity is allied to crisp apples to produce the fruity side of this well balanced wine. It will be better from 2020.
title: Jacquart 2013 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A rich blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, this wine is full of red fruits. The crisp texture suggests a low dosage and a touch of tannin adds structure. Drink now.
title: Lelarge-Pugeot 2013 Rosé de Saignée  (Champagne)

description: This spring-flower-perfumed wine is crisp with citrus while having a soft backdrop of ripe apples. It is an intensely textured wine, mineral and zesty. Those elements contrast with the rich fruitiness and good acidity. The wine could be aged longer, and will be better from 2020.
title: Jean-Noël Haton 2013 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)

description: From a single parcel of organically grown Pinot Blanc, this was partially vinified in wood. It is dry, although the fruitiness of the grapes balances that dryness. The result is a rich wine, full of fruitiness and with a toasty edge that adds complexity. Drink now.
title: Piollot Pére et Fils 2013 Colas Robin Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

description: Made from 70% Chardonnay, 20% Chenin Blanc and 10% Mauzac, this leads with toasty notes of grilled apple, dried orange peel, yellow melon and a hint of wood spice. It's brisk and lively in effervescence, countered by ample, rich fruit tones of wood-grilled apple and orange cream.
title: Sieur d'Arques 2013 Premiére Bulle Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: This ripe and full wine is balanced and textured. A mineral background gives a crisp character to the ripe yellow and pear fruit flavors. With long aging on lees, the wine has weight and richness. It should be aged further and drunk from 2016.
title: Château Moncontour 2013 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: This is an apple-fresh sparkling wine with a lively mousse. It crisp, refreshing and clean, with attractive fruitiness.
title: Domaine du Moulin 2013 Brut Méthode Ancestrale Mauzac (Gaillac)

description: This is a fresh and sweet sparkling wine, a little like a Moscato, with fresh apple and honey flavors. It makes a delicious apéritif wine or partner to a fruit dessert.
title: Domaine la Croix des Marchands 2013 Brut Mauzac (Gaillac)

description: Faint notes of strawberry rise from the glass; on the palate they become more subdued and meld into fresh, citrusy notes of grapefruit. The combination of fine fizz, grown-up dryness and spiky citrus is absolutely convincing, even mouth-watering.
title: Arthur Metz 2014 Brut Rosé Millesimé Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose is shy and gives a mere but perfumed glimpse of melon and green apple. The palate then comes in with seductive, creamy depth of autolytic richness. This revels in its rounded, baked apple flavors, backed by salty yeasty richness. Yet it remains bone dry and slender. What an elegant, intriguing wine. Lovely now, certain to evolve. Drink now through 2028.
title: Dirler-Cadé 2014 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: At first, the abundant apple notes seem crisp and green. On the palate they attain the mellowness of ripe Golden Delicious apples and the aroma of yellow plums. There is a pleasant autolytic background of sponge-cake and shortbread, balanced by lovely aromatic lemon freshness and fine mousse. The finish is absolutely dry and very pure.
title: Domaine Barmés-Buecher 2014 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Sprightly citrus notes with a hint of grass and white blossom signal a very youthful and vibrant wine. The palate adds a touch of creamy richness but chiefly this is all about easy, fresh, lemony fizz. The finish is wonderfully dry and mouthwatering.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2014 Brut Réserve Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Something of both fresh and dried pink grapefruit zest plays about the nose. The very frothy palate adds some spice to that, as well as a pleasant hint of bitterness. All the fruit is accentuated by the frothing bursting bubbles. Drink soon, ideally as an animating apéritif. The zesty finish is very appetizing.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2014 Nature Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Scented mellow notes of ripe yellow apple stream from the glass. On the palate they are displayed against an autolytic background that recalls both rye bread and short-crust pastry. The mouse is very fine and adds creamy allure to the dry light palate. This is dry, classy and rather sophisticated with a refreshing finish that leaves a lasting impression.
title: Boeckel 2014 Extra Brut Chardonnay Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Beautifully fruity notes of fresh and baked apples create an inviting nose. The palate fizzes away with creamy mousse and a lovely yeasty autolytic edge reminiscent of fresh rye bread. The apple fruit brightens the entire palate and creates a rounded, harmonious and very balanced dry finish.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2014 Plaisir Perlant Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Yellow-apple notes are clearly expressed on the nose. They also appear with lovely purity on the balanced dry palate which has a rich backdrop of autolysis with hints of rye bread. The mousse is fine and creamy, the finish is dry and lasting.
title: Domaine Mersiol 2014 Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Fresh citrus and green apple have a leafy touch and something that is reminiscent of wet stone. That taut slenderness is apparent throughout the light dry palate where lemony freshness plays the central role. The fizz is fine and creamy and leaves the mouth filled with freshness. This is vivid, has lots of verve and a clean dry finish.
title: Cave de Cleebourg 2014 Symphonie en P Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This salmon-colored blend of 90% Cabernet Franc and just a touch of Merlot is light, crisp and perfumed. It has a creamy mousse and a bright, red currant-inflected aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Calvet 2014 Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe while also crisp wine has just over half Chardonnay in the blend with Pinot Noir. It is crisp, tight with citrus and apples as well as a pure line in refreshing acidity. This is a food wine, ready to drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2014 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Pinot Blanc finds a home in the Côte des Bar region of the Aube. In this expression it shows a beautiful character, ripe, tender and very open. Warm white and yellow fruits shine this well-balanced, ready-to-drink wine.
designation: Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs
title: Philippe Fontaine 2014 Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

description: This sparkling wine is sweet, fresh and fruity. It's an unusual take on the local grape, Négrette, although it works with its freshness and soft, ripe texture. Drink now.
title: Château la Colombiére 2014 Colombulle Negrette (Vin de France)

description: This is rich and toasty right from the start, with abundant aromas and flavors of buttered brioche and wood-grilled apple. The medium-weight palate is round and soft, with a strong wooded edge that carries through to the close.
title: Antech 2014 Réserve Brut Sparkling (Blanquette de Limoux)

description: There's a warm, toasty character to this sparkling wine that's made from 70% Chardonnay, 20% Chenin Blanc and 10% Pinot Noir, with hints of currant, tart plum and white cranberry. It boasts a full texture and soft mousse, but high, mouthwatering acidity to counter and lift the palate.
title: Sieur d'Arques 2014 Premiére Bulle Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: This attractive young, fruity wine is crisp, tangy and with delicious freshness. Its floral aroma and ripe pear and melon fruitiness give it a fine rich balance. With a delicious bright aftertaste the wine is ready to drink.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay 2014 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

description: This is a spicy wine, its fruit merged with toastiness and almond flavors. Fermentation in wood has created a wine that has layers of flavors as well as crisp honeyed fruit and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine la Croix des Vainqueurs 2014 Cuvée Premium  (Vouvray)

description: Although it is dry, this wine with its gentle mousse has a light touch of honey to go with the ripe pear and cantaloupe flavors. It has a crisp edge, lightly toasty, dry and with tight acidity at the end.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2014 Cuvée T Brut  (Vouvray)

description: This sparkling wine shows the potential richness that can come from the combination of Chenin Blanc and bubbles. It's a nutty, spicy and ripe wine. At the same time, its acidity and tense structure give a cool crisp feel. This balance and tension are just right and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pichot 2014 Brut  (Vouvray)

description: This stylish wine is just at the right moment to drink. It comes from selected parcels in the vineyard and offers concentration as well as white and yellow fruits imbued with hazelnut and intense acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Moncontour 2014 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: With three years bottle aging, this wine has begun to develop attractive, mature toasty flavors that add richness to floral, crisp character of the fruit. The wine is both rich and soft, generous and very ready to drink now.
title: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2014 De Chanceny Excellence Brut  (Vouvray)

description: Naturally sparkling rather than needing any addition of yeast or sugar, this fine bone-dry wine has great style, great character. Its honey, apple and slight oxidative flavor are all part of a wine that is impressively ripe and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2014 Ancestrale Brut  (Vouvray)

description: Rounded, creamy notes of ripe and mellow apple stream from the glass. The palate is equally mellow and creamy, with an inherent bright freshness and a wonderfully creamy midpalate. Notions of freshly baked shortbread pastry join the apple notes and make for a very balanced, textured and rounded palate, vivid with apple freshness. This is lovely now, but sure to evolve in bottle. The finish is dry and creamy. Drink now through 2025.
title: Domaine Ansen 2015 Struch Brut Nature Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Very subtle notes of ripe Golden Pearmain apples on the nose speak of fruit underlined by creamy autolysis. The palate follows up with very fine mousse and a very dry but creamy and balanced palate. With its bone-dry, zero dosage style, this shows off the purity of the subtle apple fruit and the inherent balance between freshness and yeasty development. Lovely now but certain to develop. Drink now through 2028.
title: Dirler-Cadé 2015 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Almost floral-tinged notes of green apple dominate the nose along with hints of lemon. The rather fines mousse heightens the idea of delicacy that surrounds this wine. This is fresh, light, gentle and totally citrus-driven. This lovely, dry summer sparkler is all about gentle fruit expression.
title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2015 Les Bulles de Noémie Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Reduction still plays on the nose while the palate is fresh and apple-focused. Notes of tart but mellow apple expand on the palate, while fine froth tingles with a touch of bitter citrus pithiness. The finish is dry and refreshing.
title: Dopff Au Moulin 2015 Blanc de Noirs Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A touch of pepper accentuates the fresh notion of wet stone and citrus on the nose. The palate is bone dry and has a fresh fizzing mousse that accentuates, stone, pepper and green citrus even more. The slightly austere, bone-dry style will come into its own with other pure restrained flavors-think subtle Japanese dishes. The finish is brisk and superclean.
title: Domaine Barmés-Buecher 2015 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Lovely apple fruit plays on the nose. The palate is very light and dry, but has a slightly bitter edge that suggests that this might be better with food than as an apéritif. The finish is beautifully dry and invitingly tart.
title: Boeckel 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A touch of reduction clings to the nose, masking the fruit. On the palate, however, lemon and crisp green apple freshness prevail, carried by a soft lively mousse. This is dry, light and has a lovely backdrop of yeasty autolytic notes and a very clean finish.
title: Boeckel 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A lovely blend of tart berry and red-apple notes creates an inviting nose. The palate brings these lovely, almost autumnal berry notes even further as they are amplified by the lively frothy mousse. This is totally fruit driven, very appetizing and refreshing with an almost cleansing but lasting finish.
title: Domaine Specht 2015 Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: One of Korbel's most consistent wines, this brut shows a rich elegance and balance, with doughy flavors of peaches and a hint of smoke, vanilla and cherry.
title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Almost entirely Cabernet Franc with a little help from Merlot, this is a soft and fruity wine. With its strawberry fruit, light acidity and smooth texture, the wine is easy and ready to drink.
title: Calvet 2015 Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: This Crémant shows superb balance, purity and focus from start to finish, with lively effervescence and a brisk character throughout. Notes of green apple skin and lime zest are spiced by a subtle toasty accent, while the finish is crisp and refreshing.
designation: Les Graimenous Tête de Cuvée Méthode Traditionnelle Brut
title: Domaine J. Laurens 2015 Les Graimenous Tête de Cuvée Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: Soft brioche and toasted apple aromas form the nose of this pretty but light and dainty sparkler. The brisk and prickly carbonation is aligned to tart Granny Smith and melon rind flavors.
title: Antech 2015 Cuvée Eugénie Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: Faint scents of white strawberry hull and lemon pith softly grace the bouquet of this delicate sparkler. The palate offers a bit more expression and intensity, with notes of peach and yellow melon that are surprisingly ripe and round in feel.
title: Antech 2015 Émotion Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: This nutty aromatic wine is crisp, tight and with intense acidity. It has a mineral edge as well as citrus fruit, grapefruit and lemon flavors. The wine is lively, perfumed and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Amirault 2015 Les Quarterons Brut Chenin Blanc (Crémant de Loire)

description: The beautiful apple aromas lead to a delicious wine. It has honey, creamed apple and spice flavors, cut through with acidity as well as almonds. The wine is ripe, balancing its crisp texture with richer fruits. Drink this wine now.
title: Château Moncontour 2015 Cuvée Prédilection Brut  (Vouvray)

description: There is a hovering hint of something deeply aromatic, almost of bergamot, that flashes on the nose. The zestiness appears once again on the slender palate where superfine mousse tingles and dances. This is wonderfully refreshing, slender and harmonious, vibrating all the while with its zesty rich perfume, pitched fittingly against its slender palate. This is the way to go. Drink now through 2025.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Fresh clear pure notes of green and red apple have the merest hint of lemon, creating a most appetizing nose. The palate is restrained in its clear fruit, but very fine creamy bubbles lend freshness and disperse the lovely creamy apple aromas. This most elegant sparkler has a grown-up, dry and classy finish. Lovely depth shows in the umami finish.
title: Boeckel 2016 Extra Brut Vintage Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Red-apple notes have a vivid touch of lemon freshness on the nose. The very lively mousse is fine and creamy while the red-apple notes are joined on the palate by a more leafy, more tart notion of red hedgerow fruit. Think hawthorn and rose hip. This is very dry, but the very fine creaminess of the tiny bubbles and subtle notes of rye sourdough provide ample balance on this elegant wine.
title: Dirler-Cadé 2016 Rosé Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Beautifully aromatic notions of citrus peel and blossom reach the nose. The creamy fine bubbles that follow accentuate those hints of blossom even more on the slender, fresh, bright and utterly invigorating palate. This is light, floral, and unusual, but totally charming. The finish is dry and whistle clean with another hit of that pure expressive citrus florality.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: An almost leafy, greenish note hovers on the nose, reminiscent of spring meadow and tender green pear. The palate adds a wonderfully fine mousse to this, on the slender light palate. Notions of lime zest and green pear become stronger towards the refreshing finish. This is an elegant, slender and wonderfully bone-dry sparkler.
title: Domaine Barmés-Buecher 2016 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: The nose is shy and has an earthy edge. The flavors on the palate are gently fruited and suggest faint lemon and yellow apple. The mousse is lively and fresh but overall this remains a little subdued. The finish is clean, dry and fresh.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Brut Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Delicate aromas of crushed white peony, lemon verbena, chalk and apple flesh dance in the bouquet of this attractive sparkling wine, while flavors of green apple, yellow plum and lemon zest are direct and mouthwatering. The palate is fresh and zippy, with a lively mousse and bright acidity that lead into a medium-length but seriously refreshing finish.
designation: Clos des Demoiselles Tête de Cuvée Brut
title: J. Laurens 2016 Clos des Demoiselles Tête de Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: A blend that is dominated by Chenin Blanc has produced a beautiful lightly honeyed wine. Its apple fruitiness and brilliant acidity give it great crispness along with an added touch of spice. Drink this delicious wine now.
title: Domaine Amirault 2016 Amirault Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: Gaillac's local Mauzac grape lends itself extremely well to this medium-sweet style of wine. Full of spice and apple flavors, the wine is delicious as an aperitif. The méthode ancestrale involves bottling a partially fermented wine which then finishes its fermentation in bottle. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Domaine du Moulin 2017 Méthode Ancestrale Mauzac (Gaillac)

description: A blend of 72% Pinot Noir and 28% Chardonnay, this is a stunning vintage of the perennially impressive sparkler. Nutty and earthy, it sings in strawberry, wet stone and rose petal. The palate offers a lively mousse and persistent acidity, making it vibrant and easy to enjoy.
title: Iron Horse 2014 Wedding Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Rich and full of flavor, this wine offers fruit, spice and some attractive aged complexity in equal measures. It has an earthy toasty gingery aroma, mellow cherry and raspberry flavors and a mouth-filling mousse.
title: Goldeneye 2015 Brut Rosé (Anderson Valley)

description: Dry and crisp, this surprising wine made from Zinfandel grapes has a sophisticated and complex lees-aged character that gives a toasty note to the aroma, and light earthy oaky ginger and cherry flavors on the palate. While medium bodied, it is well concentrated and interesting to taste.
title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Amador County)

description: This mostly Pinot Noir-based sparkling wine contains 5% Pinot Meunier. It was given three years en tirage, resulting in a creamy mouthfeel and moderate acidity. It stays fresh and light in the glass, combining flavors of green apple, hazelnut and a squeeze of lemon.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir, this has an impressive mousse that's light on its feet with bright acidity and plenty of crispness on the palate. Strawberry, cherry and tangerine mingle along a thread of elegance and balance.
title: Grand Napa 2013 Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Done in the traditional Champagne method, this unusual sparkling wine, based on Cabernet Franc, brings sharply-focused apple fruit front and center. Though still quite young, it's a crisp and refreshing wine that will set up well with a variety of the usual appetizers for good bubbly.
title: Quady North 2016 Brut Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

description: This unusual sparkling wine made from Verdejo grapes goes for a doughy complexity that starts with an earthy, yeasty aroma and follows through with flavors like freshly baked bread and mineral water. It's on the light side in terms of fruit character, and is light to medium bodied.
title: Riaza 2017 Sparkling Verdejo (Clarksburg)

description: This is a fun, pop-top wine, orange-pink in color, a blend of Pinot Noir and Chenin Blanc. An inviting, floral-candied note of watermelon Jolly Rancher leads to interesting flavors of hazelnut and lemon, with plenty of acidity to buoy the light body.
title: Karah Estate 2018 Tendance Passante Sparkling (California)

description: Closed with a crown cap, this party-ready, cherry-candy bubbly is fresh, lively and just plain fun. Pinkish-gold in color, with big bubbles and a burst of fruit flavor, it's fine with salmon, poultry or all by itself.
title: A to Z NV Bubbles Rosé (Oregon)

description: This wine is nicely balanced, delicate and appealing, with light body, subtle cherry flavors and tiny bubbles that give a seamless texture. It was made with 55% Pinot Noir, 37% Chardonnay and the remainder other grape varieties.
title: Dark Horse NV Brut Rosé (California)

description: Light, dry and very crisp, this wine has aromas and flavors like Pippin apples and a lean appetizing texture. It shows plenty of good, bracing acidity, rather low alcohol and a bone-dry finish.
title: Dark Horse NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: A deep pink color and vivid candied-fruit flavors make this wine taste like a still rosé with added bubbles. It starts with a metallic aroma, and continues with lightly sweet cherry flavors.
title: Days of Youth NV The Diver Brut Rosé (California)

description: This plush and frothy wine offers attractive, low-key apple and butter aromas and flavors, and a smooth soft mouth-filling effervescence.
title: Days of Youth NV The Diver Brut Sparkling (California)

description: This is made from a majority of Pinot Noir alongside Chardonnay and Pinot Gris. Aged three-and-a-half years in bottle, it's complex and approachable in equal measure. Cherry, peach and a twist of lime round out the lush palate, with integrated acidity underlining its freshness.
title: Domaine Carneros 2014 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Bright focused acidity drives the texture and crisp flavors of this wine, a celebration of cherry, orange and strawberry with a touch of vanilla-biscuit richness on the back of the palate. It has texture and length deserving of its reserve title.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)

description: A smaller offering from the producer, this impresses in its blending of 60% Pinot Noir with 40% Chardonnay, combining them into a reserve-level expression of nutty almond and baked lemon. A crisp midpalate helps offset the lush broad expansion of creaminess that develops along the way.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Napa County)

description: This is a relatively small-production sparkling blend of 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay, aged more than three years in bottle. Creamy and lush on the palate, it contrasts that richness with focused acidity and crisp flavors of ginger and lemon.
title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Estate Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This is made from 80% Pinot Noir, the remainder Chardonnay. It offers inviting aromas of strawberry and orange around a tightly structured layering of flavor and bright acidity.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)

description: With a copper-orange hue, this is made from a majority of Pinot Noir though it offers flavors indicative of the Chardonnay content as well. Driven by citrus tones of tangerine, it has a dry gritty texture, mid-level structure and lasting acidity.
title: Breathless NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Sweet notions of peach and nectarine mark this fleshy, creamy rich and round sparkler, textured with an undeniable lushness. Both Chardonnay and Pinot Noir go into the blend.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Primarily Chardonnay, with other white wine varieties blended in, this refreshing, yeasty sparkling wine offers crisp apple and lemon zest flavors. The convenience of cans is a plus—easy to chill, easy to pack, easy to open and easy to recycle.
title: Canned Oregon NV Oregon White Bubbles Sparkling (Oregon)

description: Made from both Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this value-driven, larger production offering is light and lean, with understated acidity. It delivers flavor and texture within a rich rounded palate of approachable pear and vanilla-biscuit flavor.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Made in the classic Champagne method, this young, racy bubbly is a 50/50 blend of Pinot Blanc and Pinot Noir. It's tart and tangy, with flavors principally of grapefruit and lemon.
title: Winter's Hill 2016 Ninebark Sparkling (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine is brimming in apple and lemon crispness, with a dryness on the palate that detracts from its time in bottle.
title: Mumm Napa 2013 Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Though this was made in the méthode Champenoise, it's a foamy devil, seemingly bottled at unusually high pressure. Those bubbles cover up much of the subtlety from a cuvée that is principally (possibly entirely) Pinot Noir-based. Cherry candy fruit flavors are here, but the bubbles override everything.
title: Château Bianca 2016 Wetzel Estate Sparkling Wine Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a blend of aromatic white wine varieties with a splash of Syrah for color. Though the flavors are generic, the overall freshness and pleasing carbonation keep it lively and interesting, like a particularly flavorful La Croix. The convenience of cans is a bonus—easy to chill, easy to pack, easy to open and easy to recycle.
title: Canned Oregon NV Oregon Pink Rosé Bubbles Sparkling (Oregon)

description: A bright copper color and citrus aromas are followed by tart cherry and pink-grapefruit flavors in this fruity and crisply balanced wine that is a late release in magnum only. It has a refreshing, vibrant mouthfeel and clean finish and an unusually strong stream of bubbles that keeps going 30 minutes after pouring. In this large format, it will certainly keep improving through at least 2022.
title: Schramsberg 2012 Brut Rosé Magnum Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This enticing and supple wine starts with aromas of bread dough and toasted almonds. The palate brings flavors of both fresh and baked apple on a plush, softly sparkling texture.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: The wine's perlage is firm and steely, with soft layers of brioche, lemon pith and almond skins. It's persistent in petillance but boasts a distinct, delicate mousse. The finish is fresh and creamy, ending on a lingering powdered-ginger note.
title: King Family NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Monticello)

description: The aromas are fresh in this pale-salmon sparkling wine, showing yellow cherries, lillies and fresh baked rolls. The bubbles are pillowy in feel, while bright, tingling acidity wakes up the palate that offers flavors of brioche, lemon zest, juicy strawberry and cherry. It finishes on notes of yeasty brioche and preserved lemon.
title: Gruet NV Sauvage Rosé Sparkling (America)

description: The cloudy appearance of this Texas pét-nat looks just like watermelon juice. It displays aromas of pink grapefruit, fresh strawberry, white lily and hay. The palate is carried by fine, spritzy bubbles that offer flavors of lime juice, white flowers, watermelon and hints of green strawberry and more pink grapefruit. Tart cherry and lime peel are tinged with saline on the finish.
title: William Chris 2017 Pétillant Naturel Rosé Sparkling (Texas)

description: A quiet melon aroma can be teased from the glass with some swirling. Juicy lemon, clementine and ripe strawberry flavors migle with a grassy note on the supremely refreshing palate that displays tingling, delicate bubbles. Fresh squeezed lime and watermelon notes are endless.
title: William Heritage 2017 Estate Grown Pét-Nat Rosé (Outer Coastal Plain)

description: Aromas of croissant and golden raspberry are delicate on the nose. Bright, rich flavors of cherry and papaya on the palate are laced with grapefruit acidity and an underpinning of biscuit dough. Somewhat frothy bubbles are persistent but light, while a strawberry flavor emerges on the finish.
title: William Heritage 2015 Estate Reserve Brut Rosé (Outer Coastal Plain)

description: The color of Versilia Peach roses, this sparkler offers quiet aromas of strawberry, plum and saltine cracker. The palate is delicate, showing strawberry, apple, biscuits and lemon juice flavors on a soft, fine mousse. It finishes on a squeeze of lemon and baguette, with a hint of watermelon.
title: Gruet NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (America)

description: The newest edition to the winery's popular Evolution lineup, this traditionally-made sparkling wine is principally Pinot Noir, with smaller additions of Muscat and Müller-Thurgau. It's a charming and versatile wine, with pretty flavors of Alpine strawberries, orange peel and lemon gelato.
title: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution 1st Edition Sparkling Rosé (America)

description: A pomegranate aroma shows a savory edge of tomato leaf in this dark sparkling rosé. Soft bubbles gently lift the palate that displays flavors of ripe cherry, baking spice and baked bread. A lemony note appears on the finish with a hint of strawberry.
title: Gruet 2012 Cuvée Danielle Rosé Sparkling (America)

description: This has aromas and flavors of raw almond, citrus zest, bread crust and salt. Small, vigorous bubbles provide the backdrop, while dried apple and button-mushroom flavors marks the finish.
title: Trump 2010 SP Blanc de Noir Brut Sparkling (Monticello)

description: Produced from Gamay Noir grown on both sides of the Columbia River, this bursts with scents of apple blossoms and cherries. The deep color and slight bitter-skin flavor suggest that it spent some time macerating prior to fermentation. What it lacks in finesse it makes up for with fruit power.
title: Stedt 2016 OR Sparkling Rosé (America)

description: This wine shows a crisp character, its acidity given brightness by Meyer lemon and tart pineapple flavors. There's an attractive edge of minerality and delicate notions of brioche to add some layers to the palate. The finish is long and citrus-driven.
title: Veritas NV Scintilla Sparkling (Monticello)

description: This is a soft, open wine, lightly flavored with raspberry and dried sage. This is a fun wine, marked by frail bubbles and light acidity.
title: Horton NV Erotes Sparkling (Virginia)

description: Made from just a bit more Pinot Noir than Chardonnay, this is a lovely, complex and memorable wine, elegantly round and lengthy on the palate. A fleshiness of tangerine, peach and cherry complement the bright persistent acidity that has had time to mellow and integrate in the bottle.
title: Mumm Napa 2013 DVX Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: The blend is 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, within spitting distance of the 2014 cuvée. Made in the traditional méthode Champenoise, it's a savvy, sexy bottle of bubbly. Lightly candied fruit flavors of orange peel, pineapple and poached pear penetrate deeply into the palate, with a fine bead and a burst of toast.
title: Roco 2015 RMS Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: A faded shade of pink in the glass, this nonvintage bubbly offers rose petals, lemon, raspberry and chalk aromas. The palate starts with a sour strawberry and watermelon flavors, combining a strong tartness with recognizable and welcome fruit flavors.
title: Melville NV Blanc de Noir Non-Dosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A 50-50 blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, given time to age, this shows layers of richness that can only be earned over time. Rounded supple acidity supports broad complex layers of green apple, Meyer lemon and peach. It finishes crisp and dry.
title: Mumm Napa 2011 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This is made from 80% Pinot Noir, the remainder Chardonnay, both coming from both the Napa and Sonoma sides of the appellation. Inviting in wild strawberry, it is dry and stony and exuberant in earthy mineral aspects of crushed rock and dried herb.
title: JCB 2014 No 34 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Light yellow in the glass, this bubbly is a mix of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, and starts with yeasty aromas of sourdough and a light squeeze of grapefruit on the nose. The bready flavors show on the sip too, alongside tart lemon touches.
title: Cebada 2014 Blanc et Noirs Extra Brut Sparkling (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This nicely captures the toasty, lip-smacking power of vintage Champagne, hitting the palate immediately with an impression of both power and finesse. Youthful still, it offers tart fla-vors of lemon rind, pineapple and grapefruit. Though all stainless-steel fermentation and aging is indicated, that pleasing toasty note continues on through the finish.
title: Left Coast 2012 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Broad aromas of strawberry and peach flesh are cut my lime pith on the nose of this sparkling wine. Full raspberry and cherry-juice flavors on the palate are cut by a strong streak of sour and tart citrus spray, offering a balanced bubbly sip.
title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Rosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Hay yellow in the glass, this vibrant bubbly, made from Chardonnay, offers aromas of toast and shaved nectarine on the nose. The palate is loaded with lemon flavors, proving tangy, tart and pleasantly sour as it rides across the creamy mousse.
title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Produced from Hartzinger Vineyard Pinot Noir, this potent bubbly spent three years en tirage. It's a sunset copper color, with tangy strawberry and cherry flavors. Bubbles are compact, and the wine has the requisite acidity, finishing with a refreshing burst of minerality.
title: Raptor Ridge 2014 Sparkling Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Almost all Pinot Noir, with just 5% Chardonnay, this méthode Champenoise wine was barrel fermented and spent 20 months en tirage. It's a tawny gold and opens with a slightly earthy aroma that evolves into a complex mash-up of toast, butter, coffee grounds and tart fruits. The color and flavors suggest it's in a prime drinking window.
title: Lundeen NV Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: Made in the traditional method, this 100% Pinot Noir is a bright straw color, dry and tangy, with excellent length and precision. The flavors and color don't suggest Pinot Noir but might actually be mistaken for a blanc de blancs, except for a light lick of dark chocolate that trails the finish.
designation: La Cantera Vineyard Blanc de Noirs Brut
title: Lundeen 2014 La Cantera Vineyard Blanc de Noirs Brut Sparkling (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Made from 93% Pinot Noir and 7% Pinot Meunier, this is a lovely sparkling wine, rounded and layered with moderate acidity. The flavors dance around aspects of wild strawberry, raspberry and melon, with a lasting tease of hazelnut.
title: Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: Light aromas of pear cider and lemon rinds show on the nose of this bottling, which is one of the more popular bubblies from the Central Coast. The palate offers dried apples and apple-cider flavors, with a touch of earthy dust.
designation: Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs
title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made in the méthode traditionelle, this is lightly toasty and quite dry. The pale tawny gold hue and dried apple flavors suggest that it be consumed in the near term, between now and 2020. There's a touch of pepper adding a bit of welcome spice to the finish.
title: Dion 2015 Wedding Tree Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is just the second release of a sparkling wine from this producer, crafted from a mix of Pommard Pinot and Dijon clone Chardonnay. Oregon fizz is enjoying a renaissance at the moment, though it's still rather rare and expensive. This is lightly toasty, with steely highlights and tangy flavors of apple, lemon curd and pineapple.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Méthode Champenoise Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: From the Union Wine Company, this value bubbly is 62% Pinot Noir and 38% Chardonnay. It's fresh, crisp and clean, with notes of apple, melon and citrus. It comes in full-size, crown-capped wine bottles and 375 ml cans.
title: Underwood 2017 The Bubbles Sparkling (Oregon)

description: Dark in color, this is a richly rounded sparkling blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier. Strawberry shortcake and peach play effortlessly along the light palate, exuberantly floral and fruity before finishing dry.
title: Chandon NV Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: Made from a majority of Chardonnay, with smaller additions of Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, this wine is golden in color with accompanying flavors of golden apple, brioche and sweet peach. Likably round and just the right amount of rich, it will please a crowd.
title: Chandon NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Tasted in July 2018, this nonvintage brut is a 50/50 blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. The bubbles are big and fat, and the wine carries scents of powdered sugar sprinkled on grapefruit. It falls on the rustic side of the sparkling wine spectrum, but packs plenty of flavor, including a potent streak of sweet baking spices.
title: R. Stuart & Co. NV Bubbly Sparkling (Oregon)

description: This wine offers a rusty yellow gold, with scents of bruised apple. It seemed much older than its vintage, partially oxidized, but with plenty of fruit. A metallic note crept into the finish. Just one bottle was provided, so no chance to retaste.
title: Areté 2016 Brut Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: A fine companion to Underwood's regular brut, this rosé is three-quarters Pinot Noir, the rest Chardonnay. Strawberry and cherry soda flavors suggest this as a great party starter. Or get creative and use it as a versatile mixer. It comes in full-size, crown-capped wine bottles and 375 ml cans.
title: Underwood 2017 Rosé Bubbles Sparkling (Oregon)

description: Distinctive aromas of toasted nut and wood-smoke give this full-bodied wine an exotic start, while baked apple, browned walnut and crisp cherry flavors continue the theme. Made from 82% Pinot Noir and 18% Chardonnay, it offers layers of spice, smoke and mild, savory mushroom and tea flavors, surrounded by a plush, creamy texture and light acidity to keep it fresh. Best after 2023.
title: Schramsberg 2009 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Enticing aromas of toasted almond and pear tart lead to an equally seductive and complex palate that is dry but rich in feel. It has the complexity and layering of a wine aged a long time on the yeast, and shows excellent concentration that leads to a long, lingering finish. This is Schramsberg's top-of-the-line Chardonnay-based wine and it definitely lives up to its billing in this vintage. Best after 2023.
title: 97pointsSchramsberg 2009 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)Cellar Selection

description: Both delicate and flavorful, this exceptional wine defines elegance. It starts with a subtly spicy ginger-cookie aroma that leads to layers of citrus, baking spices and toasted bread on the rich palate. After 18 years since the vintage, this still offers persistent, fine bubbles, bracing acidity and a fresh mouthfeel.
title: Schramsberg 2000 J. Schram Late Disgorged Sparkling (North Coast)

description: A yellowish copper shade, this forward and fruity wine seems slightly oxidized, though not necessarily to its detriment. It's loaded with Christmas cake flavors and finishes with a metallic aftertaste. Drink up.
title: R. Stuart & Co. NV Rosé d'OR Sparkling (Oregon)

description: A crisp texture and rather full body carry subtle spice and lean dry fruit flavors in this nicely reserved and complex wine. Apple skin, lemon zest and hints of toasted almond carry the palate and linger on the finish.
title: Schramsberg 2014 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Freshly smashed lemon aromas meet with yeast and sourdough on the nose of this excellent bubbly bottling. The palate's bubbles are soft and inviting, with flavors of yuzu, fresh bread and the slightest hints of smoke and ash.
designation: Blanc de Noirs Bien Nacido Vineyard
title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Blanc de Noirs Bien Nacido Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made from equal parts Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and late-disgorged after seven years en tirage, this is the winery's top-of-the-line bubbly, and it shows. Gorgeous wafts of peach skin tease the nose before dry, layered components of lemon peel, white flower and apple skin shine on the palate, dipped in a strong mineral streak of crushed stone.
title: Iron Horse 2010 Brut LD Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A mingling of 55% Pinot Noir and 45% Chardonnay, this imparts nicely complex, layered elements of brioche, wet stone and lemon rind, the acidity tenacious and complementary. Dry, its late disgorging makes for admirable length and breadth.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2007 Carneros Cuvée Late Disgorged Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Made from 90% Pinot Noir and 10% Chardonnay, this is cranberry colored and flavored, with a rich, thick mousse. Delicately textured, it has back notes of orange and strawberry and bright, fresh, persistent acidity and a complex lingering of seashell.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2015 Late Disgorged Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Rich and round with underlying notes of wet stone, apple and lemon peel, this beautifully made wine benefits National Geographic's Ocean Initiative, helping to support sustainable fishing and establish marine protected areas. It finishes crisp and dry with lasting elegance—as good to drink as it's doing good.
designation: National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs
title: Iron Horse 2014 National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Perennially delicious, this vintage holds up tradition by offering fresh, strong flavors of strawberry, raspberry and vanilla cookie. Blending 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir from several vineyards, including Tognetti and Hyde, it's floral and softly interwoven—a fresh, focused delight. A portion of proceeds goes to Napa agricultural land preservation.
title: Schramsberg 2014 Querencia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Quite complex and subtly spicy, this elegant wine gives a full array of flavors, a crisp but polished texture and a wonderful lingering finish. It has a light-copper-gold color, aromas like ginger cookies and freshly baked bread and flavors of peaches and delicate rose petals accented by light baking spices.
title: Schramsberg 2009 J. Schram Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This complex and mature wine shows how interesting and layered a fine sparkling wine can become with time. It was aged on the yeast lees for the extremely long period of 16 years before disgorging. Honey, butterscotch and grilled baguette aromas give way to rich mellow fruit and spice flavors and a creamy, mouth-filling texture livened by fine bubbles and mild acidity.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Reserve Late Disgorged Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This blends 61% Pinot Noir, 35% Chardonnay and 4% Pinot Meunier. Dry and crisp, it offers flavors of Gravenstein apple, stone and lemon peel. It is refreshing, layered and complex.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuvée XB Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine celebrates diversity and is beautifully layered and fresh in a rounded peach tone. Moderate structure gives way to plenty of brioche richness on the palate.
title: Iron Horse 2014 Rainbow Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A clean shade of yellow hay in the glass, the nose on this bottling is very inviting with aromas of baking croissant, baking soda and lemon peel. The palate combines strong yeast with crushed chalk and clay flavors, proving quite creamy in texture.
title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Cremant Sierra Madre Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dry and fresh in acidity, with rounded corners of richness, this sings in apple, almond paste and a nice twist of gingersnap that lingers on the thickly moussed finish.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Tiny bubbles keep rising long after this dry and crisp wine made from 100% Chardonnay is poured. It has a lemony flavor with almost salty, nutty accents and vivid acidity to keep it clean and balanced.
title: Schramsberg 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This aged blend of Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay has an intense mousse on entry, a layering of flavor dipped in green apple and lemon. Structured and crisp, it tastes dry, complex and layered.
title: Breathless 2012 Méthode Champenoise Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Silky and rich, with a dry palate that's lengthy and robust in mousse, this is a lovely expression of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay bubbly, delightfully tasting of strawberry and peach.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Creamy and lush, this late-disgorged blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay has a slightly metallic edge that adds earthy complexity and intrigue to the medium-bodied mix. Flavors lean into green apple, pear and strawberry with ease.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2010 Extra Brut LD Reserve Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This elegant and well-balanced wine has a brilliant copper color, tangy cherry and apple-skin flavors and a mouth-filling mousse. It tastes nicely dry and a bit lean and nervy in character.
title: Schramsberg 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Broadly defined in honeysuckle, peach, brioche and moderate acidity, this is a crowd-pleasing and immensely likable sparkling wine. The finish lingers on a deep, nutty tone.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuvée 20 Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Thick and rich in feel but with fresh acidity, this wine tastes of lemon, strawberry and a touch of grapefruit. It is layered and complex while offering approachable rewards, made from a majority of Pinot Noir with smaller amounts of Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: This is made from 100% Pinot Noir grapes grown on the producer's Olivet Grange Vineyard—a fun, quaffing wine with plenty of quality to back up its whimsy. Light-orange-yellow in color, it's funky and earthy in flavors of wild strawberry, wet stone and dried herb.
designation: Whole Buncha Bubbles Blanc de Noir
title: Inman Family 2014 Whole Buncha Bubbles Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A subtle shade of pink-yellow in the glass, this bottling shows light strawberry and a touch of sourdough on the nose. Framed by laser-sharp bubbles, the palate offers rounded plum flavors alongside grapefruit rinds and the sour kick of green-apple skins.
title: Broken Earth 2016 Sotto Voce Grenache Rosé Sparkling (Paso Robles)

description: Very fruity, fresh and lively, this well-balanced and delicious wine has soothing bubbles and vivid citrus and apple flavors accented by floral and pistachio notes.
title: Lichen Estate 2014 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Though this red bubbly wine may explode all over the kitchen, the hassle is worth the effort. Aromas of black cherry, tart boysenberry and clove lead into full-flavored palate of blackberry and baking spice. The mouthfeel is quite lavish and there's the slightest sense of sweetness.
title: Broken Earth 2015 Sotto Voce Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: Bold in fruit flavor and very dry, this medium-bodied Pinot Gris smells tangy and fresh, tastes crisp and lively like tart cherries and lemons, and seems to have very low residual sugar.
title: Lichen Estate 2014 Blanc de Gris Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Blending 51% Chardonnay with 49% Pinot Noir, this is a creamy rounded sparkling wine of moderate structure, opting for fleshy opulence in abundance. It tastes of green apple, melon and peach.
title: JCB 2014 No. 9 Brut Sparkling (Los Carneros)

description: Fresh fruity aromas of brioche, raspberry, rose hips, citrus and spice are followed by bright tart fruit flavors, with plentiful lees accents. Apple notes linger on the finish.
title: Callan NV Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made from a majority of Pinot Noir, the minority Chardonnay, this wine is focused in green-apple aromas and flavors. The acidity is fresh, dry and balanced within a thick mousse of understated richness.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Examples of this style are rare in the state. Aromas of baked bread and citrus lead to light sharp-edged fruit flavors. It delivers a pleasing elegance. Light smoky notes persist on the finish.
title: Full Pull & Friends NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Nature Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made from 51% Chardonnay and 49% Pinot Noir, this is a broad and rich sparkling wine with ample mousse and body weight. Peach, apple and almond paste mingle on the midpalate with ease.
title: JCB 2014 No. 24 Brut Sparkling (Los Carneros)

description: This wine is made exclusively from Pinot Noir. A pretty pale salmon color, the aromas bring notes of baked bread and strawberry, with quite tart fruit flavors backed by lively acidity.
title: Gruet NV Brut Rosé Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (America)

description: This fruity wine made from 100% Pinot Noir has a light-peach color, powerful effervescence and frank flavors like red cherries that make it refreshing and tasty. It comes from an under-the-radar appellation just east of Napa County.
title: Rock Wall 2017 Blanc de Noir Loney Ranch Sparkling (Suisun Valley)

description: This very fruity and slightly sweet wine has a hot-pink color, bold aromas of cherries and strawberries and a simply fruity flavor.
title: Van Ruiten 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Lodi)

description: This top-tier wine from the Long Island sparkling house shows a wonderfully developed nose of toasted almond, citrus cream and brioche. Soft, small-bead bubbles roll across the palate, carrying a concentrated stream of citrus and salty nut flavors that linger for days on the finish. This méthode Champenoise is a blend of 45% Chardonnay, 40% Pinot Noir and 15% Pinot Meunier and was aged eight years on the lees.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2008 Brut Séduction  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This zero-dosage méthode Champenoise bottling is warm and inviting on the nose, marked by brioche, lemon custard and pie crust notes. Its smooth perlage boasts ripe citrus and blanched almond flavors, with a tangy saline tone that lingers long on the finish. It was aged 70 months on the lees before disgorgement in February 2017.
designation: Blanc de Blanc Estate Grown & Grown
title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2013 Blanc de Blanc Estate Grown & Grown  (Seneca Lake)

description: This bubbly pink blend is one of the better canned wines on the market, regardless of style. A blend of 57% Grenache, 18% Grenache Blanc with bits of Mourvèdre, Roussanne, Carignan and Cinsaut, it shows rounded watermelon, nectarine and grapefruit-rind aromas on the nose. The palate is crisp with strawberry, melon, red-apple and tart plum-skin flavors.
designation: La Bulle-Moose de Cigare Fizzy Pink of the Earth
title: Bonny Doon 2017 La Bulle-Moose de Cigare Fizzy Pink of the Earth Sparkling (Central Coast)

description: This 100% Chardonnay méthode Champenoise sparkler boasts bright lemon rind, green apple and brioche aromas. Small bubbles frame its light-bodied palate, with crisp tree fruit, clarified butter and blanched almond flavors. An invigorating salty note carries the finish.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2013 Séduction Blanc de Blancs  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Layers of yellow and green apple, citrus and pastry cream abound in this fruity sparkler. It's frothy and brisk on the palate, with loads of juicy, crisp fruit flavors that finish zesty and fresh.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2015 Brut  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Strawberry shortbread and vanilla cream aromas appear on the nose of this wine. The palate is frothy with aggressive bubbles, but forward flavors of tart raspberry, yellow plum skin and pie crust shine through, leading to an astringent, brisk finish.
title: Lieb 2015 Reserve Sparkling Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Supervivid aromas of fresh strawberries, raspberries and white cherries meld with a hint of buttercream on the nose of this sparkler. Its soft, small bubbles carry the same enthusiastic flavors, with a refreshing, crisp finish. Perfect for summer garden parties alongside fresh fruit salad and strawberry shortcake.
title: Wölffer 2014 Noblesse Oblige Extra Brut Rosé Sparkling (Long Island)

description: This sparkling wine offers ripe raspberry and Montmorency cherry aromas. The palate is light in feel, with a refreshing strawberries-in-cream flavor. It's an easy, crowd-pleasing wine that's perfect for the beach or a barbecue.
title: Atwater NV Bubble Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Ripe yellow apple, pear and tangerine notes show brightly on the nose of this wine. Its frothy bubbles carry juicy fruit flavors that finish crisp and clean but short. Made predominately from Cayuga, this is an easy, crowd-pleasing sparkler.
title: Damiani NV Bollicine Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: This blanc de blancs offers toasted brioche, citrus cream and drawn butter aromas. It's rich and broad on the palate, with a balanced perlage that carries crisp yellow apple, citrus rind and bitter almond skin flavors.
title: City Winery of New York 2012 Brut Nature Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: An interesting combination of fennel seed and citrus notes leads the nose of this Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier sparkler. The texture is rounded and bolstered by small, persistent bubbles, with citrus and bitter almond skin accents that hide under a savory, almost meaty note.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2013 Séduction Blanc de Noirs  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Heady aromas of earthy gardenia, potpourri and tangerine mark this non-disgorged, bottle conditioned sparkler. It's a blend of Pinot Noir and Viognier, and the latter contributes a lot of the floral, orange rind and grapefruit tones.
title: Anthony Nappa NV Frizzante Sparkling (New York)

description: Crisp and elegant, this sophisticated wine has enticing mineral and bread-dough aromas, tiny bubbles that form a soothing mousse and bone-dry lemon, mineral and ginger flavors. It tastes steely at first sip and then slowly opens to more richness and depth. Best through 2023.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Late Disgorged Méthode Traditionnelle Brut
title: Schramsberg 2006 Blanc de Blancs Late Disgorged Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: High-toned red cherry and cranberry aromas mark the nose of this Pinot Noir-based sparkler. Its light-bodied palate boasts strawberry jam and cranberry skin flavors, with a mild tannic grip.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2014 Noir de Noirs  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Made from estate-grown grapes, 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay, this dry delicious wine sings in high-acid lemon zest and pulp. It's layered, focused, fresh, tart and simply delicious.
title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Ultra Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Made from estate-grown Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Gris, this wine is focused in acidity, with dry, fresh components of lemon and green apple. Complex in mineral overtones, it offers a taste of oyster shell and wet stone.
title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Rather rough in the mouth, with sharp elbows, but dry and clean.
title: Schramsberg NV Mirabelle Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This medium-bodied, steely and austere wine has a pale orange-gold color, citrus and green-apple aromas and crisp, dry flavors like grapefruit. It has light almond and earth accents and is driven by good acidity for a refreshing mouthfeel. Extra brut means truly dry, and this wine shows how appealing the style can be.
title: Schramsberg 2009 Extra Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This is an earthy, nutty and dry sparkling wine, made from Chardonnay, that tastes of apple skin and lemon zest. Textured tight acidity buoys the flavors and provides lasting freshness in the glass.
title: Kokomo 2014 Peters Vineyard Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sourdough aromas meet with preserved lemon and chalk on the nose of this bottling from a newer estate project north of Highway 246. Lemon and grapefruit pith make for a tangy palate, with more yeasty elements reminding of Old World grower bottlings.
title: Strange Family Vineyards 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is certain to please large crowds, starting with its brilliant pink color and clean aromas of bubblegum, raspberry and chalk. It's taut and tight in texture, with pink-lemonade and fresh framboise flavors that will appease both experts and neophytes.
title: Sofia 2017 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Monterey County)

description: This wine smells earthy at first, tastes quite dry and minerally and has a savory edge on the finish. It is nicely austere, very tight in texture and seems to hold its fruit flavors tightly too. With time in the glass the bold character of the Pinot Noir base wine takes over.
title: Schramsberg 2012 Redding Ranch Brut Sparkling (Marin County)

description: A rustier shade of pink, this bottling shows aromas of reduced strawberry, cola and baking bread. The palate blends intriguing nuances of cooked strawberries with sour-yeast flavors.
title: Strange Family Vineyards 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Made in a Brut style from 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, this sparkling wine is high in acidity with a metallic edge to the palate, simple and dry in execution with highlights of tart applesauce and lemon zest.
title: Korbel 2014 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Preserved lemon and funky yeast aromas show on the nose of this bottling by a new project, whose winemaking is handled by Steve Clifton. The mouthfeel is very full, with loads of yuzu, saffron, yeast, exotic Asian spice and sharp lemon-rind flavors.
title: Strange Family Vineyards 2015 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Warm aromas of brioche, toasted apple, cinnamon and baking spice show on the nose of this bottling. It's clean, crisp and rounded on the palate, tasting a bit like a riper Chardonnay with butter and stone fruit, but quite inviting.
title: Strange Family Vineyards 2014 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Slightly sweet in dosage, with a distinct finish of sugar, this Pinot Noir and Chardonnay sparkler is crisp in acidity and very clean. It has forward flavors of strawberries, raspberries, brioche, toast, vanilla and cinnamon spice.
designation: Cuvee de la Pompadour Brut Rosé
title: Domaine Carneros NV Cuvee de la Pompadour Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, with a little Pinot Meunier, this bubbly is really too rough to earn a better score. Instead of a nice, creamy smoothness, it's a jagged, harshly angular wine, but it is dry and clean.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2001 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: With sparkling wine, it's all about finesse. Well, mostly. You want a nice, smooth, silky mouthfeel. This wine doesn't have one. It's all jagged, sharp; it cuts the palate. On the plus side, it's nicely dry, with pronounced strawberry flavors.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: On the sweet side, but so nicely acidified and delicious in fruit that you hardly notice the sugar, which just gives the wine a round softness. Beautiful hazelnut, peaches-and-cream and vanilla flavors, with a touch of raspberry zest.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Brut Classic Sparkling (California)

description: This is the most full-bodied of Mumm's current sparklers and despite the lack of a vintage designation, it has the weight and complexity of a true tête de cuvée. Nearly half Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, with a drop or two of other whites, it's creamy and rich in citrus and peach flavors, with a hint of strawberries.
title: Mumm Napa NV Reserve Brut Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Seriously good sparkler, so rich, smooth and supple, so elegant and refined, yet packed with the most delicious candied strawberry, vanilla cream, smoky char and even white chocolate flavors. For all that, it's dry and racy.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2003 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This is a wonderful BdB, so refined and elegant, with such a smooth, satin-and-silk mouthfeel, which is really what you want in an upscale sparkling wine. With one-third Pinot Gris in with the Chardonnay, it shows white and yellow stone fruit, mainly citrus, flavors, with a savory brioche fullness, and a clean and dry finish.
title: Mumm Napa 2001 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This is always one of Iron Horse's nicest sparklers. It seems softer, rounder, creamier and fruitier than the others it certainly is relatively high in alcohol, yet is no less elegant. Just delicious in strawberry, lime, vanilla and lees flavors, with a clean, uplifting finish.
title: Iron Horse 2003 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This is a really good wine. It has the kind of smooth, elegantly silky texture of a fine Champagne, and is delicate but complex, with brioche, vanilla custard, peach, strawberry and lime zest flavors. You can taste the dosage in the honeyed finish. Best now through 2010.
title: Laetitia 2002 Cuvée M Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Released at the same time as Chandon's 2000 Etoile, this is built along the same elegant, classic lines, but it's younger, fresher and, being a rosé, quite a bit richer in fruit. In fact, it's extraordinarily delicious, a mélange of sorbets ranging from raspberry, cherry and peach to lime and vanilla. The finish is crisp and clean. Should hang in there through the decade.
title: Domaine Chandon 2001 Etoile Rosé Sparkling (Mendocino-Napa-Sonoma)

description: The '96 Royal Cuvée has provided years of excellent drinking, and so will this worthy followup. It's a rich, complex bubbly, two-thirds Pinot Noir and the rest Chardonnay, with full-bodied cherry vanilla, egg custard, yeast, smoke and spice flavors. The tension between the creamy texture and the high acidity is really interesting.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1997 Royal Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Exceptionally refined in texture, this is a rich, layered sparkler. Based mostly on Pinot Noir, it has full-bodied nectarine, strawberry  and jasmine tea flavors, complexed with bread dough and smoky char, and finishes very dry. But best of all is that texture, pure silk and satin.
title: Schramsberg 2003 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma)

description: At 11 years, this 100% Chardonnay sparkler has achieved a taffeta softness that just melts in the mouth. With residual sugar of 0.9%, it shows a distinctly honeyed taste. Offers beautifully rich, mature lemondrop, vanilla and and butterscotchy dough flavors, with keen acidity. As good as it is, let it develop through 2008 and beyond.
title: Iron Horse 1996 Blanc de Blancs LD Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Just beautiful, one of the best DVXs ever. The vintage gave this Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend great ripeness to go with elegant balance. The flavors are enormously complex, offering swirls of brioche, citrus zest, vanilla, roasted almond skin, toasted coconut and raspberry purée, and the finish is refreshingly crisp and dry, yet also slightly honeyed. Feels classy all the way.
title: Mumm Napa 1999 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This is a first tête de cuvée rosé from Schramsberg. The North Coast appellation is because the grapes come from four counties. It's 75% Chardonnay, with the rest Pinot Noir, and it's seriously good. The residual sugar is noticeable, but the acidity (8.7 grams) is so high that it balances out, and also ensures a long life. Don't touch until at least 2007, but it's likely to gain interest and complexity through 2015, at least.
title: Schramsberg 1998 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)

description: An astonishingly brilliant bubbly, one of the best ever from Schramsberg or indeed any California winery, this Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend strikes with sheer beauty. It's so delicate and refined yet so powerful, defining Champagne qualities of finesse and elegance. Rewarding now, but the parts are far from melding. Best 2007–2012.
title: Schramsberg 2000 Reserve Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: This is Chandon's vintage brut. It is a blend of 75 percent Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. The wine has been aged on the lees, and is quite dry. You'll notice right away how silky it is, how it caresses the palate. The flavors are subtle, suggesting the faintest cherries, raspberries, peaches, vanilla, smoke. The finish is elegant. The price is entirely fair.
title: Domaine Chandon 2000 Etoile Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Heavily toasted on the nose, with char and vanilla leading the way, then smoth, creamy flavors of apple, pear and vanilla with crême brulée accents. High in acidity and meant to last, this is a well-rounded and put-together wine that should be enjoyed until 2010.
title: Gruet 1999 Gilbert Gruet Grande Reserve Sparkling (New Mexico)

description: A classic blend of Pinot Noir, with Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay, this is really a terrific sparkler. It's soft and round and elegant, a true bubbly rosé that offers rich strawberry, peaches and cream and vanilla flavors that are subtle and complex.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: With a dash of Chardonnay added for brightness, this Pinot Noir-based sparkler sure is rich and complex. It's fierce in fine little bubbles, with long, deep flavors that are just a teensy bit sweet in dosage, but very high acidity balances that right out. The wine has a certain roughness that should melt away with three to five years of bottle age.
title: Schramsberg 2002 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This is one of the reddest BdNs I've ever seen, and the wine is correspondingly full-bodied and varietally rich. It shows frank strawberry and raspberry flavors, yet maintains a dry elegance and even a light silkiness. Should be fabulous with Ahi tuna, especially tartare.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2001 Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
