description: Expensive, yes, but aims high and largely succeeds in finesse and elegance. Drinks long, smooth and rich, with layers of citrus, vanilla, lees, toasted coconut and smoky wood that finish complex. This is the first sparkling wine from this winery I've tasted, and it's a quite impressive.
title: Cottonwood Canyon 2000 Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Laetitia is one of the best table wine producers in the appellation, and it's no surprise this Chardonnay-Pinot Blanc blend is so good. It's complex, with rich lemon zest, yeasty brioche and peach-vanilla cream flavors that finish dry and long. Will benefit from a little bottle age to take the edge off.
title: Laetitia 2003 Brut de Blancs Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This polished bubbly hits the palate with a blast of fizzy acidity, then settles down to deliver rich, subtle peach, strawberry, vanilla and smoky, doughy flavors. It's a dry wine, but you can taste the dosage. All the parts haven't come together yet. Age this copper-colored beauty for four or five years.
title: Schramsberg 2003 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Pinot Noir has given this bubbly a full-bodied richness that smacks of red cherries. It's a dry wine, a little sharp and angular, but maintains a distinguished creamy mouthfeel.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: All Chardonnay, this wine has a dry elegance that makes it taste really upscale. It shows subtle peach, bread dough, smoky char and vanilla flavors, and is quite acidic. Makes you think of wedding toasts.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A still-young wine with new oak aromas of buttered toast and caramel. A bit sharp in the mouth, but with plenty of baked apple, cinnamon and vanilla flavor. Finishes with a dash of apple cider.
title: Gruet 2000 Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (New Mexico)

description: Crisp and fruity, with pronounced peach, apple, quince and vanilla flavors that taste a little sweet, with a full dosage, but nicely offset by very high acidity. Finishes clean and doughy.
title: Schramsberg 2002 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: An interesting blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Pinot Meunier and Pinot Gris, this bubbly shows complex flavors of bread dough, yellow citrus fruits and wildflowers, but is subtle and dry. One of the nicer things is the mouthfeel, which is light and refined. Finishes with real elegance. Production is an amazing 300,000 cases.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: A nice, classy bubbly that shows the character of Iron Horse's more expensive sparkling wines, but at a lower price. Mainly Pinot Noir, it's full-bodied and dry, with suggestions of strawberries, yeast and vanilla.
title: Iron Horse 2001 Classic Vintage Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Bread-doughy and acidic, this carbonically rough bubbly has flavors of limes, strawberries, vanilla and toast. It's a dry wine, but you can taste the sugary dosage on the finish.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Feels a bit rough and sandpapery, but otherwise it's a nicely dry wine, with good structure and true Champagne flavors of citrus, cherry cream and yeast. Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Noir.
title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This is one of the lower dosage Korbel bubblies, and quite dry. It's a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and has a very smooth, refined mouthfeel, with delicate flavors of citrus, yeast, honey and a touch of strawberry.
title: Korbel 2004 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Odd, but Chandon's Reserve is rougher and more scouring in the mouth than their less expensive Brut Classic. Maybe it's the dosage. This is drier. But it's also not as smooth or rich. The flavors are deep and long, but the texture is like a Spanish cava, brusque and angular.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Reserve Brut Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Classic Korbel brut, elegant, delicate and inexpensive. Nobody does a better job at this price. The wine is dry, with subtle lime, strawberry, peach, yeast and vanilla flavors, and a finish of real elegance. Hard to believe they produced 750,000 cases.
title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: A little rough in texture, but delicious, with a rich mélange of strawberry parfait, brioche, lime juice, peaches and cream and toast flavors that finish long and dry. Contains 85% Pinot Noir, with the balance Chardonnay, and is easy to find, with 95,000 cases.
title: Mumm Napa NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this bubbly is a little rough in texture, but it's nicely dry and clean, with pleasant strawberries and cream, yeasty lees and vanilla flavors.
title: Schramsberg NV Mirabelle Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: A dry, brut-style wine that's a little heavy for a bubbly, but with real yeasty Champagne character. Give the wine a bit more elegance and it's a winner.
title: l'homme qui ris 1998 Sparkling Wine  (Monterey County)

description: Here's a sweetie. With its vanilla cream, lime sorbet and raspberry purée flavors balanced by rich acidity, and at an affordable price for good bubbly, it's destined to wash down many a wedding cake.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Starts off nicely with scents of yeast that pick up white tropical fruits and freshly picked apples. Peachy flavors again have apple tones, while the acidity is high, just what you need to start off your evening. A bit heavy in the bubbles, though.
title: Gruet NV Blanc de Noirs Brut Sparkling (New Mexico)

description: It's silly to call your sweetest release “extra dry,” but that's the convention. Whatever, this is a pretty good bubbly. It's certainly off-dry to overtly sweet, but very acidy, with raspberry, peach and yeasty dough flavors.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Riche Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: Bright yellow with fresh lime aromas and flavors of yellow fruit and pear. A bubbly, broad wine that lacks the substance of some of Gruets other bottlings.
title: Gruet NV Brut Sparkling (New Mexico)

description: All of Korbel's new sparklers are good values -- when are they not? But this rosé is particularly elegant and delicious. It's not just the strawberries, lemon zest, vanilla and yeasty dough flavors, which are tasty enough, it's the mouthfeel, which shows  real Champagne finesse and silkiness. This blend of Russian River Pinot Noir and Sangiovese, Chenin Blanc and Gamay from the Delta is addictively drinkable.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: Actually a Blanc de Blancs, since it's 100% Chardonnay, this is a wine of great purity, maybe because of the organic grapes. The bread dough, vanilla and subtle peach flavors have a very rich, creamy texture, without the jaggedness of ordinary bubblies. This is an important new addition to California's sparkling wine portfolio.
title: Jeriko 2001 Brut Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: All of Korbel's new sparklers are good values—when are they not? But this rosé is particularly elegant and delicious. It's not just the strawberries, lemon zest, vanilla and yeasty dough flavors, which are tasty enough, it's the mouthfeel, which shows real Champagne finesse and silkiness. This blend of Russian River Pinot Noir and Sangiovese, Chenin Blanc and Gamay from the Sacramento Delta is addictively drinkable.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: The aroma's fresh, clean and yeasty on this young nonvintage, brut-style sparkler. In the mouth, it's a little rough in texture, with forward flavors of peaches and limes. Give it a few years to begin softening.
title: Codorníu Napa NV Grand Reserve Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Made from Pinot Noir, this bubbly is quite dark in color, and those Pinot flavors of cherries, strawberries, cola and tea really star. As full-bodied as it is, the wine is effervescently delicate, and completely dry. Try with sushi.
title: Schug 2002 Rouge de Noirs Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Looks as golden pale as a classic brut, but the full-bodied, ripe flavors of cherries and cassis-infused cream give it away as Cabernet Sauvignon. It's an unusual bubbly, but delicious, and fruity-rich enough to wash down everything from steak to chocolate cake.
title: Sjoeblom Winery 2001 Chauvignon Reserve Blanc de Noirs Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Always serviceably clean and dry, Handley's brut is a good everyday sparkler, forward in fruit and bright in cool-climate acidity, while a little rough in texture.
title: Handley 2000 Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Nice and dry, with crisp acidity and a good stream of bubbles, this sparkler has pleasantly yeasty flavors of peaches and cream. The finish is clean and satisfying.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Cuvée Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: Frankly sweet, and zesty in acidity, this is a nice, clean bubbly for those who like a bit of sugar in the finish. It has pleasant flavors of tangerine and vanilla, with a light, delicate mouthfeel.
title: Ballatore NV Gran Spumante Sparkling (California)

description: Shares many of the same qualities as Roederer's vintage brut, which is one of California's best. It's crisp and elegant and delicately flavored, with a rich yeasty edge, but it's a little too sweet in the dosage.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: A lovely, blush-colored bubbly, with strong aromas and flavors and a full, rich body. Citrus, rose petal, strawberry, vanilla, yeast and toast flavors mingle in a crisp, dry wine that has a very long, fruity finish.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Crisp and clean, with bright citrus and toast notes that finish lively on the tongue. Fresh and light.
title: Glenora 1996 25th anniversary Cuvee  (New York)

description: A little sweet, and kind of rough and sandpapery, but it fits the bill when you need a quick bubbly to celebrate.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Premium Extra Dry Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: The rosé is especially nice; with a pretty cherry core of sweet fruit. Basically it is free run (saignée) juice with a smidgen (two percent of  still wine added to brighten the color. Barrel aged and fermented; 300 cases produced.
title: Mountain Dome NV Rosé Sparkling (Washington)

description: This is the winery's reserve cuvée, first produced in 1995 and released for the Millennium. It's half pinot and half chardonnay, made from the best of the best grapes and vintages. This is just the second release in the winery's two decade history. Though NV, it is based on the very ripe 1998 vintage. The winery's most elegant sparkling wine, it has a fine, textured mouthfeel and nicely nuanced flavors of pear, apple and light citrus. The over-the-top fruitiness of the regular brut is tamed, and it has the grace and texture of a genuine Champagne.
title: Mountain Dome NV Cuvée Forté Sparkling (Washington)

description: This is a rough, rustic sparkler, with a jagged mouthfeel that frames dry flavors of bubble gum.
title: Mosby 2004 Stelline di Cortese Cortese (Santa Barbara County)

description: This lush, fruity blend is two thirds  pinot noir, one third chardonnay, and mostly from the 2001 vintage. It is a delicious, every day, méthode champenoise sparkling wine with crisp, fleshy, green apple flavors. Fruit-driven, it's got good punch and persistence, and a clean and refreshing finish.
title: Mountain Dome NV Brut Sparkling (Washington)

description: Here's a polished, elegant wine, very dry, with delicate flavors of citrus rind, bread dough and yeast, toast and vanilla. It's has a lightness and charm on the palate that make it irresistible.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: For starters, this is a very fine wine, architecturally clean, bone dry and strong in acids. It's too young to fully enjoy now, though, all raw elbows and yeast. If you don't mind that edgy sharpness, try it as an apéritif, but it will benefit from five years or longer in the cellar.
title: Schramsberg 1999 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)

description: At five years, this bubbly is drinkable, but it needs further cellaring. The acidic texture roughhouses the mouth, creating that pins and needles sensation. The wine is balanced enough to stick away in a cool cellar through 2008, by which time it ought to be smooth and approachable.
title: Domaine Carneros 1999 La Reve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: It's crazy that this is Schramsberg's “regular” brut because it's really reserve quality. Utterly smooth and elegant, it has a satin texture framing delicate layers of citrus, peach and yeast, with a long finish of toasted almond.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Still young, acidic and rough, this bubbly isn't showing its best now. But all indications are in favor of cellaring for five years. The wine has a solid core of peach and strawberry fruit, a fine, clean doughy taste, brilliant acidity, a long, powerful finish and the balance and finesse to develop bottle complexity.
title: Domaine Chandon 1997 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: A lovely follow-up to the outstanding '94, this well-integrated, perfectly aged brut is still crisp and showing hints of fresh apple, along with beeswax, citrus and gooseberry. It shows off with a gorgeous mousse, and persistent fresh flavors that linger without cracking up.
title: Argyle 1995 Extended Tirage Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: Maybe it's all marketing, but this does seem to be an ideal wedding- toast bubbly. There's something for everyone. Despite being almost all Pinot Noir, it's light and delicate, with a crisp elegance and a fine mousse, and that effervescent pleasure that only a fine bubbly provides.
title: Iron Horse 2002 Wedding Cuvee Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: LD Blancs de Noirs are rare. The trick is to take the heaviness of all that lees and and Pinot Noir fruit and transmute it into elegance. Schramsberg displays a sure hand. The wine is still leesy and oaky, and certainly acidic, but despite its age, it should coast easily through the next 10 years and beyond, mellowing with each passing year.
title: Schramsberg 1994 Blanc de Noirs Late Disgorged Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino)

description: This is a highly pedigreed wine. You can judge that by the exceptionally smooth texture, and the fine quality of all the parts. It's elegant and complex, and despite being 11 years old, the wine is still scoury and pert in acids, guaranteeing it a long future. The dosage gives it a honeyed finish.
title: Schramsberg 1994 Blanc de Blancs Late Disgorged Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Twice the price of the winery's nonvintage brut, and what do you get? A much better wine, a lot smoother in mousse, with a great degree of elegance. The raspberry and cherry-tinged flavors have a complex edge of vanilla, toast and yeasty lees.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Rich as sin, and packed with white peach and vanilla flavors, this dry wine shows the finesse, lightness and elegance of a Chardonnay-based sparkling wine. The mousse is creamy, the finish long and decadent. Will be lovely with cracked crab and sourdough bread.
designation: Mt. Veeder Single Vineyard Blanc de Blancs
title: Domaine Chandon 2000 Mt. Veeder Single Vineyard Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Mount Veeder)

description: This is the fullest, biggest of Schramsberg's current lineup of bruts, a powerfully fruity but dry wine that never loses sight of elegance, delicacy and finesse. There's something joyfully effervescent about the way the cherry, cream, yeast and spice flavors come together and play on the palate.
title: Schramsberg 2002 Brut Rose Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Compared to the winery's '99 Reserve, with which it was co-released, this bubbly is slightly sweeter, softer and smoother. It's a fancy wine, drinkable now with crab cakes or smoked salmon or on its own, of course. Chardonnay-based, the wine possesses a light elegance and very great finesse. But it should age well over the next ten years.
title: Schramsberg 1999 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This is a fabulously rich wine, full-bodied and complex in cherry, peach, vanilla, yeast, lychee, roasted almond and charcoal. It's also exceptionally delicate and fine, with a silk-and-satin mouthfeel that's as light as air. It's showing a bit of age but has yet to come into its own, suggesting a good 5–10 additional years of cellaring.
title: Schramsberg 1998 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)

description: There's more going on in this wine than in a New York minute. It's rich and young, brimming with acid, yeast and citrus fruit, and with a finish of toast and char. But it has a depth and nobility that make it complex and ageworthy. Should hold easily through 2010.
title: Iron Horse 1996 Blanc de Blancs LD Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: The winery's priciest bubbly is easily its best, finessing the roughness of the lesser blends with a smoothness that glides across the palate like silk. It displays peaches and cream Chard flavor, and a wonderful balance and dryness. Finishes with classic Champagne elegance.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1996 Late Disgorged Brut Carneros Cuvee Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This is a gigantic wine, but it's so well structured and refined, so beautiful, you can drink it now and fall in love with it. It's perfectly balanced,  enormously complex and not too sweet; the highest-scoring California sparkler we've ever tasted, blending rich toasty notes with well-ripened fruit. This fabulous wine should come together, mellow and gain complexity for a decade. Only available in magnums or larger bottles.
title: Schramsberg 1994 Reserve Late Disgorged Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Years of lees contact have made this bubbly soft, creamy and complex, although it still has a crisp spine of acidity. The flavors are rich and doughy, with a ripe finish of strawberries and peaches. It's a little sweet, and should hold well for several years.
title: Domaine Chandon 1999 L'Etoile Brut Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Soft (for bubbly), light, young and showing pretty flavors of cherry candy. It's 100% Pinot Noir, a bit foamy in the glass, but smooth and lingering, though light as a summer breeze.
title: Argyle 2003 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: Rich and full-bodied, this Pinot Noir-dominated wine has a cherry and strawberry flavor along with the doughy yeast and vanilla. It's also a little sweet, but crisp, tingly acidity balances that. Bottom line: deliciously drinkable.
title: Domaine Chandon 2000 Étoile Rosé  (Mendocino-Napa-Sonoma)

description: This is the fullest-bodied of Laetitia's crop of bubblies. It has a tinge of raspberries and strawberries, but is still an elegantly structured, silky wine, a nice interpretation of Central Coast sparkling wine.
title: Laetitia 2001 Brut de Noir Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: The smoothest and suavest of Mumm's current offerings, this fruit-forward bubbly has a slightly sweet dosage. Fortunately, it's crisp in acidity. The peach, bread dough, vanilla and cherry flavors are delicious, with a long aftertaste.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Reserve Brut Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: A pale copper color, Schramsberg's Blanc de Noirs is richer than the Blanc de Blancs, with a fuller body. It's also a little  more coarse, with pretty flavors of cherry cream and yeast. Try this powerful bubbly with curried lamb.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Blanc de Noirs Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Interesting that Iron Horse has released this at eight years of age. It's still a young, acidic wine, but is mellowing, with a tantalizingly sweet core of peaches and cream just edging into crème brûlée. This complex bubbly should develop well throughout the decade.
title: Iron Horse 1997 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: The Russians liked sugar in their Champagne, and this cuvée is one of Iron Horse's sweeter ones. The residual sugar makes it round and mellow despite crisp acidity. But the finish is dry and whistle-clean.
title: Iron Horse 2000 Russian Cuvee Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Robust and elegant, this bubbly has Chardonnay flavors of peaches, while Pinot Noir gives it a cherry tinge and a fuller body. It's crisp in acids, and finishes with a fine bread dough taste and pronounced sweetness that's almost off-dry.
title: Hagafen 2001 Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: A little rough and scoury around the edges, but gets the job done with some nice doughy, citrus fruit flavors and a dry, crisp finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine Carneros 2002 Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A great big waft of cherries erupts from the glass, signaling a fruity wine, which indeed this bubbly is. Its full-bodied flavors have a nice yeasty, doughy quality, and the wine is fully dry, although somewhat rough in texture.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Drier and rougher than Mumm's Reserve Brut, this is a decent bubbly for the price. It has nice Champagne flavors of baked bread, yeast and citrus, and is very clean and lively.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Bone dry and elegantly clean in acidity, this doughy, austere wine is less fruity than most California bruts, with accents of lime peel and vanilla.
title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Just a little sweet, which will make it perfect for wedding cake or a fruit tart, this bubbly has wonderfully crisp acids and a nice, doughy Champagne character. The vanilla-infused finish is delightful.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Brut Classic Sparkling (California)

description: Amylic, showing rather awkward tropical fruit/bubblegum character, with banana-like softness. Blowsier than the rest of the lineup, this is perfectly drinkable but less elegant (and more expensive) than Argyle's fine vintage brut.
title: Argyle 1998 Knudsen Vineyard Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: Shares the properties of Schramsberg bruts with a good balance of fruit, yeast and acidity, a robust mouthfeel and a long, tart strawberries and cream finish. This is actually a pretty good price for a bubbly of this elegance.
title: Schramsberg NV Mirabelle Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: With a slightly sweet finish that accentuates the fruit but doesn't cloy, this bubbly is crisp and clean, and despite that edge of sugar, it holds its own in dry country. Primarily Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it has good acidity.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Cuvee M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: With a pretty copper color and a delicate, complex aroma of  dough, yeast, fresh strawberries and vanilla, this rosé bubbly is a delight. It's bone dry, with a full body and a long, clean finish.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This 70% Chardonnay wine is dry, light-bodied and elegant. It has a vanilla-tinged flavor of peaches, while the Pinot Noir contributes a strawberry taste.
title: Laetitia 2002 Brut de Blanc Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A little sweet, a little scoury in acids, and strong in yeast and bread, this young, assertive sparkler shows delicate peach and strawberry flavors. It's at its best now, so drink up.
title: Iron Horse 2000 Classic Vintage Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Fuller, richer and considerably drier than Chandon's regular Brut Classic, and also more scoury in the mouth, this bubbly could soften and smoothen with a year or two of age. It's doughy and clean, with a rich core of fruit and crisp, citrusy acidity.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Reserve Brut Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: The Chard gives it lightness and lift, with a hint of peaches and cream. Dry and clean in bubbles and rich in yeast.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Cuvée Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: Frankly sweet, with sugared peach pie flavors, including the toasted crust, this sparkling wine is clean and smooth in texture. It's a good value.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Premium Extra Dry Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: A bit fierce in aggressive bubbles, but this sparkler is fine for everyday purposes, with its sweetened peach and vanilla flavors and brisk, clean acids.
title: Ballatore NV Gran Spumante Sparkling (California)

description: Extra dry, of course, means a little sweet, and so this bubbly is. It has good acidity and modest bread dough, apple and peach flavors, with a clean finish.
title: Korbel NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: It's a darker-colored wine than the regular 2001 Brut Cuvée,  more redolent of cherries and strawberries, and fairly heavy for a bubbly. The slightly sweet finish suggests a high dosage.
title: Hagafen 2001 Brut Cuvee Late Disgorge Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Full-bodied and slightly sweet on the finish, this sparkler has pronounced red cherry and strawberry flavors. It will appeal to those who like a little dosage in their sparkling wine.
title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: Pale in color despite a majority of Pinot Noir, but full-bodied, those cherry and strawberry flavors leap right out of the glass on this bubbly. The wine is dry and a little rough in texture.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: This driest of Korbel's lineup also bears a vintage designation. It's crisp and elegant, with bread dough flavors and a hint of lime zest and smoke. It's a great accompaniment to wedding cake.
title: Korbel 2003 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Vanilla cream and peaches in cream, with lots of pure yeasty dough, mark this bubbly. It has good, crisp acidity and a rough texture that turns a little sweet on the finish.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: If you like your bubbly a little sweet but balanced and elegant, with a high-class touch, this is a good choice. Believe it or not, it's based on the grape Flora, supported by Gewürztraminer. It's fruity, with a honeyed finish and wonderful acidity.
title: Schramsberg 2002 Cremant Demi-Sec Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Tastes like a country-style Chardonnay with bubbles. The flavors of peaches and green apples have a doughy edge, and the wine is elegant and dry.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: This is a sharp, awkward wine, in which the lees stick out. It's fruity and doughy, but lacks elegance.
title: Robert Hunter 1997 Brut de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma Valley)

description: A little rough, and with an evidently high dosage, this peach-fruited wine has a cloying quality and a finish that's too sweet, even by California standards.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2002 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Red in color, sugary sweet, this sparkler will have its fans, but it's really kind of cloying.
title: Ballatore NV Rosso Red Spumante Sparkling (California)

description: Clean and robust in fruity flavor, this dry, doughy sparkling wine will fuel thousands of wedding toasts at a fair price.
title: Tott's NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: A little sweet, rough and sandpapery, but with good fruit and dough, this gets the bubbly job done at a fair price.
title: Tott's NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: This is one of the Ste. Michelle Estates brands, and the only producer of inexpensive sparkling wines in the region. They make four at the $12 price point:  a Blanc de Blancs, a Brut, a Blanc de Noirs and an Extra Dry. All are non-vintage and 100% méthode Champenoise. The Blanc de Noirs is consistently the best of the lineup; some of the others can be excessively foamy and a bit chalky through the finish. But the Blanc de Noirs is a pretty, pale copper; lightly Pinot-scented, and a good quaffer that really works well with turkey.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Much more robust and full-bodied than the L'Ermitage brut, but still elegant and fine. Offers yeast, smoke and vanilla-tinged strawberry flavors, in a slightly rugged texture. Age through the end of the decade.
title: Roederer Estate 1999 L'Ermitage Rose Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: From Pinot Noir grapes. It's rare to find a California bubbly this red in color. Opens with bright and expressive cherry, vanilla and yeast aromas, and turns rich in cherry fruit in the mouth. Unusually full-bodied for a sparkling wine, but very fine.
title: Schug 2001 Rouge de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Despite its relative youth, this Virgina-made sparkler is pungently toasty on the nose, then moves into green apple and lime flavors. It does show its dosage a little, but finishes with decent flourishes of smoke, toast and citrus.
title: Kluge Estate 2002 Brut Chardonnay (Albemarle County)

description: A bit on the heavy side, with faint scents of watermelon and cotton candy, but will have its fans for its attractive light coppery-pink color and amiable, off-dry nature.
title: Mount Pleasant Winery 2003 Brut Imperial Sparkling (Augusta)

description: Here's a nice, easy-drinking blush bubbly. It's dry and crisp, although a little rough and sharp, with subtle strawberry and yeast flavors.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: Basically a blanc de blancs, this 100% Chardonnay is delicate, fine and delicious. It is pale straw in color, with a storm of small, fine bubbles and pretty aromas of lime, smoke, yeast and vanilla. In the mouth, you'll find rich flavors of lime and peach, in a dry wine that's light and clean. It's also firm and crisp enough to warrant a decade in the cellar.
title: Domaine Carneros 1997 Le Rêve Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A very great success that's picking up some charry, smoky, old yeast notes in addition to the rich lime and white peach, but it's as fresh as can be. Vibrant in acids, with a refined, smooth texture, and very dry, it's the epitome of elegance. Still young. Drink now through this decade.
title: Iron Horse 1996 Brut LD Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Among the top sparklers in California, the wine this year is even more smooth and polished. It's positively French in its classic structure and elegance. Feels ultra-refined in the mouth, with subtle flavors of dough, smoke and fruit.
title: Roederer Estate 1998 L'Ermitage  (Anderson Valley)

description: Ultra-refined, super-elegant, the superlatives go on and on. Pours clear and bright, with the most subtle and inviting aromas, all dough and smoke and custardy vanilla with that tease of strawberry. So silky and light on the palate, airy, like silk, and perfectly dosed to a smooth dryness. You will find youthful acidity and scour on the finish, suggesting a wine fully capable of aging. Now through 2010.
title: Schramsberg 1998 J. Schram Sparkling (Napa County)

description: This is really a beautiful bubbly. It's dry, balanced and elegantly structured, with fine acidity and a deft suggestion of bread dough and yeast on top of subtle citrus and smoke notes. Easy to drink, clean as a whistle, a real beauty.
title: Schramsberg 2000 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Strong and full-bodied, with raspberry-cherry, dough and vanilla flavors and a rich, creamy texture. A little sharp in acids, with irregular mousse, and with a lovely, rich finish.
title: Iron Horse 2000 Brut Rose  (Green Valley)

description: Drier than the ‘96 brut, and the better for it. This is an austere, tight wine of finesse. It displays citrus, herb, smoke and yeast flavors, and good acidity. It is very elegant, the kind of wine made for toasts.
title: Domaine Chandon NV étoile Brut Sur Lees 1999  (Napa-Sonoma)

description: This is 100% barrel fermented, an 80% pinot/20% chardonnay blend, and at this age it is already showing lovely sherry notes and lightly oxidized fruit. Yet it retains enough youthful juice to be quite refreshing, with a finish that suggests toast and slightly oily nuts, layer upon layer.
title: Argyle 1997 Knudsen Vineyard Brut  (Willamette Valley)

description: Similar to the Wedding Cuvee but finer, a smooth wine with suggestions of lime, vanilla, lees and dough, that's dry, with just a hint of sweet dosage. There's a rich creaminess and elegance to the structure that showcase the wine's pedigree.
title: Iron Horse 1999 Classic Vintage Brut  (Green Valley)

description: Displays great elegance in the subtle interplay of lime and peach fruit with smoky dough and yeast. Smooth and creamy texture, great acidity, and a dry finish combine to make this a wonderful sparkler.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2001 Blanc de Blancs  (Carneros)

description: Very refined and smooth in the mouth, with an ultra-creamy texture that carries subtle flavors of lemongrass, vanilla and yeast. Very dry, with crisp acids. This is a bubbly that feels rich and elegant all the way down.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 1999 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfectly aged, creamy and round, this lovely blanc de blancs shows ripe fruits that include a touch of mango, along with fennel and other herbal notes, vanilla custard and a smooth, pleasing finish.
designation: Knudsen Vineyard Blanc de Blancs “Julia Lee's Block”
title: Argyle 1997 Knudsen Vineyard Blanc de Blancs “Julia Lee's Block”  (Willamette Valley)

description: Pale in color, with delicate dough, smoke and vanilla notes, but you'll find the Pinot Noir in the suggestion of cherries in the aroma, and a red-berry weight in the mouth. This is a beautiful wine, elegant and crisp, filled with balance and harmony and length.
title: Schramsberg 2000 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Very dry, apparently with a low dosage, which makes those bony acids stick out ever more. Pretty austere now, showing little beyond intense citrus, yeast and char. Such is the balance that it's likely to age well. Hold through 2006, then try again.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1995 Carneros Cuvee Sparkling (Carneros)

description: If you read the review of Schramsberg's J. Schram, you'll get a sense of this wine. It's nearly identical, but less refined, a bit rougher by comparison. Still, it's a very fine wine, youthful and sharp in acids, but balanced and controlled. Very tight, and clearly needs time. 2006 and beyond.
title: Schramsberg 1997 Reserve Sparkling (California)

description: Smooth and refined, this classic blush offers subtle aromas of raspberries and lime, smoky oak and bread dough, with a floral tone. Although it's bone dry and even a bit tannic, it feels lush, right down to the polished finish.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: A thrilling success, with beautifully developed aromas of vanilla and buttered toast. Gorgeous mousse, and perisistent, nutty, complex  flavors that show hints of candied tropical fruits and sweet butterscotch. Maybe the best Argyle ever.
title: Argyle 1994 Extended Tirage Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: A crowd pleasing sparkler for its intricate melange of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir flavors, rich moussy texture, crisp acids and just-right dosage. The cherry and lime flavors are edged with smoky vanilla honey and taste just great. Almost addictively good.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa 1998 DVX  (Napa Valley)

description: At 9 years, still very pale, with good bubbles and crisp acids. However, you begin to pick up on an aged Champagne character. Very dry and complex, clean and satisfying in the mouth, this wine should develop with additional bottle age.
title: Iron Horse 1995  Green Valley

description: Delicate, refined and very dry. This is one of the more elegant bruts around, with a silky mouth feel and very fine texture. Seems to float in the mouth, with gentle lime and vanilla flavors.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Reserve Brut  (Napa-Sonoma)

description: This is as boldly fruity as rosé can be; it is packed with young pinot flavors of cherry candy. Youthful, big and fruity, it is immediately engaging, quite quaffable, but ultimately much less complex and interesting than the rest of the Argyle lineup.
title: Argyle 1999 Brut Rosé  (Willamette Valley)

description: The Blanc de Noirs is the best bottle of the lineup, year in and year out. Creamy and complex, it's a pretty, pale copper, with Pinot-scented hints of cherry fruit.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A brut-style, very dry blend that's mainly Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Offers lots to like with its suggestion of lime and raspberry encased in smoky vanilla and doughy yeast flavors. Crisp acidity makes it clean.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV XXV Anniversary Reserve Brut  (Napa Valley)

description: A tiny bit sweet, with lemon and peach flavors and a bit of a rough scour of acidity. Yet the creamy texture and clean yeasty finish make it a good sip of bubbly.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Cuvee M  (Napa Valley)

description: Full-bodied and brisk, a big sparkler that showcases its strawberry-raspberry flavors. Fundamentally dry, although you'll detect some sweetness on the finish.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Reserve Blanc de Noirs  (Sonoma-Napa)

description: Very fine and silky in texture, a little sweet for a brut, but the acidity helps. Intricate flavors of citrus fruits, raspberries, yeast and smoke leading to a smooth finish.
title: Domaine Chandon 1996 Vintage Brut  (Sonoma-Napa)

description: Starts with wonderfully complex scents of dough, char, butterscotchy smoke, lemon chiffon pie and vanilla. The flavors are equally complex. Would score higher if not for a certain roughness of texture.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: A carbon copy of the winery's brut, except with a little darker, a fuller body and hints of cherries and strawberries. Dry, with a round, creamy texture. Try this polished wine with sushi.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Full-bodied and rich, yet delicately structured, this bubbly shows raspberry, vanilla, smoke and bread dough flavors, and is dry. Turns rich in red berry fruit on the finish.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Argyle vintage dates its brut, a mark of extra care and quality. This is still green apple young; at first sip it could almost be hard cider. Tart, bracing and concentrated, it tastes of fresh cut apples, pears and yeast.
title: Argyle 1999 Brut  (Willamette Valley)

description: A bit sweeter than Iron Horse's drier bruts, and very polished, with subtle raspberry, lime, yeast and smoky-vanilla flavors and good acidity. Easy and delicious to drink, but complex and nuanced in all the right ways.
title: Iron Horse 1999 Russian Cuvee Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A good blush bubbly, fairly full-bodied and showing flavors of cherries, yeast and smoky vanilla. Drinks quite dry and lively in acidity, with a fruity finish.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Almost a rose, and quite full-bodied, this rich wine brims with strawberry and cherry flavors and yeasty, bread dough notes. It's very dry. Really easy to sip, and with layers of nuance and subtlety.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Blanc de Noirs  (Napa Valley)

description: This is the winery's first vintage cuvée, and it's a nice, toasty, creamy wine that has been given extra care from fermentation onward. Some tropical flavors underlie the toast, and it's very full bodied for an all-chardonnay bubbly. The finish tastes of ripe bananas.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle 1998 Luxe Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Beginning to show its age as the fruit drops. Picking up crushed mineral, dried lime, vanilla and hints of dusty herbs, but still vibrant and fresh. Should continue to do interesting things over the years.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1996 Royal Cuvee Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A bit rough in texture, but polished in sweet vanilla, smoke, dough and subtle peach and citrus flavors. Has just enough dosage to make it finish round.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Mountain Dome has won a faithful following in the Northwest by making accessible, broadly flavorful bubbly that comes as close to a fruit bomb as fizz ever does. This is a clean, fresh and quite tasty effort, two thirds pinot noir and one third chardonnay.
title: Mountain Dome NV Brut  (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: A nice, dry sparkling wine, showing subtle citrus, cherry, smoke and yeast flavors. It has a good mouth feel and is balanced and crisp.
title: Korbel NV Brut  (California)

description: Bigger and more obviously fruity than the Blanc de Blancs, it is a simple, clean, pleasant but nondescript bubbly.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Cuvée Brut  (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Soundly-made, attractively packaged, lightweight bubbly. Crisp green apple aromas lead into a clean and refreshing sparkler, with some citrusy tang.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Fans of Aussie sparkling Shiraz will get off on this dark red, fruity wine. It's has intense flavors of raspberries and cherries that straddle the dry-sweet line, but it's basically dry, clean and balanced. Pinot and Zin.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Red Sparkling (California)

description: Big and rather angular in texture, a full-bodied wine with suggestions of cherries, smoke and vanilla. There's a bit of sweetness. It's an easy sipper that can stand up to steaks and similar fare.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs  (California)

description: Tasty bubbly here, a smooth, polished wine with pronounced lime, raspberry and vanilla flavors complexed with yeast and smoke. Dry and vibrant, this is easy to drink.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: There's lots of strawberry and vanilla flavor in this dry wine. It's a bit aggressive in the mouth, with sharp elbows, though. Finishes clean and scouring.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: The aromas and flavors of this bubbly are great. Sweet vanilla, smoky char, and yeast, and the cherries and raspberries are ripe and delicious. The wine is a little rough and scoury, though.
designation: Brut Rosé - Cuvée de la Pompadour
title: Domaine Carneros NV Brut Rosé - Cuvée de la Pompadour Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Heads right down the middle, a popular style of bubbly with a little something for everyone. Dry, with suggestions of lime, dough and sweet oak, and nicely effervescent. Finishes with a clean, racy acidity.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Brut Classic  (California)

description: With lots of Pinot Noir and Gamay, this salmon-colored wine is full-bodied. It shows cherry and raspberry flavors alongside the yeast, smoke and vanilla. Dry, round and creamy, and easy to inhale.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: A rich, full-bodied wine with lush flavors of cherries, raspberries, vanilla, smoke and yeast. It's dry and creamy, with bright acids and a long, satisfying finish. Best Buy
title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: Dry, crisp and tart in acids, this bubbly offers lots of pleasure. The subtle flavors of citrus fruits, strawberries, yeast and toasty vanilla drink a little rough in texture, but this is a good price for the quality.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Brut Prestige  (Napa Valley)

description: Off-dry, this bubbly has a little sugar boosting the peach, bread dough, citrus and vanilla-smoky flavors. Balancing the semi-sweetness is crisp acidity and a clean finish.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Cremant Sparkling (Mendocino)

description: Here's a dry, classic-style brut, balanced and elegant. It has subtle flavors of wheat straw, smoke and bread dough, and clean acids. A little rough, with a rich finish.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: Dry and clean, if a bit rough in acidity and sharp bubbles, with bready, yeasty flavors hinting at limes, vanilla and a tart bite of half green strawberry. Finishes long and rich.
title: Iron Horse 2000 Wedding Cuvee  (Green Valley)

description: Shows some good potential, with ginger and toast aromas that develop into meaty, soy and mushroom flavors on the palate. Creamy mouthfeel, too. Too bad there's a hint of an odd, plastic-like note to the finish.
title: Kluge Estate 2001 Brut Albemarle County Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: With minimum dosage, this is drier than Korbel's other brut styles, and also rougher in texture. It showcases citrus, bread dough and spicy flavors.
title: Korbel 2002 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: If you like your bubbly a little sweet, this is for you. The peach, vanilla, lime, smoke and raspberry flavors are offset with good acidity. Finishes a bit rough.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Riche Sparkling (California)

description: Similar to Korbel's brut, but less full-bodied, this dry, crisp wine is elegant. Finishes with citrus, peach, vanilla and yeast flavors.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay  (Russian River Valley)

description: This is significantly sweeter than the rest of the lineup from Domaine Ste. Michelle, and the sweetness has a sugary character that is a bit too reminiscent of cheaper, bulk-fermented bubblies.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Extra Dry  (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Has some yeasty, apple-y notes on the nose, but this is blander than some other vintages have been, offering modest apple and citrus flavor. Perhaps it just needs more time in the cellar.
title: Wölffer 2000 Cuvée Christian Brut  (The Hamptons, Long Island)

description: Smooth, yet still has crisp acidity and bubbles. The flavors are subtle: not-yet-ripe strawberries, vanilla, a squeeze of lime, smoke, yeasty bread dough.
title: Schramsberg 1999 Blanc de Noirs  (California)

description: Pretty copper color; has powerful aromas of strawberries. This full-bodied bubbly has deep flavors of strawberries, vanilla, white pepper and toast. The fruit is ripe, yet the body is elegant.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Very good now, it will eventually become great. It brims with fresh citrusy acids, and is very dry. There's an undertow of lush peach fruit, vanilla, bread dough and smoke, fading into a long finish.
title: Schramsberg 1997 Reserve Sparkling (California)

description: Starts out a little sulfury, but it blows off to reveal citrus and dough flavors. Drinks very dry and acidic, a lean, austere bubbly with some elegance. Turns astringent on the finish.
title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvee Sparkling (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Rich and smooth bubbly, with plenty of high-end refinement. Feels elegant in the mouth, with complex layers of citrus fruits, a hint of peach, and doughy, yeasty flavors. It's absolutely dry, with some scoury acids that may soften with a few years of age.
title: Laetitia 2000 Brut Coquard Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: One of the darker, more extracted blush bubblies, with an orangey-pink color and pronounced flavors of raspberries and herbs. Round and full-bodied in the mouth, the wine is nicely dry, with a clean, spicy finish.
title: Iron Horse 1998 Brut Rose Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Rich toast and hazelnut aromas lead the way here, with a bright-edged citrus core on the follow-up. The wine is richly textured, serving up tangerine, herb and mineral flavors on the finish.
title: Pacific Echo 1998 Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Not a bad price for a full-bodied sparkler of this quality. It's fully dry and balanced, with a bubbly mouthfeel, rich in young acids, that carries cherries and blackberries. Just a bit rough on the finish, but a lovely sipper.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: Quite bright and lemony, with a rich, weighty body. Backed by pretty vanilla, toast and nut flavors, the wine serves up a fresh, clean finish that ends with an interesting mineral edge.
title: Korbel 1997 Le Premier Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a nice, refreshing bubbly with lots of flavor and some elegance. The subtle strawberry and peach is balanced by notes of dough, yeast and smoke, backed by firm acids. Feels a bit rough at first, but has a clean, rich finish. A blend of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay.
title: Handley 1998 Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Fairly dark in color, it starts off with a bright cherry core that extends to black cherry, citrus and herbs along the palate. It's creamy, fresh, and long on the finish.
title: Iron Horse 1997 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This is a pink-hued blanc de noirs made from Cabernet rather than Pinot Noir. It's bright and fresh, with pretty citrus, raspberry, cherry, toast and herb flavors at the fore. Clean and zippy on the finish, it's full and round. Shows that fine bubbly can be made outside its normal varietal parameters.
title: Sjoeblom Winery 2000 Chauvignon Sparkling Rosé Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A delicious rosé that's delicate and rich, rather than full-bodied and heavy like some rosés can be. This golden-hued wine carries pretty scents of strawberries, vanilla, cream and smoke. In the mouth, it turns fruity in an elegant way, with a round texture and a long, dry finish.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Delightfully refreshing, this sparkling wine is dry, yet filled with complex black cherry and bitter almond flavors. Made in an Aussie style, it also serves up pretty licorice, raspberry and herbal accents for added interest. A dark alternative to standard sparkling fare.
title: Geyser Peak 1997 Sparkling Shiraz (Sonoma County)

description: Rich, smooth and delicious, a toasty wine with delicate flavors of lime, peach and almond skin. It's a bubbly that feels luxurious and complete on the palate, with a creamy mousse and a long, vanilla-tinged finish. One of the more elegant nonvintage bubblies around.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2000 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Stylish and elegant, a full-bodied brut with plenty of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay character in the fruity, peach and lime flavors. Nice integration, with intensity and balance. The finish is dry and clean, with a hint of hazelnut.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Etoile Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: A lovely blend of lemony-fresh aromas that introduce well-balanced toasty, bread-like notes. The wine shows more fine balance on the palate, with a sparkling array of green apple, grapefruit, pear, melon and honeyed flavors. Long on the finish.
title: Domaine Carneros 2000 Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Mumm's top cuvée, and its most French in terms of smoothness and elegance. Smells beautiful, with delicate notes of peach, strawberry, roasted hazelnuts, smoke, vanilla and dough, and eases over the palate with a creamy grace. It's pretty austere now, showing tart limes, but has the concentration and balance for aging.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa 1997 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Way smoother and creamier than Chandon's other nonvintage bubblies, this is a Pinot Noir-based brut with elegance and finesse. The delicate flavors carry hints of limes, strawberries and roasted nuts, accented with leesy dough and smoky oak.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Reserve Sparkling (Sonoma-Napa)

description: Quite fragrant, with hints of peaches, tangerine and wildflowers. It's creamy on the palate, serving up a lovely blend of toast, green apple, citrus, pear and grapefruit flavors. Full and rich on the finish. Really lovely.
title: Pacific Echo 1998 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Almost the quality of great vintage Champagne, in terms of smoothness and texture. This connoisseur's wine is muted in flavor, such that the acids and smooth texture star. But it's an ager.
title: Iron Horse 1996 Brut LD Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: At nearly 10 years of age, this rich sparkler has developed mature flavors and aromas that take the lime and peach into dried fruit and dusty spice. It is fine and complex, with lively acidity. Will keep for years to come.
title: Iron Horse 1994 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Bright and fresh, yet also richly textured, the wine offers an elegant blend of citrus, honey, toast, melon, green apple and hazelnut flavors. It's a classy example of New World bubbly that leaves a long, crisp finish and a desire for more.
title: Domaine Carneros 1996 Le Reve Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Incredibly good, so rich and complex you'd swear you were drinking vintage Champagne. Flavors of yeast, lees and baking bread dominate now, with underlying accents of sweet lime. This young, elegant wine will improve with extended cellaring.
title: Schramsberg 1999 Blanc de Blancs  (Napa Valley)

description: This 5-year-old brut contains a small percentage of even older reserve wine, and it shows in the smooth, mellow texture, which age has softened. It shows also in the flavors, which have turned very dry and green tea-like, with notes of lime and peach. Beautiful now, but with the balance to develop additional bottle complexity.
title: Roederer Estate 1998 L'Ermitage  (Anderson Valley)

description: Toasty, nutty, vanilla and spice aromas lead off here. A firm-textured wine with pear, apple, hazelnut, lemon, spice and herb flavors neatly interwoven, it's got muscle and finesse. On the finish, it's lush, showing elegance and lots of staying power.
title: Pacific Echo 1996 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: A richly textured, plush bubbly that serves up mounds of toast, cherry, peach, pear and floral flavors. With just enough tangy acidity to balance its body, the wine finishes long and fresh.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rosé  (Anderson Valley)

description: Creamy, with citrus, cherry, herb and mineral flavors on the palate. It's fresh, clean and focused, though a bit reserved for a wine with this much lees contact. Classy nonetheless.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Etoile Rosé Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: A terrific tri-county bubbly. Coppery in color, with fierce bubbles. Has rich aromas of strawberry, yeast, smoke, vanilla and cinnamon, and drinks ripe, dry and clean. Lots of finesse and elegance in this beautiful wine.
title: Schramsberg 2000 Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: Held back for eight years, this wine tastes like it was bottled yesterday. It's fresh and doughy, with lime and vanilla flavors; the bubbles are still fierce, as are the acids. It's a clean, lean machine of a sparkler, elegant now, but should age flawlessly for years to come.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1995 Royal Cuvee Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This French-styled sparkling wine is still far too young to enjoy. It is aggressively acidic, even tannic, and austere. There is a subtle core of cherry and raspberry flavor, however, that demand long-term aging. Drink this wine after 2010, or even later.
title: Schramsberg 1997 J. Schram Sparkling (California)

description: Pretty dark for a bubbly, with dough, strawberry, smoke and vanilla aromas and delicate flavors of strawberries and cream. A bit rough in texture, but clean and dry. Might soften with a few years in the cellar.
title: Schug 2000 Brut Rouge de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Opens with clean and inviting aromas of freshly sliced peaches, vanilla and bread dough, and turns rather tough in the mouth. The peach flavors are fine and dry.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay Champagne Chardonnay (California)

description: Shows some hints of light toast on the nose, followed by pineapples and pears on the palate. It's creamy and smooth in the mouth, but has a suggestion of sweetness that distracts slightly from what should be a crisp, clean finish.
title: Martha Clara NV Brut Methode Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Admirably toasty, but seems a bit soft and unfocused on the palate, with modest flavors of mushroom and earth.
designation: Fort Clatsop Cuvee Blanc de Blancs
title: Domaine Meriwether 1998 Fort Clatsop Cuvee Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Oregon)

description: Button mushrooms, clean compost and hints of toast give this wine an interesting flavor profile, but the wine turns a bit too sweet on the finish.
title: Lucas Vineyards NV Lucas Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Another reliable and affordable release from Domaine Ste. Michelle, this year's brut shows hints of Red Delicious apples and berries wrapped around a core of tart acids.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Cuvee Brut Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Boldly flavored, with massive doses of tart green apples pumped up by bubbles and a trace of sweetness. Simple and a bit sugary, it' would be a good base for "Champagne" cocktails.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Extra Dry Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Dark for a rosé, a deep salmon and garnet color. The aroma is reduced or sulfury, not exactly the most inviting scent. Like Sattui's Brut, this rosé also is sharp in acids and low in flavors, although it does show modest strawberries. Lacks the delicacy and finesse of a fine sparkler, especially at this price.
title: V. Sattui 2000 Cuvée Rouge Red (Napa Valley)

description: This is about two-thirds Pinot and one-third Chardonnay. Very tart and beery, it's a big, simple, fruity style with outsized bubbles.
title: Mountain Dome 1997 Brut Sparkling (Washington)

description: Rather lemony and simple, with tart, crisp flavors and a clean finish. Sort of like lemonade with bubbles (sans sugar).
title: McIntyre Vineyards 1998 L'Homme Qui Ris Sparkling (Monterey County)

description: A perfectly acceptable sparkler for parties, with its flavors of peaches and cream, and smoky notes. Finishes very dry, with a scour of acidity.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Brut Cuvee Chardonnay (California)

description: The wine shows hints of honey and citrus up front, followed by toast and nut flavors. But it's a little flat on the midpalate.
title: Pacific Echo NV Cramant Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Boasts a reddish-copper color and a fine bead, but doesn't give up a lot on the nose—just hints of berries and toast. Tastes more earthy and mushrooomy, with a creamy mouthfeel but a short finish.
title: Domaine Meriwether 1998 Olivia's Cuvee Brut Rose Sparkling (Oregon)

description: Fresh, young and aggressive, with notes of apple and ginger backed by crisp acidity. Clean and refreshing, a well-made bubbly at a price that makes it a solid choice for holiday parties.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An average-quality bubbly that's a bit rough around the edges, with sharp bubbles and brisk acidity, but perfectly adequate for ordinary times. The Chenin Blanc-based flavors are neutral at first, then turn peachy.
title: Chouinard NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Tastes kind of lean and earthy, with dried straw and grapefruit flavors rounded off by a bit of honeyed sweetness from lees and dosage. Strives for elegance, but could use more finesse.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa 1998 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Toasty aromas carry a hint of earthiness as well, then the wine turns citrusy and lemon-like through the midpalate. Finishes tangy and surprisingly lean for a blanc de noirs.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Blanc de Noir Sparkling (California)

description: A very nice sparkling wine, and a good value at this price. Makes the right moves with its delicate peach, strawberry, baked bread and vanilla aromas, and rich, fruity flavor. A fierce burst of bubbles makes the wine crisp and bubbly in the mouth.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: This is a very dry wine made in a tarter, more austere style. The flavors suggest limes, hay, and fruit skins from peaches and grapes. It's a bit rough in texture, but overall offers nice, easy drinking.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: The cuvée is 85% Pinot, 15% Chardonnay. A pretty, salmon-colored blend made with grapes harvested in '94 and '92. As you might expect there is some nice richness to it, showing aged, caramel, roasted flavors.
title: Mountain Dome NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Washington)

description: Offers a simple but enjoyable bouquet of rising bread dough, followed by flavors of pear and apple. The texture combines a hint of creaminess with crisp acidity on the fairly dry finish.
title: Lucas Vineyards NV Lucas Extra Dry Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: Full-bodied and dry, with pleasant flavors of strawberry, raspberry, smoke and vanilla and a nice doughiness. Light and elegant on the palate, leaving behind a bubbly scour that carries strawberries long into the finish.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Starts out a bit sulfury, but later reveals citrus and dough flavors. Dry and acidic; turns astringent on the finish.
designation: Brut Cuvée (San Luis Obispo/Santa Barbara Counties)
title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvée (San Luis Obispo/Santa Barbara Counties) Sparkling (Central Coast)

description: Pale pink, with pretty apple and cherry flavors at the fore. The wine is fresh, clean and light textured, offering a lively, toasty finish.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: A sweetie with a round, smooth taste of lemon custard and vanilla offset by pretty acids, and wrapped in a rich Champagne-like body. Feels clean and lively despite the sugar, and finishes with a creamy flourish.
title: Schramsberg 2000 Cremant Demi-Sec Sparkling (California)

description: A bright-edged, steely, mineral-like wine that serves up lots of lemon and grapefruit. The finish is fresh and zippy with a hint of cherries at the end.
title: Laetitia 2000 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Kicks off with a blend of pretty peach and citrus flavors. Firm and focused, with zippy lemon, grapefruit and spice flavors, the wine finishes with a bright, toasty edge.
designation: Blanc de Noirs - Cuvée Pinot Noir
title: Korbel 1998 Blanc de Noirs - Cuvée Pinot Noir Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A little sweet, a little tart, somewhat rough hewn, this is the most rustic of Iron Horse's line of bubblies. It has flavors of citrus fruits and peaches and the bright, aggressive acidity this cool climate appellation brings.
title: Iron Horse 1998 Russian Cuvee Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Whatever “extra-dry riche” means, this is a slightly sweet brut-style wine, with flavors of peach, raspberry and citrus. The bubbles are on the big size, but on the whole it's a pleasant wine.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Extra-Dry Riche Sparkling (California)

description: Pale and delicate, with flavors of lime, straw and bread dough, and a lively, persistent sparkle. Drinks quite dry, with lots of polish and elegance. Turns nutty and toasty on the finish.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: A darn good sparkling wine, well-aged and heavily scented with ripe apples, honey and clover. It's made from 100% Pinot Noir, and it's got a whole lot of rich, yeasty flavor for the price.
title: David Hill 1992 Brut Sparkling (Oregon)

description: A pretty wine, almost flamboyant with ripe flavors of raspberries, strawberries, citrus, brioche and smoke, but so controlled by its acidity that it's balanced. It's a bit on the sweet side for a brut, and finishes with a lemony tartness.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Made a little on the sweet side, with forward flavors of raspberries and limes, but it's still a dry wine. Feels lush and round in the mouth, leaving a lively prickle of acidity on the finish.
title: Iron Horse 1999 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A young, fragrant bubbly that opens with pretty aromas of peaches, limes, smoke, vanilla and baked bread. It is delicately dry in the mouth, with rich flavors and a silky texture.
title: Iron Horse 1998 Classic Vintage Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: The wine shows off rich, toasty aromas up front, followed by lemon and grapefruit notes on the palate. Green apple and herbs line the finish.
title: Laetitia 2000 Brut Cocquard Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: What a pretty color, a pale straw with glints of rosy peach skin, and a suggestion of fresh strawberries and cream on the nose. Drinks smooth and rich, a lively, full-bodied sparkler with firm acidity.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Kicks off with toast, mushroom and earth aromas suggestive of a well-aged blend, then delivers a smooth creamy mouthful packed with rich fruit and earth flavors. Assertive enough to pair successfully with many first courses.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Chandon's basic brut is balanced and harmonious, with flavors of citrus, pear, raspberry and vanilla, and an engaging edge of dough and smoky oak. Basically dry, but with a sweetly ripe dosage that makes it round and creamy. Best of all, it avoids sharpness, and is smooth.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Brut Classic Sparkling (California)

description: Crisp and clean, with a fresh lemony edge that perks up the palate. It's followed by hints of toast, mineral and light strawberry flavors. Bright, yet slightly creamy on the finish.
designation: Brut Rosé - Cuvée de la Pompadour
title: Domaine Carneros NV Brut Rosé - Cuvée de la Pompadour Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Sometimes you need a good bubbly but can't spend a lot: weddings, bar mitzvahs, block parties, that sort of thing. This 100% Chardonnay is terrific, with apple, peach and brioche flavors, fine mousse and an elegant finish.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Brut Cuvée Chardonnay (California)

description: Re-release. What a pretty bouquet on this 7-year-old wine! It is delicate but assertive, with flavors of dried hay, bread dough, vanilla, rich cream, smoke and peach. The mouthfeel is dry and a bit scoury in acidity, with a biscuity vanilla flavor. Still seems young. Best left in a cool cellar for another seven years.
title: Schramsberg 1996 Reserve  (Napa County)

description: A tremendously flavorful wine that showcases beautiful Chardonnay and Pinot Noir flavors. Like sipping the essence of limes and strawberries, with the crisp, scouring bubbles of Champagne. Very dry and clean, with a long, rich finish.
title: Korbel 2000 Natural  (Russian River Valley)

description: Crisp, clean and fruity, with apple and ctirus aromas compounded by bread dough, vanilla and smoke. Drinks bone dry and a bit austere, with sharp edges from acids. But it's saved by the finish, which is richly fruity.
title: Korbel NV Brut  (California)

description: This Beaver State answer to Moscato d'Asti is sweet, sweet and more sweet. Who knows what the actual residual sugar reading is? That said, the lemon-lime aromas with notes of basil and tarragon are nice, and the wine is currently quite fresh (although it likely won't last long). Not too bubbly or aggressive, and pretty in the mouth due to fairly snappy acids. Drink now with fruit-based desserts or frosted cake.
title: Silvan Ridge 2002 Early Muscat - Semi Sparkling Muscat (Oregon)

description: Fresh and clean, with scents and flavors of ripe apples and a beery, leesy note. This blend of 58% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay boasts an aggressive bead that gives it a brash, in-your-face quality ideal for casual summer sipping, less so for elegant, formal occasions.
title: Domaine Meriwether NV Discovery Cuvee Sparkling (Oregon)

description: The nose bears an uncanny similarity to applesauce, yet it's certainly not unpleasant. The palate features an expressive blend of apples and citrus, while the finish is smooth and of moderate length. If there's anything to fault here it's that the wine feels sharp on the tongue, and at the center it seems a touch candied. –M.S.
title: Wölffer 1998 Cuvee Christian Brut Sparkling (The Hamptons, Long Island)

description: This rich and yeasty sparkler is very much like the wines of Champagne that it's modeled after. The nose is yeasty and full of pear aromas, while the palate is defined by orange and apple flavors. The finish is smooth and comes in a couple of layers, and overall the it is mouthfilling and pure.
title: Domaine Carneros 1999 Brut  (Carneros)

description: Quite delicate up-front, with hints of toast and citrus. The core is pretty and focused, showing lots of elegant cherry, melon and spice. Full bodied, yet balanced by tangy acidity and a fine lemony finish.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Étoile Rosé  (Napa Valley)

description: Elegant, with an intriguing spice edge, this wine shows hints of mineral, strawberry and herbs framed in bright, lemony acidity. Toasty, creamy notes extend along the palate, ending in a long, clean finish. —J.M.
title: Domaine Carneros NV Frivolites  (Carneros)

description: Fresh and toasty, with a creamy texture and pretty melon, citrus, apple, pear, mineral and nut flavors. Moderate at the end.
title: Pacific Echo NV Brut  (Mendocino County)

description: Bright and fresh, with peach and citrus notes. The wine is light on the palate, but offers a long, toasty finish at the end.
title: S. Anderson 1997 Brut  (Napa Valley)

description: You'd almost think you were drinking fine Champagne when you sip this intricate bubbly, which, after all, is owned by a French Champagne house. It's dry and yeasty, with suble citrus flavors and an aftertaste of almond skin. Feels fine and elegant on the palate.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut  (Anderson Valley)

description: This vintage wine is much smoother and more complex than the winery's nonvintage releases. It's yeastier and doughy, with citrusy flavors and a round, creamy mouthfeel. The finish leaves the mouth fresh and clean.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1994 Vintage Reserve - Brut - Royal Cuvee  (Carneros)

description: NULL
title: Gloria Ferrer NV  Carneros

description: Has the same fruity flavors as Ste. Michelle's brut, but slightly jagged, angular acids show through, and the finish is a little tart. Needs food, but is a very good wine.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Extra Dry  (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Quite rich for Mumm's annual lineup, with citrus and melon flavors, maybe because a third of the blend is Pinot Gris. It's fully dry, with a crisp mouthfeel and a yeasty finish. Light and elegant through the finish.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa 1997 Blanc de Blancs  (Napa Valley)

description: This 100% Chardonnay has strong scents of lime, smoke, freshly baked bread and vanilla. It's lemon-and-limey and rich, but delicate. Feels light and fresh on the palate, with a clean finish.
title: Iron Horse 1994 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A tasty package of ranier cherry, red plum, caramel, toast, tobacco, basil and a hint of tomato. Acids and a touch of tannins are well integrated. Light and elegant throughout.
title: Schug 1998 Rouge de Noirs Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Creamy and rich, with hints of cherry and strawberry. The wine is backed by citrus, herb and mineral notes.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rose  (Carneros)

description: With 10 years on the yeast in the bottle, it is no surprise to find sweet cream, unsalted butter, cardamom, white bread and lemon-candy aromas and flavors. The soft acidity and medium-length, talc-y finish leave no questions as to why this was “disgorged on demand.” Drink now, only 405 cases were made of this 80% Pinot, 20% Chard blend.
title: Argyle 1991 Extended Tirage - Disgorged on Demand  (Willamette Valley)

description: An excellent young blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Pleasant, subtle flavors of raspberries are accompanied by brisk acids and nice, scouring bubbles that cleanse the palate. The finish contains notes of bread dough and smoke. Will improve with a year or two of cellaring.
title: Handley 1997 Brut  (Anderson Valley)

description: A pale orange or copper-colored wine, with powerful apricot, orange juice and honeyed espresso aromas. Attacks the palate with intense sugar, a very sweet wine good on its own with a simple butter cookie. The flavors are apricot-fruity, with soft acids and tannins.
title: Renwood 2000 Amador Ice Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Very nice. Full-bodied, with flavors of strawberries and yeast; also high in acids. It's a bouncy, jagged wine, cleansing and stimulating the palate, with a dry, tingly finish.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rosé  (Anderson Valley)

description: Basically a Chardonnay-only brut. It has nice peach and apple flavors and a bit of sugar to soften it, but it's basically dry, and of course a little lighter and more elegant than the regular brut.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay (California)

description: Fresh, light and focused, with citrus, apple, mineral and toast flavors. Clean, bright and refreshing on the finish.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 1998  Russian River Valley

description: Creamy smooth, yet sparkling with pretty hints of fig, apricot, melon and spice. Very slightly sweet, it makes a marvelous apéritif.
title: Schramsberg 1999 Crément - Demi Sec White (California)

description: This tête de cuvée is a vintage blend that's almost entirely Chardonnay. Very light and airy, with dry citrus and straw flavors and a hit of yeast. Very good, but at this price it could use more finesse.
title: Domaine Carneros 1996 La Reve  (Carneros)

description: Flinty rich, with hints of strawberry, citrus, melon and toast. Fresh, clean and light on the palate. Clean at the end.
title: Schramsberg 1999 Brut Rosé  (California)

description: A smooth-drinking, aromatic bubbly that may be a little too dry for     some. The initial aromas of raspberries and limes are accented with oak and yeast, and are delicate and inviting. In the mouth, it has an almost Sherry-like tang, but rich texture and clean strength are its nicest features.
title: Thornton NV Brut Reserve Natural  (California)

description: Peach, melon and citrus flavors are at the core. The finish is soft and mellow, turning toasty and nutty at the end.
title: S. Anderson 1997 Blanc de Noirs  (Napa Valley)

description: Pretty toast and dough aromas up front. The wine fans out to reveal a broad range of flavors, including pear, apple, citrus, mineral, honey, nut and floral qualities. Long at the end.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc De Noirs Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This half-and-half blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay is often referred to as California's best. This year, it's very dry, with nuanced flavors of citrus, peach and yeast. But it feels a little rough on the palate. This youthful scour should soften in a few years.
title: Roederer Estate 1997 L'Ermitage  (Anderson Valley)

description: Crisp, firm and packed with intensity. The wine serves up lots of hazelnut, toast, spice, citrus, apple, melon, pear, honeysuckle and herb flavors. Creamy and rich on the finish, with a bright, refreshing edge.
title: Wölffer 1997 Brut  (The Hamptons, Long Island)

description: This is actually a blanc de blancs, and as you'd expect, it's very light and elegant. There's just a trace of citrus in the nose, and a hint of peaches on the tongue. Dry and crisp. Could use a touch more finesse in the bubbles, but it's a beautiful wine.
title: Clos La Chance NV Amber's Cuvee Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is Iron Horse's signature bubbly. Opens with delicate aromas of lime, vanilla and smoke, and when you taste it, strawberries kick in. The mouthfeel is especially nice, light as air and soft as silk, despite the crisp acids.
title: Iron Horse 1997 Classic Vintage Brut  (Sonoma County)

description: Fairly dark for a rosé, this Pinot Noir-based bubbly is overtly fruity. Raspberry and strawberry aromas and flavors are complemented by yeast and bread dough. Full-bodied and rich, with a spicy, fruity finish.
title: Iron Horse 1997 Brut Rose  (Sonoma County)

description: The richest and finest of this winery's series of value bubblies. This Chardonnay-Pinot Noir blend is delicately scented with raspberry, peach, smoke and yeast, and it's smooth on the palate. So elegant and complex, it's hard to believe it costs so little.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Cuvee Brut  (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This vintage brut is clearly finer than the regular nonvintage brut. Shares the same character of dry elegance and finesse, with subtle flavor. It's very pinpointed and rich, and feels good and satisfying in the mouth.
title: Korbel 1996 Le Premier Reserve  (Russian River Valley)

description: This blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc begins with richly attractive scents of dough, straw, vanilla, smoke and pound cake, and drinks very dry and delicate. Subtle citrus and strawberry flavors lead to a clean, lively finish.
title: Thornton 1996 Brut Reserve  (California)

description: Fresh, rich and toasty smooth, with complex vanilla, pear, apple, citrus and floral notes. Creamy on the finish. A fine example of what bottle age can do for bubbly.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1992 Late Disgorged - Carneros Cuvee - Brut  (Carneros)

description: Rich and ripe, yet light and elegant, too. A wonderful blend of toasty citrus, melon, floral, honey and herb flavors, all couched in a classy bubbly base.
title: Schramsberg 1995 Reserve Cuvee Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Smells rich and complex, offering up a myriad of strawberry, white chocolate, toasted almond, vanilla and bread dough aromas and flavors. Absolutely delicious bubbly, creamy and clean. The rich, spicy finish has a taste of yeast.
title: Schramsberg 1998 Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (California)

description: Incredibly rich and smooth, with subtle flavors of peaches, vanilla, yeast and smoke. Very dry, but so rich and creamy—just luscious. Feels light and airy and elegant all the way through the long finish.
title: Schramsberg 1996 J. Schram  (Napa County)

description: This is a rough, slight bubbly that needs a bit of work in future vintages. It's bone-dry and very acidic, with barely any flavor at all. It tastes like seltzer or carbonated water.
title: Falconer 1997 Late Disgorged Blanc de Noir  (Sonoma)

description: Well, it's dry, bubbly and clean. This blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay is also inexpensive, but you'd never mistake it for Champagne.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Bubbly Brut Cuvee  (California)

description: Bizarre, with candied yam, pepper and citrus smells, and a dry, rough feeling that leaves the palate exhausted.
title: Barefoot Cellars NV Bubbly Prenium  (California)

description: Simple and short, with light cherry, citrus and herb notes.
