description: Made to benefit the exploratory organization, this high-toned stunner exudes flavors of Gravenstein apple followed by a slight richness of marzipan. Moderate acidity and weight makes it a fine companion for the table, finishing with a sense of welcome fullness.
designation: National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs
title: Iron Horse 2013 National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Crisp peach and red-fruit flavors combine with vibrant acidity and energizing, fine bubbles to create a balanced and rich sparkling wine. A spicy, crisp fruit character lingers long on the finish.
title: Roederer Estate NV Estate Bottled Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: After three years en tirage, this well-evolved wine is heady and floral, made to highlight and celebrate diversity. Creamy and lush on the palate, it has a rounded richness of stone fruit. Made predominantly from Pinot Noir, it has an accentuated taste of strawberry shortcake.
title: Iron Horse 2013 Rainbow Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This is an assertive, flavorful and robust wine, with a medium to full body, a mouthfilling texture and fine-beaded bubbles. A creamy viscosity and wonderful layers of butter, apple, vanilla and ginger make for a delicious palate.
title: Roederer Estate NV Estate Bottled Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Made entirely from Chardonnay, this is a bright sparkling wine, bubbling in acidity and dry, leavened layers of apple and pear. A creaminess of vanilla balances the crispness, making for a successful small-production sparkler.
title: Benovia 2012 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Exuberant in mousse, this wine is luxurious and rich, the perfect quaff for any occasion. Made from 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay, and aged for three years, it's bright in bolts of green apple and strawberry.
title: Iron Horse 2013 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Made from a majority of Pinot Noir, this reserve-tier wine lives up to its label, showing a dry swath of wild strawberry and orange preserve among a creamy center of integrated acidity and depth. It's a delight with complexity and crispness working well together.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Extra dry in style, this sparkling blend of 68% Pinot Noir and 32% Chardonnay succeeds dramatically in its ability to be salty as a cracker and crisp as a bite of green apple, followed by a lemon chaser. Tart and lengthy, it has persistent acidity and purity that's hard to resist.
title: Iron Horse 2013 Brut X Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Beautiful in peach color, this blends 73% Chardonnay and 27% Pinot Noir. Dry and crisp, it tangles together vibrant flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and cherry, as aromas of rose petal whisper by. A stony mineral component adds complexity and invitation to the texture.
title: Schramsberg 2013 Querencia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Combining 76% Pinot Noir and 24% Chardonnay, this wine has a depth of richness and focused, supportive acidity that work well to complement each other. Stone fruit, vanilla biscuit, cherry kirsch and green apple are all within the spectrum of flavors here, finishing with grace and a hint of spice.
title: Iron Horse 2012 Classic Vintage Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This spicy and well-balanced wine has a light salmon color, subtle aromas like cinnamon and cherries, and flavor accents resembling cranberries, paprika and ginger. It's light to medium bodied, has very fine bubbles and a lingering finish.
title: Breathless NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Floral in lemon blossom, this tastes of lemon peel, grapefruit and spicy gingerbread, its acidity persistent and uplifting. A bite of texture gives it heft without too much ripeness, finishing lean and crisp.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Intricate baking spice aromas and buttery apple-tart flavors meet a delicate yet expansive mouthfeel in this light-bodied, irresistible and off-dry wine. The spicy elements weave in and out of the silky texture and continue to echo on the finish.
title: Breathless NV Blanc de Blancs Méthode Champenoise Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Nutty and dry, this Chardonnay-only sparkler tastes of almond paste, dried apple, dried citrus peel and toasty oak. It's vibrantly balanced and fulfilling.
title: Mumm Napa 2012 Blanc de Blancs Reserve Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: Luxuriously crafted to be lush and robust, this blends 76% Pinot Noir and 24% Chardonnay with ease and gusto. The palate is dominated by layered flavors of baked strawberry and cherry.
title: Iron Horse 2012 Russian Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Very crisp, refreshing and nicely dry, this light copper-colored wine surrounds a core of fresh raspberry flavors with light spicy nuances and a texture that turns vibrant bubbles into a creamy sensation on the finish.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rosé Excellence Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: Dry, appetizing and complex, this wine has intricate aromas of butter, almond and toast followed by mellow fruit flavors, lingering spices and a suave texture that seems to encourage the long finish. It's light- to medium-bodied and excellent in overall quality.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: This is a light-bodied, very fruity and soft-textured wine that smells like cherries, berries and melons and tastes fresh and a touch sweet. The acidity is low and the bubbles are lively, so it's easy to sip.
title: Rock Wall 2016 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Yolo County)

description: A fizzy blend of six white grapes, this quaffable, tart bubbly tastes principally of grapefruit and a touch of spice. It's a solid choice alongside almost any salty appetizer.
title: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution Brut Sparkling (America)

description: A lovely bubbly. It's crisp and creamy, with luscious flavors of vanilla, lime and orange sorbet that are a little honeyed. Easy to like.
title: Korbel NV Sec Sparkling (California)

description: Lots of cheerful substance in this blush bubbly. Dry and crisp, it has lip-smacking flavors of raspberries, strawberries and limes, with a toasty, yeasty richness.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rosé Chardonnay (California)

description: This subtle, restrained and elegant wine from a classic producer leads with nice doughy, toasty aromas. It fills the mouth with delicate bubbles and lingers on the finish, giving more toasty complexity and lasting fruit impressions.
title: Schramsberg 2014 Brut Rosé (North Coast)

description: This well-balanced and smooth wine is the debut California offering from French producer Pommery. Made from 96% Chardonnay and a dab of Pinot Noir, it carries aromas of toasted baguette and flowers, with crisp apple and white peach flavors on fine-beaded bubbles. The concentrated fruit amplifies on the palate and lingers on the finish.
title: Louis Pommery NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: A nice, everyday bubbly that offers elegance at an affordable price. Chardonnay contributes crisp flavors of limes, while Pinot Noir brings deeper flavors of cherries. A lovely wine that grows in the glass.
title: Chandon NV Brut Classic Sparkling (California)

description: A good, dry and elegant bubbly. Shows crisp flavors of yeasty bread dough, limes, tangerines, raspberries and vanilla. This is a great price for a sparkling wine of this finesse.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: This wine has a delicious, robust character, starting with aromas of toasted nut, strawberry, cherry and apple and followed by full-bodied flavors of strawberry, nuts and vanilla. The wine is balanced but will pair better with slightly bigger dishes.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2004 Topaz Impérial Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Almost exclusively Pinot Noir, this is a deeply colored, full-bodied wine, rich and crisp in strawberries, lees and vanilla. A touch of Chardonnay adds a refreshing note of lime. Delicious and easy to like, especially at this price.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Elegant, dancing aromas of apricot, pear and citrus are followed by toasted nuts and citrus in this refreshing and dry-style bubbly. Offer good complexity and some cream on the palate—making it an enticing food wine.
title: Sherwood House Vineyards 2004 Blanc de Blanc Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This delightful, food-friendly sip from the culinary-minded owners of Shinn Estate starts with alluring aromas of toasty nut, lemon and apples, leading into elegant, balanced flavors of cream, apple and citrus. Dry yet fruity, it's a great accompaniment to varied foods—from delicate salads to spicy cuisine.
title: Shinn Estate 2006 Ultra Brut  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Soft and elegant aromas of strawberries, cherries and vanilla lead into fresh, friendly and lively flavors of citrus and strawberry in this sparkling rosé. Balanced with a big finish, pair this wine with fruit or dessert.
title: Heart & Hands 2007 Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: This sparkler offers aromas of toast, vanilla and fresh fruit, followed by a medium-bodied array of citrus, honey and toasted nut. Crisp but fruity, with a lingering finish, the wine is both food-friendly and assertive.
title: Palmer NV Special Reserve Brut  (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Refreshing and mouthwatering, this wine offers aromas of lemon, citrus and vanilla and an overall clean, elegant palate. Perfect for fresh salads, seafood, poultry.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Pinot Blanc Brut
title: Lieb 2005 Blanc de Blancs Pinot Blanc Brut Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This is one of the sweetest of the winery's crop of bubblies, made as usual with a notable touch of honey, although it's still fundamentally dry. Shows luscious flavors of raspberry, lime, tart apple and brioche, leading to a long, richly spicy finish.
title: Iron Horse 2004 Russian Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Mainly Pinot Noir, but the touch of Muscat lends a tart touch of orange to this dry, crisp bubbly. Otherwise, it's your standard brut. Finishes dryish and elegant.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Va de Vi Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a delicious brut. Dry and fruity, it has forward flavors of Key limes, pineapple zest, brioche, vanilla and spices. The bubbles are a bit scoury. Easy to find, with 22,800 cases produced.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuveé 20 Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Full-bodied and dry. You can taste the Pinot Noir in the black and red cherry and red currant flavors. A bit rough in texture, but pretty good for the price. Will pair well with roast salmon or even a lamb chop.
title: Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: A creamy, toasty nose of almond and vanilla leads on this elegant sparkler, followed by balanced pear, apple and hazelnut flavors. A more opulent style wine that still has a fine finish—and a touch of spice.
title: Sparkling Pointe 2000 Brut Séduction Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: The beautifully designed bottle alone is a treat, but the wine—a blend of three rosés—backs it up: it begins with elegant aromas of aromatic flowers, cherries and citrus, followed by crisp citrus and juicy strawberry and cherry. A fun and flirty sip with class.
title: Croteaux 2008 Cuvée Sparkle Rosé Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This is a rich, full-bodied and somewhat heavy rosé in its youth, brimming with warm California sunshine flavors of raspberries, strawberries, cherries and cola that have a slightly sweet finish. It's nice and silky. All primary fruit now, it should develop bottle complexities through 2014.
title: Chandon NV L'Etoile Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: A feminine, elegant nose of apples, toast and honey leads into delicate, dancing citrus, apple and spice flavors. Poised, with a light touch, and very food friendly, this wine will please fans of more restrained sparklers.
title: Bedell 2005 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This bubbly starts with pretty aromas of flowers, spice and pear, followed by a bright profile of spice, fruit and cream. Balanced but offers a zingy finish with length. A fun and interesting wine with a lot of personality.
title: Brotherhood NV Grand Monarque Sparkling (Hudson River Region)

description: A beautiful sparkling wine, marked by an extremely fine texture that feels silky and smooth. The bubbles are very fine, so the wine lacks the roughness you usually find in bubblies of this price. It's a fruity drink, showing pineapples, tangerines and vanilla.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: A bit rough and scoury, but so delicious in flavor, you forgive it. Attracts for its raspberries, rose petals, brioche and vanilla, and the way the racy acidity cleanses the mouth.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Not really dry but off-dry, this bubbly is rich, with honeyed flavors of raspberries, cherries, pineapples, apples and brioche. A pleasant sipper.
title: Chandon NV Extra-Dry Riche Sparkling (California)

description: This is a sweeter style of sparkling wine by Mumm, the style called Sec in French. You'll find a trace of honey and sugar on the finish to the raspberries, strawberries and vanilla.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This is Korbel's first-ever brut made with organic grapes. It's a solid sparkler, but not particularly better than any of their others. It shows rich flavors of citrus, vanilla and yeast, and is very tart in acidity.
title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Orange citrus and lemon lead in this rich, full-bodied sip. Easygoing but full of character, the wine will hold its own against richer dishes—think lobster, cream dishes, crab.
title: The Old Field 2004 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Dark in color and full-bodied, this is a big, heavy sparkling wine based on Pinot Noir. It has flavors of cherries, raspberries, red currants, cola and anise, in a silky, crisp texture with yeasty notes.
title: Chandon NV Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: A citric, toasty nose leads into fresh and fruity flavors of lemon, toast and spice in this fun and friendly sparkler. Pair with fruit, desserts or sip on its own—it's great for a balmy day and a dependable everyday sip.
title: Lakewood 2005 20th Anniversary Brut Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: Dry and rough even at the age of eleven years, this sparkling wine is marked by flavors of yeast and citrus fruits. It's not going anywhere, so drink up.
title: Thomas Fogarty 1998 Late Disgorged Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a good, rich bubbly, full-bodied and dry, with subtle flavors of red cherries, limes, vanilla and yeasty bread dough. It's a little scoury, but a good value for the money.
title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: This friendly bubbly offers a spicy, robust nose of apples and toast and a full-bodied, earthy palate. The character is fresh and the finish lingering and spicy.
designation: Fiori Delle Stelle Blanc de Blanc
title: Casa Larga NV Fiori Delle Stelle Blanc de Blanc Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: Good price for a sparkling wine of this quality. It's smooth and creamy, with layers of Mandarin orange, peach, vanilla and smoky yeast that finish with a honeyed richness.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay  (California)

description: The aromas in this light, delicate wine—green apple, pear and toasted nut—give it an appetizing start. Fresh, citrusy flavors follow. It's a clean-style bubbly—not too robust and zingy on the finish. Pair with lighter dishes or sip alone.
title: Onabay 2006 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Floral and citrus aromas and flavors typify this Brut from Michigan. On the palate, it's lively and fresh--not terribly complicated but a fun summer sip.
title: Good Harbor NV Moonstruck Brut  (Michigan)

description: This fresh, fruity sparkler from Missouri starts with a nose of apple, toast and pear, followed by citrus and apple flavors. Not overly complicated but a fun everyday sip.
title: Mount Pleasant Winery NV Brut Imperial Sparkling (Missouri)

description: Crisp, citric aromas start this refreshing wine from Brotherhood. On the palate, citrus, apple and toast give the wine a more robust character. Friendly and easy to enjoy alone or with everything from salads to heartier cream dishes.
title: Brotherhood NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (New York)

description: Frankly sweet, with honeyed flavors of raspberries, vanilla and crunchy granola. Finishes clean and zesty in acidity. If this is your style, it's a great buy.
title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Not really dry, but with an edge of honeyed sweetness to the raspberries, limes, vanilla and doughy flavors. Drink this clean, brisk wine with fresh fruit or butter cookies.
title: Korbel NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: Pale and refined, with elegant flavors of raspberries, strawberries, vanilla and yeasty lees. With a slightly sweet finish, balanced with crisp coastal acidity, it's a beautiful sparkling wine.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: The nose on this upstate New York sparkler is promising, with toasty aromas reminiscent of Champagne. However, the palate doesn't follow through. The wine is thin and watery, with little depth or persistence. Nonetheless, it could be enjoyable as a simple warm-weather quaffer.
title: Glenora 2002 Brut  (Finger Lakes)

description: A good sparkling wine, a bit scoury around the edges, but nice and dry, with a fancy finish. Shows crisp flavors of yeasty lees, limes, lemons, vanilla and smoke.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Va de Vi Ultra Cuvée Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Good price for a dry, crisp sparkling wine. Clean and classic, it shows refined flavors of citrus, lees, bread dough and vanilla that are delicious and complex. Easy to find, with 25,000 cases produced.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: Absolutely dry and brilliantly crisp, this clean, vibrant bubbly is rich and subtle in raspberry, lime, brioche and smoky vanilla flavors, with a spicy, lingering finish. Defines the Iron Horse style of elegance and class. Made from 68% Pinot Noir and 32% Chardonnay.
title: Iron Horse 2004 Ultra Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Delicious. This is a full-bodied blush bubbly with instant appeal, from the coppery color to the long, spicy finish. Shows lush flavors of creamy raspberries and red cherries, brioche, vanilla and cinnamon spice, with a nutty sweetness. Elegant and complex. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée de la Pompadour Brut Rosé
title: Domaine Carneros NV Cuvée de la Pompadour Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: With a ruby-crimson color, this sparkling wine is as full-bodied as a Pinot Noir, but with bubbles. It has flavors of strawberries, vanilla and yeast, and is dry and clean. Nice with ahi tuna tartare.
title: Frank Family NV Rouge Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a very rich, full-bodied blush bubbly that really satisfies for sheer deliciousness. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, its creamy texture holds flavors of limes, raspberries, vanilla and yeasty lees. The price is not inexpensive, but it's a good value in a sparkling wine of this quality. From Schramsberg.
title: Mirabelle NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Frank Family, far better known for Cabernet Sauvignon, joins the sparkling wine sweepstakes with this drily crisp, Champagne-like brut. It has subtle flavors of raspberries, strawberries, limes and brioche pastry, with a complex finish. Quite good.
title: Frank Family 1997 Brut Champagne Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This brand is a sort of junior label for Schramsberg, one of California's premier sparkling wine houses. It's quite a good bubbly, showing plenty of balance and finesse, with rich, dry flavors of yeast, citrus fruits and vanilla.
title: Mirabelle NV Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Not really dry, but off-dry to semi-sweet, with pleasant flavors of citrus fruits, peaches, brioche, vanilla and spice. Nice with fresh fruit and sweet country ham.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: Sweet, with flavors of tropical citrus fruits, flowers, candied ginger, bread dough and spices. Feels a bit rustic. Made from a blend of Flora and Gewürztraminer.
title: Schramsberg 2005 Crémant Demi-sec Sparkling (North Coast)

description: A bit rough and scoury around the edges, but dry and crisp and elegantly constructed, with rich flavors of citrus fruits, yeasty baked dough and vanilla. Drink now.
title: Domaine Carneros 2005 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Sweet in raspberries, cherries and vanilla, this bubbly is balanced with very crisp acidity. It has a clean, vibrant finish. Makes you think of wedding cakes and pastries.
title: Ballatore NV Rosso Red Spumate Sparkling (California)

description: Sharp in bubbly acidity and slightly sweet, this sparkling wine has pleasant flavors of raspberries, strawberries and vanilla. It's a clean, refreshing sparkler.
title: Ballatore NV Gran Spumate Sparkling (California)

description: Shows Pinot Grigio's floral, citrus, apricot and spice flavors in a dry sparkling wine. Unusual, but tasty, and versatile with all kinds of food.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Pinot Grigio Sparkling (California)

description: A bit on the sweet side, with sugared lemonade, pineapple juice and vanilla flavors. Easy to drink this polished sparkler.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Chardonnay  (California)

description: A bit scoury in the mouth, but dry, clean and crisp, with delicate flavors of vanilla, lemons, limes and yeasty dough.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Cuvee  (California)

description: Simple and sweet, with raspberry jam, cherry parfait, vanilla cream and doughy flavors, balanced with zesty acidity. If you like your bubbly on the sugary side, it's for you.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV White Zinfandel (California)

description: Marked by the crispness of the acidity, which makes for a tingly feeling on the tongue, this dry bubbly has citrus and yeast flavors.
title: Korbel 2005 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A good, rich, dry bubbly, with a creamy, leesy taste and long finish. The flavors of figgy vanilla and praline are unusual for a bubbly, but nonetheless are delicious.
title: Mosby NV Stelline di Moscato Orange Muscat (Santa Barbara County)

description: The charming nose of freshly picked berries promises good things to come. Off-dry, but not cloying, the palate is approachable and flirty, with fresh fruit flavors and a crisp finish. Not terribly complex, but overall a good go-to sparkling wine.
title: Château Frank 2000 Blanc de Noirs  (Finger Lakes)

description: The virtues of this 100% Chardonnay are its elegance, cleanliness, brightness and the sheer pleasure it offers. It's so refined and complex, offering flavors of Meyer lemons, Kaffir limes, brioche and smoky vanilla that change endlessly in the glass. Just fabulous, and a terrifically versatile food wine.
title: Iron Horse 2002 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A gorgeous sparkling wine that shows real Champagne quality in its dryness and creamy, yeasty complexity. Made from 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, it flatters the palate with lush flavors of raspberries, oranges, limes, pears, brioche, vanilla and cinnamon honey. Delicious and compelling now, this rich bubbly should develop additional bottle complexity over the next decade.
title: Schramsberg 2001 Reserve Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: Has a pretty copper-partridge color and is very dry, with crisp, mouthwatering acidity and a yeasty, leesy tartness. Flavorwise, this bubbly is about subtle raspberries, cherry skin, tangerine, brioche and vanilla. Feels a bit full-bodied and juvenile now. The suggestion is ageability. Try after 2012, if you can properly cellar.
title: Schramsberg 2000 J. Schram Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: A great California bubbly, right up at the top. It's unusual for a sparkling wine house to hold back their basic vintage brut this long, but J did, and consumers benefit. The wine has some bottle age, and is softly picking up nutty, dried fruit, floral and yeasty notes. Enormously complex, it should continue to develop for many years.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2000 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Pretty much as gorgeous as California bubbly gets. It's dry and yeasty and rich in citrus, peach and apple flavors, with an enormously fine structure. Feels smooth as silk, clean as a whistle, with a delicate but complex mousse. Young and vibrant, with mouthwatering acidity, this Champagne-like brut should develop bottle complexity through 2013, at least.
title: Schramsberg 2001 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Available in magnum only, this is an occasional bottling from the winery. A winery spokeperson told me my bottle was entirely 1993 vintage, but not all other bottles are. The wine is extraordinarily fine, but compared to other California bubblies, it's sandpapery and almost harsh at this point. As it warms up in the glass it shows an immense toasted nut and grilled fruit richness with an impossibly long finish. This is one to stash for the long haul.
title: Iron Horse NV Joy! Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A fresh and slightly lean sparkling wine with a lightly toasty vanilla nose and flavors of grapefruit and apple. Crisp on the palate but with enough complexity for food pairing, the wine ends with a clean, citric finish. Friendly and delicate.
title: Château Frank 2000 Estate Bottled Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: This is a beautiful brut, easily worth its price. It shows the fancy elegance of more expensive bubblies, with its refined texture and rich but subtle flavors of strawberries, peaches and brioche. Made from Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and easy to find, with 25,000 cases produced.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: The Wedding Cuvée is one of Iron Horse's sweeter bubblies, but it's not a sweet wine. It's soft, creamy and delicious. Brimming with flavors of green apples, strawberries, brioche and pepper, it continues the winery's brilliant tradition of crafting some of the finest sparkling wines in California.
title: Iron Horse 2005 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Fully ready to drink now, this dry brut shows the classy elegance of a fine Champagne. The Chardonnay contributes white peaches and apples, while Pinot adds a subtle note of cherries with spicy, yeasty nuances. At 80,000 cases, it's a notable achievement.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Very fine, a smooth, silky wine with an elegant mousse, or quality of bubbles. It's pretty full-bodied, with subtle raspberry, peach, vanilla and brioche flavors. Easily the most complex and interesting of Chandon's lineup of sparklers.
title: Chandon NV Etoile Rosé Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: A luscious and superior California bubbly, this blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay shows an irresistable richness of raspberry purée, cherry skin bitterness, vanilla, yeasty baked bread and something unidentifiably smoky-sweet. Yet it's bone dry. With a long, complex finish, it should continue to age beyond this, its tenth birthday.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1998 Carneros Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Royal Cuvée is usually Gloria Ferrer's best bubbly, and so it is with this bottling, a worthy followup to the past several vintages. Very finely structured, it shows appealing flavors of cherries, citrus fruits and vanilla, and is so rich, it's almost like a table wine. Addictively good now. Watch it change as it warms in the glass.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2001 Royal Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This is the best of Laetitia's current sparklers. It's the smoothest and finest in texture, with a mouthfeel that's all silk and satin. The flavors, of raspberries, limes, smoky vanilla and yeast, are similar to the winery's other bottlings, but the fine smoothness shoots the point score up. Now through 2012.
title: Laetitia 2004 Cuvée M Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This complex sparkling wine was held back on the lees in the bottle for nearly a decade, which is the meaning of late disgorged. Tasted beside J's 2000 Vintage Brut, it's not as immediately luscious or delicate, having a more scoury edge, although the flavors are similar. The impression is one of ageability. Try holding until after 2010.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 1998 Late Disgorged Vintage Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: An unusual, but very good, bubbly. Made from Pinot Noir and with the color of the first blush of a peach, it offers a blast of cherry, raspberry and vanilla flavors that finish dry, long and clean.
title: Chandon NV Pinot Noir Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Made with a higher dosage, or sweetness level, than Iron Horse's other bubblies, the '03 Russian Cuvée is seriously delicious. It has honeyed lime, raspberry and smoky, baked bread dough flavors, with a tangy taste of green apple peel.
title: Iron Horse 2003 Russian Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: With mid-summer comes the annual release of J's nonvintage Cuvée 20. This year's bottling is richer than last year's, and offers broad citrus, raspberry, vanilla and yeasty brioche flavors. The wine feels clean, vibrant and smooth.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuvée 20 Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A very good Chardonnay-based sparkler, dry and rich in vanilla, peach and lime flavors, with exotic notes of grilled pineapple and fresh brioche. Feels clean and delicious, and should develop for a few years.
title: Laetitia 2005 Brut de Blancs Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Made from Pinot Noir, this is a dry, crisply elegant and full-bodied bubbly. You'll detect a sweetly ripe, mashed red cherry background to the yeast and vanilla flavors. Drink now through 2010.
title: Laetitia 2005 Brut de Noirs Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Full-bodied and rich, this slightly orange-colored bubbly offers forward flavors of cherry vanilla and Chardonnay with mashed ripe strawberries. It's very good, an addictively drinkable bubbly that finishes clean, dry and yeasty.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Compared to Roederer's current nonvintage bubblies, this one's tight and not as likeable. It has an almost rustic scoury feeling. But it's very rich in cherries, raspberries, white peaches and yeasty, leesy influences, and probably needs time in the bottle. Try after 2010.
title: Roederer Estate 2002 L'Ermitage Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Made from 100% Chardonnay, this sparkler is just delicious, a versatile wine to have by itself, with savories, sushi or the most elegant meals. Crisp and balanced, it has rich flavors of pineapples, peach jam, brioche and vanilla, with a smoky edge.
title: Schramsberg 2005 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: Gloria Ferrer's 2005 dry Chardonnay and Pinot Noir were both really good, so why shouldn't this bubbly blend of them be? And so it is. Rich in raspberry, lime, vanilla cream, yeast and cinnamon spice flavors, it has a complex, silky texture, with very fine bubbles. Drink now.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2005 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A bit more full-bodied than Chandon's brut, this gold-colored bubbly has fine flavors of cherries and smoky vanilla. A beautiful wine for sushi.
title: Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Full-bodied and a little forwardly sweet, this deeply colored blush bubbly has flavors of raspberries and cherries, accented with smoky yeast, vanilla cookie and peppery spice. Drink now through 2010.
title: Laetitia 2005 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: With a pretty peach-blush color, this shows a fine balance, as the crisp acidity tones down the forward fruit flavors. The dosage gives a honeyed edge to the strawberry, cherryskin, peach, green apple, crème brûlée and brioche flavors.
title: Schramsberg 2005 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Mostly Pinot Noir, with some Chardonnay, this rich, crisp bubbly has forward flavors of strawberries, raspberries, tangerines, vanilla and yeasty smoke. It's quite dry and at its best now.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Made largely from Pinot Noir, this bubbly has rich flavors of cherries, yeast and smoke. Ten percent Chardonnay adds a lemony brightness. Drink now.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Australia has sparkling Shiraz, and now California has this ruby-colored, full-bodied sparkling wine, made from Pinot Noir. It shows Champagne-like bubbles and yeastiness, and is dry, but the flavors of cherries and black raspberries are entirely unique.
title: Schug 2005 Rouge de Noirs Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Here's a fine everyday bubbly, not too expensive, but showing finesse and elegance. Has appealing, slightly sweet flavors of limes, vanilla, roasted hazelnuts and yeast.
title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A bit rough and scoury. Offers pleasantly rich waves of vanilla wafer, lime, Meyer lemon, leesy yeast and sweet smoky oak flavor, with a dry, crisply clean finish.
title: Laetitia 2004 Brut Coquard Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Iron Horse's '03 Classic Vintage Brut is very high in acidity, giving it a scoury, sharp bite that cuts into the palate. It's also very dry, making for a certain austerity. Flavorwise, you'll find suggestions of mashed peach, apricot, raspberry, mineral and brioche.
title: Iron Horse 2003 Classic Vintage Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Tastes like Chardonnay with bubbles and yeast. With a slightly sweet finish, this bubbly has flavors of limes, green apples and lees.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay (California)

description: Good price for a bubbly of this quality. Shows a nice spectrum of citrus, yeast and strawberry flavors that finish dry, crisp and clean, if a little rough. Drink now.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: A good, rich bubbly, elegant and easy to drink, with a scoury texture framing flavors of limes, brioche and vanilla. Drink now.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2004 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Actually a little on the sweet side, this pleasant brut-style wine has rich flavors of limes, peaches, vanilla and spice, with a bracing scour of bubbles.
title: Korbel NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)

description: Full-bodied for a bubbly and slightly sweet, with forward flavors of cherries, strawberries, vanilla and brioche. Balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: Made from 90% Pinot Noir with the balance Chardonnay, this beautifully colored bubbly shows the integrity the house of Schramsberg brings to its sparkling wines. It's not truly dry, but the raspberry, cherry, lime, vanilla and brioche flavors are delicious.
title: Schramsberg 2005 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: Rustic and rough in the mouth, but shows basic Champagne-style dryness and yeastiness, with pleasant citrus flavors. Good price for an everyday sparkler.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: A little sweet and one-dimensional, with candied flavors of raspberries and limes.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: This cuvée is 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay, and the nose leaps out with vanilla wafer, yeast and toasted nuts. It has the extra fruit power of domestic bubbly, and lacks the finesse of real Champagne. Yeasty and round, it finishes a bit short with a hint of plastic. But at this price point it's a wine to savor, that brings a lot of enjoyment to the table.
title: Domaine Meriwether NV Discovery Cuvée Sparkling Wine Sparkling (Oregon)

description: This Oregon sparkler is lovely to look at, a pale pink with a tiny bead. It's scented with caramel and meringue, and tastes lightly of cherry soda. In the mouth it is light and creamy, with delicate, candy-like flavors that quickly fade.
title: Domaine Meriwether 1999 Prestige Rosé Cuvée Sparkling (Oregon)

description: Nothing but tons of pure Chardonnay flavor in this unoaked wine. It brims with pear, peach, pineapple, green apple, passionfruit and honey flavors that are brightened with citrusy acidity.
title: Iron Horse 2006 UnOaked Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: This is something you're not likely to see every day—a 10-year-old sparkling wine made from 100% Pinot Gris. Lacks the finesse and minerality of those Alsatian sparkling wines, but the flavors have been smoothed out over the years, and a pleasing toasty streak has crept into the tart pear skin fruit.
title: Duck Pond 1996 Sparkling Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: A disappointing sparkler, too powerful in fruity flavor for the delicacy and restraint a good bubbly requires. The structure of acidity and low alcohol is just fine. The problem is that the raspberry, lime and vanilla flavors are overpowering.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2006 L'Homme qui ris Sparkling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made primarily from Pinot Noir with a little Chardonnay, this has a subtle color of the first blush on a peach, and is fragrant and delicious. The fruit flavors of raspberries and cherries have a lime tinge, and the finish is dry and impressively long. Really easy to like, just filled with charm and finesse.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2004 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A brut-style Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend, this sparkler is really good, and easily worth its relatively modest cost. It drinks rich and fine, with an elegant, dry structure framing complex, honeyed flavors of strawberries, limes, vanilla, leesy yeast and smoke. Will easily stand aging through 2010.
title: Mumm Napa 2001 Grand Année Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This is an absolutely first-rate bubbly, dry, smooth and rich. Has complex flavors of peaches, limes and strawberries, accented by doughy yeast and smoky flavors. Really defines the balanced elegance and pedigree you want in a great sparkler.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Iron Horse's Brut Rosé is always a compellingly rich, full-bodied, fun and delicious wine, and the '03 is their best ever. It captivates with raspberry and cherry flavors, slightly liquored, with smoky char and lees nuances, and possesses fresh, vital acids. One-fifth Chardonnay adds a citrusy brightness. Try with sushi or ahi tuna tartare.
title: Iron Horse 2003 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: A delicious sparkler; shows the delicacy and elegance of a blanc de blancs at its California best. The Chardonnay contributes subtle peach and citrus   flavors, and the mousse, or bubbly mouthfeel, is very refined. Should age well. Drink now–2009, at least.
title: Domaine Carneros 2001 Le Rêve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Royal Cuvée has turned into one of the most consistent buys in an upscale California bubbly, mainly due to the elegance that always marks the wine. The 2000, which is a classic blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, shows the smoothness and complexity that mark fine sparkling wine, with subtle citrus, peach, raspberry, brioche and smoky vanilla flavors.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2000 Royal Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This has picked up softness and a honeyed mouthfeel, as the chemistry of aging on the lees does its magic. The wine has a plush, creamy feeling, with the silky smoothness of a great sparkling wine. Flavorwise, it's all pears, limes, dough and cinnamon spice. Delicious now, and should hold and improve over the next eight years.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 1997 Late Disgorged Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Released after five years on the yeast, this is still a young, tartly aggressive bubbly. It is in fact by far the most acidic of Iron Horse's current stable of superb bubblies. But it's enormously rich, offering a wealth of subtle lime, peach, strawberry, toast and sourdough bread flavors that impress with both depth and length, as well as sheer class. Wonderful now, and should age effortlessly for six to eight years.
title: Iron Horse 2001 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Always one of the top sparklers in California, L'Ermitage defines the rigorous selection that marks the best vintage-dated, ageworthy wines. The 2000 is about 50-50 Chardonnay and Pinot, and is very rich and flavorful in yeast, smoke, strawberry, citrus and vanilla flavors, but it's also a very young wine, tight and minerally. It wants bottle age. Should begin to fantail out by the end of 2007 and continue to develop for 4 to 6 years, if not longer.
title: Roederer Estate 2000 L'Ermitage Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: An hommage to the winery's late, great winemaker, Guy Devaux, Mumm's vintage-dated DVX is their tête de cuvée, a selection of the finest lots of grapes which are then given white glove treatment. The 2000 is a worthy successor to its predecessors, rich, smooth and dramatic. It has the silky finesse of great Champagne, with charming lime, raspberry, vanilla and smoky dough flavors. Should age well. Drink now–2010.
title: Mumm Napa 2000 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Right up there with the recent string of fabulous têtes de cuvées, the 2000 shows the concentration, power and subtlety of this, the winery's top release. A blend of Chardonnay with 20% Pinot Noir, it shows exotic and complex flavors of tangerines and raspberries, candied ginger, coconut macaroons, baked bread and yeast. It's delicious now, but all the parts haven't come together. Hold until mid-2008 through 2010, but could go well beyond that.
title: Schramsberg 2000 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This is the winery's most expensive bottling, a late disgorged bubbly that has now seen a decade of age. It shows the elegant polish of the '97 Royal Cuvée, but is superior even to it in richness. The creamy smoothness is the star attraction, but so are the subtle citrus, raspberry, brioche and vanilla flavors. Impeccably dry balance guarantees that this beautiful brut will age effortlessly for 10 years, if not longer.
title: Gloria Ferrer 1997 Carneros Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This sugary-sweet, frizzante-style sparkler is the sort of wine your grandmother might enjoy. It tastes like orange soda, only with 11% alcohol for a little extra kick in the back of the throat.
title: Bridgeview 2006 Semi-Sparkling Muscat (Southern Oregon)

description: This lovely brut offers real Champagne-like finesse. It's rich and dry, with yeasty flavors of pineapples, lemon chiffon and raspberries. The mousse is creamy and smooth. This polished bubbly will develop with five years of cellaring.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: Rewards for its rich Champagne personality and California expression of fruity flavor. Although the texture could be a bit smoother, the wine has a fine mousse, with complex, subtle flavors of strawberries, limes, vanilla, yeasty dough and wood smoke.
title: Mumm Napa NV Reserve Brut Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: As the name implies, this is an enormously likeable sparkler, based primarily on Pinot Noir and showing that grape's sensual texture. With raspberry, strawberry, lime, vanilla and smoky yeast flavors, it's irresistibly good.
title: Iron Horse 2004 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Mostly Pinot Noir with some Chardonnay, this bubbly shows the pedigree of these two noble varieties in its balance and elegance. It has rich Champagne-like flavors of smoke, brioche, raspberry, lime and vanilla, and finishes dry and polished. This is a great price for a sparkling wine of this quality and sophistication.
title: Mumm Napa NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Made entirely from Chardonnay, this is the most elegant and delicate of the winery's current bubblies. It's a dry, sophisticated wine, with subtle citrus, peach, apple and yeast flavors. If you've never cellared a sparkling wine, try stashing this away for up to a decade.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2003 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This bubbly charms with cherry and raspberry flavors and a touch of limes and vanilla. It's nice and smooth in the mouth, with a creamy mousse. Showing real finesse and elegance, this sparkler will be delicious with raw tuna.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: From the pretty pale, amber color to the long, distinguished finish, this is a great rosé sparkler. To begin with, it's dry, a point in its favor, while the flavors are subtle and complex. They suggest pink grapefruits, tangerine zest, a squeeze of white peach, vanilla, and the smoke and dough of oak and lees. With its low alcohol and very low pH, it's a balanced wine of great structural integrity.
title: Roederer Estate NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: This has subtle flavors of strawberries, limes, dough and vanilla smoke. It's a little rough in the mouth, with a scoury texture, but it's a good buy at this price.
title: Piper Sonoma NV Select Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Nearly all Pinot Noir, with just 15% Chardonnay, this full-bodied sparkler has raspberry and cherry liqueur flavors that finish with a dose of sweet honey. Very high acidity brings needed balance to this rich wine, but it does seem like it could finish a little drier.
title: Schramsberg 2004 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma)

description: The flavors are pure and delicious, suggesting jasmine tea, strawberries, citrus fruits, rose-hip tea, smoky dough and cinnamon. Dry, clean and elegant; the mouthfeel could be a little smoother, though.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A nice bubbly that's mainly Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. It shows Champagne flavors suggesting citrus fruits, pears, strawberries and bread, with crisp acidity making the finish clean. The mouthfeel is a little rough and scoury.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 1999 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: This is Schramsberg's sweet sparkler, although it's not terribly sweet; it only suggests a touch of honeyed caramel cream, peach-vanilla frappuccino and gingerbread. Crisp acidity helps to balance. Made mainly from the rare Flora grape, which is a cross between Sémillon and Gewürztraminer.
title: Schramsberg 2004 Crémant Demi-sec Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma)

description: For those who like their sparkling wines a little sweet. This Pinot Noir-Chardonnay blend has the highest dose of residual sugar of all Iron Horse's bubblies, and it shows in the jellied flavors of raspberries, strawberries and limes. Very crisp acidity provides needed balance and elegance.
title: Iron Horse 2002 Russian Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Made in a frankly sweet style, this blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay has jellied flavors of raspberries, cherries and toast. It's a little rough in texture.
title: Schramsberg NV Mirabelle Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: A little sweet, which makes the wine less subtle, this Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend has jammy raspberry, cherry and vanilla smoke flavors. The finish is very sweet.
title: Schramsberg 2004 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Off a beat from the great '03, closer to the '02, this is an elegant young sparkler, lacking a bit in finesse. This 100% Chardonnay has slightly sweet flavors of lemon candy and yeast.
title: Schramsberg 2004 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: This is the winery's sweet sparkling wine. It has the elegant structure, fine acidity and forward raspberry, strawberry, lime, vanilla and smoke flavors of the dry bruts, with a sugary finish, for those who like their bubblies on the sweet side.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This bubbly is rich in cherry and raspberry fruit, in addition to the usual sparkling wine notes of bread dough and smoke. It's a little sweet and scoury on the palate, but a fairly polished sparkler for this price.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: If Schramsberg's regular sparkling wines are too pricy for your budget, this second label is a nice alternative. It shows good brut sparkling wine character, with slightly sweet fruity, yeasty flavors and crisp acids that finish with elegance.
title: Schramsberg NV Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Simple and rough in texture, with medicinal citrus fruit and dough flavors.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Premium Extra Dry Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: Rough and scoury in the mouth, with citrus, vanilla, honey and bread dough flavors. Not bad for this price.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Cuvée Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: Rough and gritty in texture and overtly sweet in pineapple, orange, peach and bubble gum flavors, this everyday bubbly finishes clean and honeyed.
title: Ballatore NV Gran Spumante Sparkling (California)

description: True to its name, the wine is crimson in color, and sweet, with honeyed raspberry, cherry and vanilla flavors. Easy to drink due to the balanced sweetness.
title: Ballatore NV Rosso Red Spumante Sparkling (California)

description: A little rough in texture and sweet on the finish, this pineappley brut is okay for everyday purposes, but the residual sugar is really too high for balance, especially at this price.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuvée 20 Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Just delicious, a fascinating counterpoint to the winery's '01 Brut Chardonnay, with which it was coreleased. Shows a beautiful Pinotesque weight, with a cherried edge to the lime and yeast flavors. With a grand cru texture, this is really one of the best Chandon bubblies of recent memory.
title: Domaine Chandon NV Brut Pinot Noir (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Beautiful young bubbly, light and elegant, with Chardonnay flavors of peaches and limes, enriched with leesy dough and smoky spice. The texture is ultrarefined, with a very fine mousse. This is one of the best, most complex Chandon bruts in a long time.
title: Domaine Chandon 2001 Brut Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Lots of Champagne-like richness in this dry blend of Pinot Noir, Gamay, Sangiovese and Zinfandel. Despite these big red varieties, it has subtle, elegant flavors of strawberries, limes, yeast and vanilla.
title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: Basically a blanc de blancs, and a pretty nice one at that, despite a certain roughness of texture. It's dry and crisp, showing yeasty flavors of peaches, limes and vanilla.
title: Korbel NV Chardonnay Sparkling (California)

description: Delicious sparkling wine, dry, crisp and elegant. The bubbles are really tiny, giving the wine a silky mouthfeel, while the flavors are forward in raspberries and cherries, with a yeasty tang. As dry as the wine is, it shows a rich vein of honey on the finish. Drink now through 2010.
title: Mumm Napa 2001 DVX Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Just about half Chardonnay and half Pinot Noir, with a touch of Pinot Meunier, this fruit-forward bubbly  tastes sweet, even by California sparkling wine standards. It's almost what the French call demi-sec, with sugared lemon mousse and raspberry-vanilla cream flavors.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2002 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Yes, it's sparkling Syrah, made famous by the Aussies. As dark as a red wine, it's so deliciously aromatic in cherry pie, chocolate fudge and caramel scents, it makes your mouth water. Once in that mouth, it has the dry effervescence of a sparkling wine, with the weight of, well, Syrah. A curiosity, but a good one.
title: Steele 2003 Black Bubbles Syrah Syrah (Lake County)

description: Absolutely, compulsively delicious. Totally a California-style bubbly, it's dazzlingly rich in cherry, raspberry, brioche, vanilla and spice flavors, with crisply sharp acids for balance, and a satisfying dosage for softness. Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc.
title: Laetitia NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Mainly Pinot Noir, with 15% Chardonnay, this pale pink bubbly is impressive for ripe raspberry-cherry flavors, with a polished edge of bread dough and smoky vanilla. It's quite a delicious rosé sparkler, finishing dry and elegant.
title: Mumm Napa NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This is quite a good sparkler; a great price especially for a Chard-Pinot Noir blend from a major appellation that has spent eight years on the lees. Dry and creamy, it has mouthfilling, yeasty, raspberry-strawberry and vanilla-spice flavors, boosted with a honeyed dosage.
title: Cameron Hughes 1998 Lot 25 Sparkling Wine Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Another year, another near-perfect brut rosé from Korbel. So dry and balanced, so layered, with yummy raspberry, vanilla, smoke and yeasty dough flavors, it's just irresistable.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: Almost 100% Chardonnay, this bubbly shows a gorgeous elegance and dry sophistication. It's all taffeta and silk, so light and airy, so drinkable. With subtle hints of lime custard, bread dough, lees and vanilla, it's one of the best blanc de blancs of this year. Drink now through 2010.
title: Domaine Carneros 2000 Le Rêve Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This 100% Chardonnay is easily the best Schramsberg blanc de blancs to date. It's so rich and luxurious in subtle lime, peach and brioche flavors, and so refined in its beautiful silky mouthfeel, and so long in the finish, you can't help but love it. Gorgeous now, and should hold and even improve for the next six to eight years.
title: Schramsberg 2003 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Not the winery's best bubbly, as it's on the rough, sandpapery side. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, it has cherry, yeast and smoky vanilla flavors, and finishes dry.
designation: Cuvée de la Pompadour Brut Rosé
title: Domaine Carneros NV Cuvée de la Pompadour Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: The winery's brut has been a remarkably consistent wine over many years, offering plenty of real Champagne quality at a relatively affordable price. The '03 is dry, crisp and clean, with a fine, silky mouthfeel. It's also subtle, with suggestions of limes, cherries, brioche and toast.
title: Domaine Carneros 2003 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)
